Reviews: My doctor switched me to Lo Lo Estrin Fe after taking me off of Beyaz. I had previously been on Yaz/Beyaz for 5 years and never had any side effects and they worked great. I was taken off due to the high incidence of blood clots. I have been on Lo Lo Estrin since the end of August and have not had a period. No spotting, nothing and I am not pregnant. I would rather have my period each month for reassurance. I also experienced severe acne on my chin, a normal breakout spot for me. This acne is the worst I have ever experienced and took forever to clear up. I also had light breakouts on my chest and back which are not normal for me. I also continuously have had discomfort or a general crampiness over my left ovary for a couple of weeks. The discomfort was also on the left side of my low back. My doctor said it could possibly be cysts. Just a very annoying pill to be on. I was recently switched to something else and hope to have a better experience.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: While first taking the pill, the first couple months I was very moody and emotional, but I rarely had my period which I liked. After the first two months my mood became better and I loved the pill- no weight gain, acne, nothing terrible. After I refilled my prescription and started taking it again, I started to break out in rashes all over my body a couple hours after taking the pill. After three weeks of investigating what I could possibly be breaking out from, I stopped taking the pill and my severe rash went away. Other then my own reaction to it, I loved the pill-unfortunately had to switch

Reviews: I had a tubal ligation which causes a hormone imbalance with hair loss, irregular periods & heavy bleeding, acne with one huge pimple every two weeks. I've been on this pill two weeks and I feel bloated all the time and my face first cleared up and now is broken out in a rash and very small pimples all over. The only plus - I lost 2 pounds and my hair stopped falling out.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
GOOD: No periods, 10 pounds lost.
BAD: Breaking out, skin has lost it's glow, yeast infections

I'm 33 and have suffered from abnormally long and heavy periods(up to 3 weeks long, talk about being depressed) for the last 13 years. I have tried multiple hormone and birth control pills, even tried the bio-identicals and nothing worked. I had been to multiple doctors in the NYC area and none of them could figure out what was going on. 10 months ago my doctor suggested taking Lo Loestrin Fe since it had a very low dose of estrogen, 10mcg. The first 2 months I spotted and was emotionally a little off but I can happily say I have not had a period since and since I've suffered with constant periods for the last 13 years I welcomed NO PERIODS! Besides being able to have a normal sex life again, I lost 10 pounds. All of the bloating and sugar cravings went away. I used to wake up in the morning thinking about what I was going to eat for breakfast, lunch, dinner and now I'm not thinking about food all day long. I also feel like my metabolism has revved up. I can still eat my ice cream and have my snacks but it doesn't stick to my thighs like it used to. It has been a wonderful change. The only downside is my skin has lost it's glow and I'm constantly breaking out. In the past I maybe had 1 breakout a year now the minute 1 pimple goes away 2 more pop out. I also started getting yeast infections, 1 every couple of months. Starting in January I'm going to switch to the Loestrin 20 which has 20mcg of estrogen and see if that helps with my skin and hopefully keep periods light. Good Luck!!!!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have only been on this pill for 2wks. I began taking it the day my period started.  I have been bleeding and spotting ever since.  I have alot of mood swings and nausea every single day.  I will give it the rest of the month. If I don't feel any better its bye bye Lo Lo.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on Lo Loestrin for two weeks now. I was previously taking Levora and was put on BC because I had heavy bleeding to the point of an iron IV and dangerously low blood count. The Levora kept me constantly bleeding (low bleeding) everyday for a full year, extremly irrating. My new GYN-O put me on Lo Loestrin and my period has stopped completely at the moment, so for me it is absolute happiness.  I must say I have experienced an increased hunger and some nausea but no mood swings to date. I too thought I was pregnant so I'm relieved to hear that is probably not the case. I am contemplating surgery to remove my uterus so this is a temp fix until then but the absense of my period has been blissful!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: My 15 yr old daughter was on this for over a year due to excessive bleeding/cramps.  It is expensive and she is prone to acne and it made the acne worse despite being on acne meds.  She was also moody, everything annoyed her and she gained about 15-20 lbs despite being an athlete.  She was always hungry.  It took several months before the spotting regulated.  Also if she was just a few hours late taking a pill she would begin spotting right away.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: The first month I got my period same time as usual, didn't last any longer than normal(I got it in the third week of the pack). The second month, I got it half-way through the second week, and had a lot of trouble stopping. It lasted about 7-10 days. Currently on the third month, will see if it does any better. Other negatives: I have broken out severely with acne, have a lot of cramping, and have experienced a lot of vaginal irritation. Positives: I bleed much lighter than I used to but for a longer time period. Also, stabilized my blood sugars around that time of the month. Probably going to go off this pill with my follow-up visit.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on this pill for 2 weeks now and have experienced almost every side effect listed: insomnia, stomach pain, nausea all day long, vomiting, skin problems, but most of all terrible mood swings and anger. Crying and feeling constantly misunderstood. Spotting. I will get off this pill as soon as I can. I rather have bad periods than deal with these side effects. I was told that it "might" get better, but I cannot live like this for 3 months hoping it changes.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I am on my third month and love this pill. I have had a tubal and started taking this pill to stop bleeding. I was bleeding for 7 weeks and by the 3rd month of taking this pill I no longer have a period. I am very satisfied. I have not had any other side effects other that slight sore breasts the first month since then it has passed.

Reviews: I was on this birth control for about a week to a week and a half and stopped because I couldn't take it.  I experienced heavy spotting to the point where I was soaking a maxipad every hour, as well as nausea, migraines, dizziness, and the worst cramps in the entire world.  I went to the doctor and she said that I had become anemic from all the blood loss, and put me on a bunch of medication.  I stopped taking it and tried Ortho Cyclen, and am so much happier now!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: To those of you just beginning with this pill, give it time.  I took it for over a year with no problems whatsoever, but had to come off because I could not afford it.  I then got back on and for the first month, I did spot for about 10 days, but now everything is back to "normal."  I do not get a period on this pill, my mild acne is gone, and oddly I have gained 3 pounds, though I do not attribute that all to this pill.  Please be patient and give the pill more than a month.  I have been on many versions of b/c pills and even had Depo... this pill is by far the best and mildest when it comes to side effects.  I just wish it was not so expensive.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I am getting older and my periods were lasting longer and longer, so my doctor thought it might be helpful to switch to Lo Loestrin.  I have been on it a month and a half. Haven't really stopped spotting and bleeding since.  I also have been extremely moody and snappy.  My abdomen is perpetually bloated (not just during PMS) and I have gained a few pounds.  I am not a fan of this pill.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been taking this pill for just a week, on top of the IUD Mirena. I have endometriosis, POS, PMDD and abnormal periods -- even with the IUD in for over 9 months I still have multiple periods in the same month. This pill has done the opposite for me than for most... I was having problems with mood swings, rage and irregular periods, and while I can't speak to what it has done for my cycle, having not finished a pack yet, I have to say that I've only experienced mild breast tenderness thus far. My mood is so stable and I feel even keel for the first time in years. I haven't felt that way in YEARS. I am very thankful this drug and perhaps those having major side effects should consider an additional method of BC.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

I can barely catch my breath. I'm a healthy person otherwise. I Don't care hoe heavy or painful my periods are I NEED TO GET OFF THIS MEDICATION ASAP.

Reviews: I have been on LoLoestrin FE for three months. My first month was fine. The second month I broke out with terrible acne, bad mood swings and crying spells, and my menstrual cycle stayed on for 12 days straight. My third month has been a little better except for the vaginal dryness. When I spoke to my gynecologist, he said that vaginal dryness and yeast infections are slightly common because the pill is secreted through the urine (didn't know that at first). Still, the cramps and heavy bleeding are gone.

Reviews: so i started B.C cause i needed to regualt myself. i have never in 14 yrs had a regular period.so i am on my 3rd pack and the 1st month a started taking it.. i started my period the 2nd week and had the heaviest period of my life for 14 days, with horrible crapming then stopped, then started back up again 9 days later and really, its a lot lighter, but i have now been flowing for 3 weeks with maybe a day here and there where i am not bleeding. on top of all that,, i have gained 15lbs, totally and horriby tired all the time and my sex drive hasn't been affected except the fact that my hole feels raw after i do have sex and it hurts like i have been having sex for days straight when i haven't..and so my period actually stopped 2 days ago after 3 weeks and then BAM i start again today (not heavy, but not spotting either). so in the end i am going to stop this Pill.,. i am miserable and i am tired of bleeding.. i am always uncomfortable.. but the only good thing is my boobs have filled out a bit more.. but i would rather have irregular periods, i felt fine then.. just the doc told me i was almost 30 and needed to start thinkin about getting regular.. screw that.. i think not

Reviews: I started taking this just over 3 months ago. I had a lot of headaches in the first 2 months. I have gained about 5 lbs. I'm hungrier now for no good reason. My boobs grew (I'm a DD, I don't want bigger boobs!), too. I'm squeezing into my bra, barely. I went from being a happily sexualized woman to "meh, not feeling it". My sex drive is gone. Gone. The worst? The acne. Big, cystic, deep acne. It popped up during month 1 and has remained ever since. And I'm used to having clear skin with only an occasional blemish. Not these big painful ugly knots on my face. Typically, I'm keeping around 4 of these knots at all times. When 1 goes, another pops up elsewhere. I started taking this because as I'm getting older (I'm 39), my periods are getting closer & closer together (like every 17-20 days), and the flo is ridiculously heavy at least 1 of the days of my period (as in, I better stay at home or else an accident WILL happen). I swear, I think I'm gonna go back to that. At least it's just suffering a few times a month instead of being fatter, huge boobs, biz zits all over my face & leaving my hubby feeling like I don't love or want him anymore. This is stupid.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: From the first month I began taking Lutera three years ago, it began working the way I had hoped.  I have not experienced ANY side effects.  My pharmacy switched me to another generic (supposedly same meds) and I had side effects that required medical intervention.  Switched back to Lutera and the side effects disappeared.  If I am off of Lutera for a month for one reason or another, all the problems with my cycle return and I am reminded of what a great job Lutera does!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: After having a 2year long period my doctor decided that this pill will be her last attempt to get me to stop bleeding before sending me to someone else. The first day i took it i stopped bleed =) i couldnt believe it, something worked!! then after 2 weeks it started again, but not that bad lasted  week and a half and went off, for about another week and from then on it wasnt normal just very light spotting everyday(pinkish) but i was still happy that it wasnt the heavy pouring bleeding i was used to. after the third month i stopped taking it because thr heaving bleeding started again passing clots the size of my fist (and was painful too) doctors are running all kinds of test and i have a second specialist try also. i didnt have any side effects, lost alot of weight while on it and even noticed my hair growth!   i guess after bleeding for two years straight i was happy that it stopped the bleeding even if it didnt last long... not the best... but was def the best i had tried.

Reviews: I've only been on this BC for about a month now but so far I have been extremely satisfied with it; however, I am experiencing bleeding and spotting in between my period time which is fairly annoying. This so far has been my only complaint as I was previously on Mononessa which cause me to have extreme symptoms such as weight gain, tender breasts, nausea and vomiting constantly, I felt like I was pregnant even though I wasn't having sex, and mood swings. I would recommend Lutera for a friend.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: So I've been on Lutera for about 6 years now. We've had a love-hate relationship, but mostly love. There will be side effects to any bc due to hormonal changes. Your body needs to adjust to the transition, give it time. Over the years, I have had cramping, acne, and moodiness on and off. However, the benefits outweigh these minor setbacks. I started on Lutera because of heavy, long-lasting periods and eventually needed it for birth control. I have been sexually active for the past 4 years and have had no scares.   Overall, Lutera is very reliable if you can tough it out through the transition period.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Dear reviewers:  I was on Sprintec but the pharmacy only had the generic of Mononessa.  I always had breakthrough bleeding and very moody but periods were very light.  I didn't like the bleeding so my doctor just put me on Lutera so we will see.  I'm not really understanding most of your comments.  More hormones means more side effects.  Lutera is a lesser dose than most so should have less side effects.  It's common sense.  I would think that maybe your acne or moodiness could be related to something else.  But, I am open to seeing what happens.  Maybe I will eat my words.

Reviews: This BC has been very effective in regulating my periods. Before taking any birth control, I never knew when my period was coming, I would bleed between 7-14 days, the bleeding was extremely heavy (couldn't change tampons fast enough), and the pain was unbearable. With Lutera, my period now, after over 2yrs of use, only lasts from the last Thur-Sat of my pack and the pain has also significantly decreased. I do get headaches more frequently during the placebo week. I used a different BC prior to Lutera and it did not help at all. Once I started Lutera, it was SUCH A RELIEF!! Don't have many side effects, but they are worth the shorter, lighter periods and less pain.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Looking forward to seeing how spotting diminishes over time.

Reviews: I am 44 have been on pills for years to prevent ovarian cysts.  This pill stopped breakthrough bleeding but severely changed my blood pressure/heart rate,gained 1 pound per week, & had crazy mood swings.  My normal bp is 114/70ish, my weight has been the same for about 8 years & am pretty easy going. The only change was this pill...I switched to microgestin & all is normal again.  Get off this pill right away if you are having these symptoms...this is my 1st review in an attempt to help others.

Drug: levonorgestrel-eth estradiol tablet, dose pack, 3 months contraceptives
Reviews: I took this because my periods were very unpredictable and painful, and this has completely taken care of this. I can expect exactly when my period will start, and I have little to no cramps anymore. My bleeding lightened, and so has my acne as an added bonus. I cannot speak for the pregnancy prevention, as I do not use it for that. This is the first form of birth control that I have tried, and have had no bad side affects other than having to remember when to take the pill! Beginning this prescription is one of the best things I have ever done.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been on Lessina for a little over a year to correct my non stop, year round, just painful period. When I first started Lessina I gained 20 pounds but I lost 30 pounds after 4 months. With taking Lessina have problems with nausea, vomiting, abdominal cramps, moodiness and dizziness through out the day not just after I take the pill. Another side effect I have that they don't list is sensitive smell almost like a pregnant woman would have which enhances the nausea and vomiting. I also have breast tenderness and sometimes vaginal itch. It doesn't always happen all at once or everyday and happens more the week before my period. If I mess up taking the pills (missing a pill and having to double it up) causes me to get really sick as if I started Lessina for the first time. My periods leveled out and are now shorter. Lessina didn't do anything for break outs but didn't cause me any.

Reviews: I gained 20 lbs from this pill!!! I started to get an upset stomach after everything I drank or ate and just wanted to sleep the pain off. I felt nauseua and my organs began to hurt, like someone was taking turns squeezing my kidneys, liver and intestines one at a time, alternating what to squeeze. I've never felt so much pain and wasn't sure what was going on. I had a colonoscopy, an endoscopy, a CT scan, ultrasound and obgyn screen, on top of countless blood tests. Nothing came back on any of my tests. I stopped taking leena to prep for my CT scan and 3 weeks later I felt 100% better! I told my doctors but they didn't believe me. If you are taking leena and feel like your health is declining, stop taking it for a month and see if you feel better!

I was diagnosed with extensive bilateral pulmonary embolisms. I'm an otherwise healthy 25 year old. While hospitalized for 10 days I was tested for all sorts of genetic conditions that would predispose me to blood clots, all came back negative. So the doctors are saying it was this medication. Definitely would not take again.

Reviews: I took this pill for a long time and never realized the side effects. I even saw a psychiatrist thinking something bad was happening to me. I tried several different meds but nothing helped. So, I stopped taking all meds including the pill. I felt great, positive and full of energy. I still wanted to regulate my period and not get pregnant. So, I thought I'd try the pill again. But, I noticed severe fatigue after one week of taking this pill. I fall asleep on the couch for at least two hours in the middle of the day. I also noticed that I become angry very easily and feel extremely hot for no good reason. I lash out at people and have very negative thoughts. I get a sharp pain in my uterus occasionally. I feel depressed, sad, and paranoid. My period is lighter but I spot bleed even when I take the pill on time. I am not taking this pill anymore and I feel back to normal. I would advise against using this pill.

When I started Sprentec, I was on my period for the first whole month, and then every two weeks after that. But with Nortel, , I had my period the first two weeks and then now about every 5-6 weeks and it'?s not nearly as heavy or long. For the first month, I did experience some bad effects of it like everyone else but since then everything has improved. Clear skin, I‚Äôve  gained weight (but that was a goal for me), no headaches or hair loss, breasts grew, sex drive is fine, I haven‚Äôt experienced dryness like other users, cramps barely happen, so I think it's? great to me. Then again, everyone's?? body is different so everyone isn't? going to have the same exact side effects.

By the second week of taking it I began vomiting from being so nauseous. Same thing on Christmas morning. I felt nauseous after taking the pill and went and threw up. The first time I got my period while taking this pill, it lasted for a whole month. It didn√¢??t lighten my period at all, and it made my cramps worse. It decreased my sex drive, made me gain A TON of weight, made me breakout, and put me in an awful mood all the time. Reviews:
While in this drug, I experienced weight gain of 30+ pounds, very difficult to lose now. I also experienced higher cholesterol (I never had a problem with it before).
Loss of libido was a big problem too. It's great to have shorter periods but losing libido was taking a toll in my relationship. I had no interest at all in intimacy. 
I felt miserable! I felt the person in the mirror was not who I was and my husband was thinking I didn't love him any more. I tried several different diets with no success. I eat 1200 calories a day and didn't lose a pound.
I talked to my Doctor about changing the drug,but he thought the drug was not the culprit. I decided I had to stop it, and basically told my Doctor I was not taking it anymore.
I stopped taking it and within 20 days libido came back and I started to lose weight already!
Talk to your Doctor if you think any drug is making changes to your health. Trust yourself! we know ourselves better than anybody else. We can tell when something is wrong in our own body even if somebody else tells us different.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I am getting ready to start my 3rd month on this particular birth control. I tried Loestrin 24fe and did not respond well so we tried Nortrel 1/35. I haven't noticed any real side effects other than at times there seems to be an inability to achieve an orgasm. I haven't had any acne issues, not too much weight gain that I couldn't lose by watching what I eat. I have noticed increased irritability around my period and an increase in the intensity of the headaches I typically get with my period. My period went from 3 days of spotting / streaking + 4 days of heavy bleeding with awful cramps to 3 days of a moderate flow period that was easily contained with a super absorbency tampon as opposed to my previous use of Ultra absorbency AND a thick overnight pad. If the headaches continue, I will check with my doctor. That could be attributed to a lot of other things, but I noticed it within my first pack. Otherwise, I recommend giving this a try.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Within the first month of taking this pill I knew my body wasn't reacting well. My doctor insisted I tried it for 3 months before switching to a new one. This medicine made my periods heavier and I bleed almost every other week for 7 or more days until I start a new pack then it stops for about a week. During my heaviest days I have to change my pads every 30-45 minutes and sometimes more frequent than that and I still bleed through sometimes because it is so heavy. Also my blood has been significantly darker since starting this pill. I have gained so much weight even with diet and exercise. I get constant headaches, nausea, AND VERY BAD MOOD SWINGS! My sex drive has deminished. Another thing is this pill is very expensive and not covered by my insurance. This was my last month of trying it out and I have seen no changes. My mood swings were crazy to where I would fly off the handle at home over the simplest things.  My work was very stressful and high paced. Tried the samples I had received from my doctor and have been taking it ever since.  I had been diagnosed with fibroids which was contributing to the heavy bleeding. Reviews: I have been on Natazia for about a year and a half now, and it's been amazing. Before this pill I would get horrible cramping to the point where all I could do was curl up in a ball and shake uncontrollably in pain. My periods would last a min of 2 weeks, it was ridiculous. Natazia has been amazing. It took about 2 months before my peroid got a on steady cycle. I would get my period on a Thursday night, and it'd be done by Sunday afternoon. My period is no longer so heavy that I cant leave the house with a ton of backup pads & tampons. I still get a tiny bit of cramping the first 24 hours, but I mean it's a period...you have to expect some discomfort. I am no longer sick to my stomach during my period, and back pain is gone as well. I highly recommend this medication to any female out there that has long/heavy peroids with horrible cramping.

Reviews: I just started my 3rd pack of Natazia.  I kind of like it but I'm not sure it is the right one for me.  The first month everything was fine.  I got my period a day or two before the first white pill.  I bled on and off for a week.  It was extremely light (compared to what i'm used to experiencing).  My period ended and about a week later I started spotting on and off daily until it was time for my period again.  During my period this time, I am bleeding on and off.  I think that it's over and 12 hrs later it comes back.  I am not sure it's ever going to go away.  This has been happening daily since Sept. 22 and it is now Oct. 10th (spotting/period).  I like the pill because the bleeding is so light, I forget that i'm bleeding.  But I am frustrated because I am nervous to not wear a pad because my period/spotting shows up daily.  I want this pill to work for me.  I just started my third pack and I'm hoping that things will straighten out.

Reviews: I've just ended my third month on this pill and so far, I hate it. I know any new BCP takes a few months for your body to adjust, but I haven't had a period since I started-- the nurse I spoke to said this is normal, but it concerns me. I'll have bad cramps for a week or so at random times during my cycle, but no bleeding. Had HORRIBLE moodiness during first month (cried over everything). ZERO sex drive. I was on Ortho-Tri-Cyclen Lo for six years and can't remember ever having side effects, though the last six months I started having heavy bleeding again, which is why I switched. I would not recommend Natazia.

Reviews: Singly, the worst birth control I've used. I use BCs to handle my PCOS. This caused RAPID, EXTREME mood swings, vaginal discharge, itching and pain - changes to the texture and consistency of my vestibule & vulva and induced symptoms of vulvodynia. I strongly advise any doctor AGAINST prescribing this medication to any female.  Getting off this medication encouraged more mood swings and pain and migraines. I've not experienced anything like this before. Do NOT take this drug.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
This was my 5th combination birth control pill in 7 years after: Ortho, Trinessa, Trisprintec, and Portia.  I was put on the pill for a hormone imbalance, heavy periods, and pregnancy prevention.

Periods: Were 2 days at first, then stopped all together for 3rd and 4th month.

Spotting: anywhere from 6-10 days for first two months, then no spotting the last two.

Nausea: at least a week each month.

After 4 months, I have switched to another pill.  It was great for periods, but I couldn't stand the nausea.  I would give it a try if you have heavy periods, it could be the pill for you.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I'm probably the oldest person who has commented on the medication.  I am perimenopausal and have been using this to treat the symtoms.  One being irregular and heavy periods.  I have taken MANY BC pills -one by one I would experience breakthrough bleeding - then bleed HEAVILY for a week.  I was started on Natazia to have shorter and lighter "periods" during the time I would have a scheduled period (placebo pills).  

I have been on this medication for a year and 1/2 and unfortunately I can't say I have "regulated" yet!  

I will have several days of no spotting - then several days of spotting.  Sometimes my periods are two days - light.  And then sometimes - around the 3rd month I have a 12 day period!  Awful!  I will have begun the next pill pack - and I will still bleed into the second week of te pack. 

I will say - you MUST take this pill no more than 14 hours apart.  Try, try, try to not forget or skip or start your pill pack late.  Be very regimented!  

Still - I've done that and had a several day period. 

Yes - Acne.  For a while I didn't experience it - but now very bad on my chin.  Not all the time - it comes and goes. 

Breat tenderness - funny - I had not experience it at all - not much - then this past month they have been VERY tender and swollen (that's not a bad side effect!) 

I haven't had the headaches. (knock on wood!)

Mood swings...no more than usual. 

Still spotting...usually heavier spotting the last week before my "period" starts.  

I will say one thing no one has spoken about - odor.  When I was taking other pills  - when I would spot or have my period I would get that "period odor" - we all know how it goes.  

NO ODOR on this pill!!!  I read where it "alters the chemistry of the cervical mucus" - must be what is happening.  And that is a BIG plus for me.  I do NOT like to smell!!  

I will cont. to take.  Better than alternative which is Uterine ablation. Good Luck!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I took natazia continuously (skipped placebo) due to endometriosis for 3 years. I had no side effects severe enough to stop taking the pills. At first it did take a few months to completely stop my periods but after that it worked well for several years. I did have the occasional headache , breast tenderness, and some nausea but not severe. At the end of several years I did you end up switching only because I started to experience breakthrough bleeding. Since I have endometriosis it is recommended to not have any periods at all and therefore I am starting a new kind today, otherwise I never would have changed. I would recommend this product based on my personal experience.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on Natazia for almost a year now. I haven't been on b/c for over 10 years(husband had vasectomy) but my gyn recommended it due to long and very heavy periods.  So far it has corrected the problem.  It has also helped keep my weight lower and reduced my acne.  There is one major drawback that I've found, lack of sex drive!  At the beginning of the pack (pink pills) it's very high but the rest of the month it's almost non-existent.  My husband isn't too happy but it's hard to give it up when there are so many pros.  I'm a 40 year old healthy woman and would recommend this pill.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I LOVE THIS PILL!!!.. My periods were so heavy that at some points I thought I was having a miscarriage!.. This pill has Greatly reduced my flow and last month I didnt even get a period which was AWESOME!!.. I will admitt my sex drive has decreased  but not moody or depressed or anything. :}  Life is what you make it.. :}  Love Love Love this pill.. If you are looking for one to greatly reduce your periods or really stop your cycle  this one is for you! :}
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Today alone I just took my 3rd pill to try and stop the bleeding and it's not doing anything.  These are sugar pills as far as I'm concerned.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: In addition to causing some of the more "typical" side effects such as breakthrough bleeding, headaches, and mild depression, I also realized Natazia was the cause of my non-bacterial Cystitis-Like symptoms!  After two months of not being able to kick a "UTI" that wasn't actually a UTI, I decidied to stop Natazia cold-turkey (I was at my wit's end).  The next day, my Cystitis symptoms went away!  It is listed as a RARE side effect, and my doctors kept assuring me my birth control wasn't the cause of my symptoms, but as soon as I started the pill, the symptoms started to develop (lulling during my period).  As soon as I stopped, so did my UTI-Like symptoms.  Coincidence?  Time will tell, but I doubt it.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

I tried increasing my level of activity and changing my diet but nothing worked. As soon as I stopped taking the pill I lost six of those pounds in a week.

Reviews: I have tried at least 5 different pills all having different side effects such as spotting throughout the month or 2 weeks straight, but I have not experienced this with Natazia at all! The first month I did have a week where I was a complete psycho but that went away in month two. The only thing is that I get a headache a few days before it starts. Now I can pinpoint my periods to almost the minute that I should get it and it lasts about 4 days. Love it! Hope it stays like this!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I was put on Natazia to stop weeks-long heavy bleeding that just wouldn't stop. While that condition was scary, the first two pills of Natazia were worse. I felt like walls were moving around me. The next few were better. But about a week and a half into the month, I started getting insane migraines and regular chest pain. I decided to get off of this pill pretty quickly even though it stopped the bleeding like it was supposed to. 

There's another issue you should know about. With other pills I've taken, if you miss one, you can generally resume. With this there's a good week where if you miss even one pill by more than 12 hours, you have to stop the entire pack. And of the pills I've taken, this is one of the more expensive -- so you certainly don't want to throw away almost half of an unused pack. 

I'm having surgery for my underlying issue. And then my husband and I hoping for children. So I won't likely be back on pills anytime soon. But if I ever do, it won't be Natazia.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: My doctor prescribed me Natazia after trying about 4 other birth controls for continuous bleeding.  I am 22 and bleed for months at a time and then have a few days off then start again.  We have tried various BCs but nothing works.  This like the other BCs didn't work but did stop my cramps.  After a few weeks on this pill I began to become very anxious for no reason and I couldn't figure out why.  About 3 months into the pill I began to have very severe panic attacks, again over nothing.  I finally discovered that all my anxiety problems/panic attacks started after I began taking this pill and immediately stopped taking it.  With my other BCs I rarely had side effects.  After having the panic attacks I completely stopped all BCs out of fear of having such side effects again.  About a week after stopping Natazia, all my anxiety was gone.  I know people react differently to BCs but I would NEVER recommend this to anyone!  The panic attacks and anxiety cause me to have to quit my new job.  Its just not worth it!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Drug: necon 7/7/7 (28) 0.5 mg/0.75 mg/1 mg-35 mcg tablet
Reviews:
I am 19 and have been on this birth control for 4 months now. This was one of the three new drugs I was given. I can't naturally produce any progesterone or thyroid hormones so I will always have to take supplements. I had very painful, long and irregular periods and also  normal, hormonal and cystic acne. My face has almost completely cleared up. My periods are lighter and right on schedule now. I am so happy I started this birth control.
Note: my dime-sized cystic type acne was cleared up by also taking Minocycline.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Drug: necon 7/7/7 (28) 0.5 mg/0.75 mg/1 mg-35 mcg tablet
Reviews: This is the most amazing birth control! This is the first and only birth control I have ever taken. I have been taking it for about three months now, I have had no side effects at all! Taking the pill is such a breeze, they are so small you hardly notice them. I used to be afraid of taking pills! My periods are now regular, and much lighter compared to the heavy, irregular, and painful periods I had before. I'm also using it for birth control purposes, and it works very well. Another thing is, My breasts have grown a full cup size, and it really made me feel good about myself. I couldn't be happier with my birth control!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
Dealing with possible endometriosis, when I had my periods I would bleed heavily for 3 months straight. I would be off for a week and then bleed again. Also had horrible pain that was affecting my life. Had so much nausea I lost weight like crazy and was down to 95lbs. Had tried just about every other type of birth control pill.
 I started taking it on the first day of my period. It was way lighter right away and stopped after 5 days! Cramps eased up. The nausea was worse at first but within about a week it went away. I've gained an appropriate amount of weight- back up to 115 which I consider my healthy weight. The worst part of taking it was that it made me exhausted. I literally slept like 15 hours a day the first week I took it. I had a really hard time getting through a shift at work. (It was still worth it to not be in excruciating pain.) Within a couple weeks that seemed to get better too, though I'm still not back to my normal energy level.
 I find that I have to be really careful to take it at the same time every day. Within half hour late of taking it, I get cold sweats, dizzy, nauseated. Then when I take it I get so tired like when I first started taking it and I'll pass out for a good 12-15 hours. 
I was worried about being crazy moody and emotional on it or growing excess hair but no problem w either of these. Overall really happy with this. It got results that no other med achieved for me.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Drug: necon 7/7/7 (28) 0.5 mg/0.75 mg/1 mg-35 mcg tablet
Reviews:
I've been taking this birth control for about 2 months now, and I'm really amazed! Being an emetophobic, I have always been afraid of medications of all kinds.  I was always afraid of side effects.

I had NO side effects while taking this pill! On the first few pills I had a minimal appetite, and that was okay, I could deal with that. It went away quickly.  My periods are very light, a few days long, no more bad cramps! My acne actually cleared up.  My breasts grew a little too, no problem there. 

I have been overall satisfied while taking Necon 7/7/7. It has helped me a lot.  I went from long, heavy, irregular periods to short,light, painless periods.

Reviews: I have rated this drug 4 stars because I have been using it for the past going on 6 years or so. (Since I was in 8th grade?-I am now a freshman college student) The pills seem to always work for me unless, of course I missed days in which normally would result in the start of my period. The normal for me came to be that I would have my period for two days (normally Wed/Thurs or Thurs/Fr) and I'd be done, and it wouldn't be too overly excessive and heavy. It seemed to me that I was more normal then because it regulated my periods from what it used to be...(lets say the worst was 3 months straight and VERY heavy...basically I had to miss school because I practically lived in the bathroom...) The only, I guess, side effects they would be called, would be really bad cramps and bloating and serious mood swings...(ha ha)(But I dont mind that compared to what I had been...) Anyway, I haven't had any problems, as in it has always seem to work for me...up until two weeks ago...For some reason they stopped working for me and I don't understand why... I haven't missed a SINGLE pill since I switched back to ortho novum (i was taking this drug then the generic brand of the basic same drug and now im back to ortho novum). Basically I have been bleeding through the active days! At first it was light so I didn't see a serious problem in the fact figuring it was just because I was switching pills and getting back on a regular track when all of a sudden today (11-10-10) my period has progressed and become VERY heavy...What is going on????????
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I started taking this medication after coming off of depoprovera for an extended amount of time because my HCP recommended it in order to get my periods back in order. The first month I started the pills I would get headaches occasionally and had experienced some breast tenderness. I had also noticed some mood changes but nothing unbearable. The second month my moods have been all over the place and I am easily angered by the silliest of things. I have also noticed that I am getting nauseated easily and am avoiding most foods (not pregnant). I also have noticed my sex drive is practically nonexistent at this point.  I never had any issues with depoprovera so I was a little confused to why I would be reacting to this medication this way.I am going to finish out this pack and stop taking it afterwards. This is my own personal experience with this birth control and I would advise anyone to do proper research on side effects and understand when they are having symptoms. Any medication has the ability to effect others differently, this is just my personal experience.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

I originally started with a monocycle pill, and had my period for the first three months straight before I switched. I LOVE my ortho tri-cyclen and won't change methods until I'm done having children.  My acne has cleared up, my periods are 3 days long and very light, my mood swings have lessened, I have not gained weight, and I have NO cramps.  This is a miracle birth control pill for me! I have been on it for almost 6 years now and I suggest that everyone gives it a shot!

Reviews:
In the past, I had been on EstroStep Fe and Yasmin. EstroStep was a wonder drug for me, with the exception of weight gain. Yasmin made me incredibly suicidal and after I stopped taking it, I was forced to use anti-depressants. 

I'm in the middle of my second round of white pills and so far, I only have one complaint. Around the second or third white pill, I get incredibly fatigued (probably due to reintroduction of the hormones after a week of inactivity). 

This pill, so far, has cleared up my skin (though I never had any severe acne to begin with--it's just a plus!), NOT caused me any weight gain (just temporary water gain during the light blue pills), ceased any and all facial hair growth (it was blonde and fine and hardly noticeable except up close, but it was quite dense), given me shorter, lighter periods and prevented cramping. So far, I love this pill and I was very skeptical about starting it. I was petrified that it would do to me what Yasmin did but I'm very glad I gave OTClo a chance!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

This medication has made a world of difference in my face and an unsightly cyst I had on my forhead (for which I had seen a dermatologist and had a cortizone shot which didn't help much) has subsided! I am so happy about this and my face feels less irriated. I am 41 and was concerned. The pill has given me back some estrogen, important at this age, prevents pregnancy since I'm sexually active, and has helped my acne. So I am very satisfied.

Reviews: I have been taking this pill for about 2, almost 3 months now. I started taking it as a contraception, and because I was having 2-3 periods a month. The first two weeks, I had extremely painful stomach cramps, little to no appetite, and I was nauseous every night. Since then, the cramps have gone away, but come back a week before my period starts, and are worse than I ever had before I was on this BC. My sex drive is almost non-existent, I get horrible headaches half-way throughout the day, I have noticed myself becoming moody and depressed, and am nauseous every single night. If I eat, within a half hour I either have horrible diarrhea or I am vomiting uncontrollably for at least 15-20 minutes. The only good thing I have to say about this BC is that my slight acne is clearing up, and I have not gotten pregnant yet. Thinking about quitting this BC though, too many negative side effects to handle.

Reviews: I am a 34 yr old woman that was prescribed this pill by my gyn to help with heavy periods and extremely large clots. I have been taking this pill everyday for the past 3 months and my breast were tender everyday, my skin cleared up for the first month of use only, my periods stopped completely for 2 months. Earlier this month, my period came back but it wasn't like a period I had before and it lasted for 2 weeks. On the 3rd week I started experiencing shortness of breath and pain in my chest on the right side that radiated from under the right breastplate to my underarm and to the area below my shoulder on my back. I had this pain for 2 days until I couldn't take it anymore. I went to the E.R. to find out that I had a blood clot on my right lung that was threatening to end my life if I had not went to the E.R. I had to stay in the hospital for 3 days, receive blood thinner shots in my stomach all 3 days there and also some blood thinner pills. I was discharged from the hospital with the shots and pills. I have to take the shots until my INR level comes up and I have to take the pills for 3-6 months. I was advised NOT to take this birth control anymore. I do smoke cigarettes and explained this to my gyn prior to getting Mononessa and was told that smoking with birth control increases heart disease not blood clots in the lungs. I don't drink or use street drugs. The shortness of breath I experienced with the use of Mononessa and the clots on my lung, triggered my asthma and I had to have breathing treatments every 6 hours while I was in the hospital. I am consulting a lawyer for further assistance.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have only been taking this brand for about a week now and I am still bleeding. I noticed that I get upset easy now, it's just been a few days but my attitude has changed. I feel drained of energy and sleep more than normal. I'll keep taking this brand for a while to see if the benefits kick in. I have had abnormally long periods since I stopped taking a different brand over a year ago. The doctor said after a couple months things should be normal.

Reviews: I've been on this pill for about a month now(first time ever taking.g BC) and I've experienced a few zits, nausea, fatigue, and period-like cramps.I got on this pill because I was bleeding for 7 weeks straight. but since the pill, no period yet. I makes me think I'm pregnant. but so far so good! going to wait to see if I immune to it over the next month.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been on Mononessa for around seven months and before this I was on Sprintec for two months. I had irregular, long, painful, and heavy periods, as well as an ovarian cyst on my left ovary. Because my OB-GYN thinks breast/ovarian cancer likely runs in my family, she has ordered multiple tests, checks up every 3 months, and keeps me on birth control. I was originally prescribed Mononessa but my local Walgreen's didn't have it and they gave me Sprintec and claimed that they were the same. For two months, I didn't sleep, I was constantly sick to my stomach, my head hurt all the time, and my periods were still painful and heavy. When I returned to pick up my third month, I told Walgreen's that I wanted the Mononessa that my OB-GYN described. With Mononessa, my periods are a different story...I typically get my period on the third or fourth day of my "period pills" and other than an overwhelming and extremely heavy start, it's usually pretty light. I do still have a lot of pain, even though the blood is almost nothing. I am a week ahead of schedule though and I am not really a fan of that. I can't seem to lose the weight I've been trying to lose and I have been experiencing breast tenderness with this birth control.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I'm a virgin so I can't really say if it does it's job or not. I have had no acne or mood swings BUT I've had 10-13 lbs weight gain since I've been on it. My boobs also grew. Also I found out i have high cholesterol--not sure if it's because of the pill or not? I mean I'm in great shape and eat healthy so this was sort of surprising. I never had a period, but that's because my Dr. told me I could just skip the placebo pills. In fact, I've been off the pill for 6 months and have only had one period since!!!! I'm obviously not pregnant. It wasn't easy at all to lose that extra weight and I just feel as if my body hasn't been the same since I took the pill......
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
While I feel that a lot of the reviews on here aren't accurate (you need to be taking the drug for more than 2 months to acclimate to it) some of the reviews have some truth. I've been taking Mononessa for a year. The first six months were great. It cleared up my acne, shortened and lightened my periods, and I even lost a couple of pounds.

It's been a year since I started this medication, and I now want to change. After the 6 month mark, my acne came back and it is WORSE than the acne I had before (I never had anything major, I just wanted CLEAR skin). While my periods are still short and light, I'm not okay with having acne all over. I'll be switching as soon as my doctor okays it.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been prescribed to Mononessa about 4 months ago because my periods were very long and heavy. i would keep forgetting to take the pill after a while. This is the first month that i have been completely consistent on taking it. I have notice deep depression, mood swings, fatigue and anxiety. In 3 days i will be starting the placebo pills. Now my boobs are super tender, i'm getting cramps and getting nauseous. No food looks appealing at all! I am not myself at all. I'm not sure if i should switch off of it or not!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: In terms of having a lighter period and less cramps this has worked.  Side effect wise it has been the worst thing in the world for me.  I am moody and get upset at just about everything, my joints are in pain, i get head aches just about every day, im tired all the time going to sleep at 8:00pm and still being tired at 5:30am when waking up.  I have noticed more pimples occuring along my jaw line which never would happen before.  I just called my OBGYN to get an appointment to see her tomorrow, i need to get off of this stuff before it ruins not only my relationships, but my body.  This might not be the case for everyone, but the only thing good out of this pill is the fact that im not having a baby right now because i took it.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I received immediate relief with this pill and only experienced side effects the first time I tried it.  The side effects were completely overshadowed by the fact that my flow was lighter than it had been in years. The second time I used it I had no side effects. It is very effective in controlling my flow and I highly recommend it.  I time taking it with my meals as a precaution, but have taken it on an empty stomach with no issues.  I now don't feel the need for a hysterectomy and am thankful that I tried this.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  heartburn ,  dizziness , drowsiness,  diarrhea , and  headache  may occur.

Reviews: I was prescribed this medication, I have struggled with awful cramps, heavy bleeding and just unpredictable periods.  This medication is a heaven scent, my flow is 70% less, my cramps went from me having to go to emergency and getting morphine to, next to nothing and if I need something extra, I take a Motrin. So thankful for this product.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  heartburn ,  dizziness , drowsiness,  diarrhea , and  headache  may occur.

Reviews: I use to almost hemmorage every month until put on this, when i started this I noticed a real difference. I had no side effects, only ALOT less bleeding, less cramps, and I had more of a life because I wasnt afraid to leave the house due to leakage accidents. I was normal again.

Reviews: Almost continuous bleeding, ranging from light to heavy, for the 18 months I had it inserted.  After removal, I am currently on day 11 of heavy bleeding with golf-ball sized clotting.  I have never experienced this kind of bleeding before and I don't know when it will end.  I wish I had never used mirena.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had a heavy bleeding nothing was stopping no medication after mirena no bleeding not even for a day and my body was relaxed i am relaxed no cramping no bleeding at all so happy

Reviews: After inserted I began to smell an unpleasant odor. a few weeks after insertion I began feeling contractions....progressively getting worse. Finally, I had to have it removed.

Reviews: I used the Mirena for about 5.5 years because I was told that it was found to be effective for 7 years. I got it primarily because I was having a lot of problems with period symptoms like heavy periods, migraines, and cramping and over 35, so traditional birth control with estrogen was no longer recommended due to the migraines. This worked fairly well for me for 5 years, with very short/light periods and manageable migraines. I did have some night sweats/hot flashes. After the 5 years, I started to have anxiety, increased reflux with nutcracker esophagus, and breast tenderness with muscle fatigue/pain in the shoulder area. I am glad I did it, but would have had it taken out in 5 years if I did it again.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena coil fitted in August 2018 for both heavy periods and birth control. I was so desperate for this to work and was excited to have it fitted. I explicitly stated that I wanted something that DID NOT cause weight GAIN as I have worked hard to reach my perfect BMI over the last 2 years. I was informed that it would NOT cause weight gain. The insertion was really painful (and I mean really painful) but I was glad that I had it fitted. Immediately I had major contraction pains which took my breath away. These went on for nearly two months. I also had an insatiable hunger. This lasted for 3 months and then happened every 2 weeks thereafter. I also bled seriously heavily for the first 3 weeks and then had light bleeding every. Back and hip pain was also a permanent fixture from day 1 of insertion. I also had mood swings which made me feel very anxious and angry and my hair started falling out. I've never had an of this in my entire life! I went for a check up to make sure that everything was ok and that the coil was still in the correct position and was informed that it was. After three months, the bleeding calmed down to every 3 weeks, but my stomach was ALWAYS bloated and really uncomfortable every day with mild and sometimes severe cramps. My stomach looked like I was expecting twins, really embarrassing especially as it used to be flat. I then weighed my self. Despite not putting on weight in 3 years and in fact losing it over that time, I'd gained 12 pounds within 4 months of having the coil fitted, seriously not good. I was doing exactly the same amount of activity and eating the same things as I had done over the past 3 years. It is now January 2019. I've had the coil in for 5 months, but I've just got back from an appointment to have it removed. It's the best thing I ever did. My stomach pain has already disappeared, I really didn't think that the results would be so quick.Please, please think very carefully about having one of these things fitted.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Insertion is quick and easy and feeling very satisfied so far.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: At 39 with fibroids and heavy bleeding, it made total sense and it worked for many years. Now, 10 years and 3 mirenas later,it was doing more harm than good. Within a week of having it removed my sex drive and physiological responses to stimulation returned. Intercourse was no longer painful. The constant spotting stopped entirely. The bloating in my lower abdomen disappeared. It was a transformation that was obvious. While my gyno had been suggesting therapy, all I needed was to have the Mirena removed. Don't get me wrong, at the time it served its purpose but at some point, it became a negative and no medical professional thought to eliminate it. I'm happy to say after having the Mirena removed, I am off the list for a hysterectomy with normal periods. Fortunately I don't require it for birth control as my husband has had a vasectomy. I'm glad I decided to have the Mirena removed and had this trial period before my doc did an unnecessary hysterectomy.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I read the horror stories but this was my last and only hope (at age 45), so I went for it.

How I wish I had done this when I was 20, it has changed my life. PMT/PMS has calmed down, there is spotting but that clears up and now I barely notice when having a period.

I thought I could feel it for the first week or so but maybe it was just settling down, any discomfort was short lived. 

Over the last 30 years I have passed out and vomited at work, at train stations, public toilets, swimming pools, friends houses etc.... Missed weddings, birthdays, holidays and other special/fun occasions.  I could also never eat properly around my period, had to eat very little and basic food, yoghurt and cereal for a few days.

This has changed everything. 

I haven't had any children and was advised the fitting would be more painful. It wasn't pleasant, I felt sick, hot and very ill but for only 40/50 SECONDS - this is bearable and helps if you put some things into place before your appointment. I have listed below for anyone interested.

At least give it a try there is nothing to lose, it can always be removed

Good luck x

Prior preparation:

I started taking a magnesium supplement a couple of weeks before my appointment, it helps with muscle cramping and relaxing. I had an epsom salt bath prior to the fitting, again for the magnesium.

I took some IBS anti-spasmodic supplements, to help with related cramping.

Lastly, 30 mins before fitting I took painkillers. 

Really hope this helps x
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Severe back pain, acne, right ovary pain, and awful problems with my hormones. Every day I have a hot flash at age 27. This is not normal. I have an appt to have this removed. Don‚Äôt do it ladies. Trust me. I can‚Äôt wait to feel better.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I've had the Mirena inserted in December 2016.  For the first 3 months I spotted on and off.  For the past 5 months I've been bleeding heavily with one or two weeks of no bleeding here and there.  My doctor keeps trying to talk me into not removing it but I'm now anemic due to the extreme blood loss. So to go back to your previous question of effectiveness my response if I Don't Know because with all this bleeding sex is a rarity.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:

We fight tirelessly until our clients recover the compensation they deserve, focusing specifically on national litigation against big name pharmaceutical companies. . Reviews: Worst experience ever. Don't do it. My doctor insisted in Mirena instead of the copper T which is what I had for the past 10 yrs. I've been spotting non-stop for 4 months, when I actually got my period it was heavy and my iron has drastically gone down. The doctor said it was normal cause my body was getting used to it. Last night I felt really bad cramps and my body naturally expelled the Mirena.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I read so many bad reviews of this iud prior to having it inserted and almost scared me out of it. I had 2 kids all natural and the pain I experienced during insertion was not typical for a normal insertion as my uterus was shaped weird and it didn't place right and had to have placement fixed. HOWEVER, this was by far the best decision I've ever made. I didn't need it for birth control purposes it was solely for bleeding problems, after 3 mos of bleeding/spotting my Dr said it was hysterectomy or try this. My bleeding stopped almost immediately and I've had 2 very light periods since. I've had some mood swings but nowhere near as bad as when I was on BC pills and no acne issues. I did however for the first yr or so did get off and on water retention which was partly due to me not drinking enough water once that was corrected the bloat went away. I was facing hysterectomy as I have history of endometriosis and this changed my life and prevented surgery! It's probably not for everyone but if your dr thinks it's a good choice/option I would definitely consider it. I have recommended to several of my friends who have had the same "luck" with it as I have, not all people have a horrible experience with it.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I only had it in for 1 month then asked to have it removed because it was so painful.  I used it to help with long periods but this made it worse.  I constantly felt it poking me.  I could not sit properly, wear pants, bend down or exercise.  Even wearing a seat belt was difficult because it would put pressure on my pelvis.  After a 10 minute car ride, I felt I needed pain killers.  Had cramps every day and spotted/bled every day.  Sex was intolerable.  The doctor said it was put in properly when I returned for my check up but I still wanted it out.  As soon as it was out, I felt back to normal.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I'm in my 30s with two little ones, both delivered via c-sections. I've developed Adenomyosis and can't handle these horrible periods anymore. I'm going with an iud to delay a hysterectomy. I also reacted badly to the pill in the past. All the horror stories had me really second guessing my decision, but the procedure was painless (no worse than a pap, but I did take two naproxen beforehand just in case). Right now I feel like this device has quelled my symptoms, but it's still early for the other stuff. I would recommend it!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: This is an update of a post I wrote back in January about a week after insertion. I would say the only positive I see is I haven't gotten pregnant, but then again I don't think I kept it long enough to be able to have seen the effects over time. The 1st month on it was kinda bad. Spet the first 72 hours stuck in bed in excrutiating, paralyzing pain; literally couldn't do anything because the pain was so extreme. When my period came, it was as bad as usual, no change in pain level. The following 2 months were okay, except I would still get my periods for 6 to 9 days. But this time, the cramps lasted the entire period but were not nearly as bad; it would hurt but I was still able to function. But then, at the beginning of June (around month 4), I started experiencing regular sharp, horrible pain in my lower abdomen coupled with non stop spotting with blood clots and it kept on getting worse day after day. I told my OBGYN, but he said I could just be experiencing the side effects and not to worry, but I know my body enough to know that this was not normal. Went to my family doctor to double check and as he was trying to verify that the IUD was in place, he couldn't find it. After a painful half hour research down there, he ended finding it. Turns out it was a case of rejection, so he took it out immediately and after that, I had one of the most painful, horrible periods I've ever had, having every symptom from pain to migraines to uncontrollable vomiting (I couldn't even hold it in long enough to reach the washroom)... I was asked if I wanted to try it out once more and definitely refused. Those 2 okay months out of 5 were not worth it.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had my mirena put in a few weeks ago and I must say that I love it. Before getting it I read hundreds of reviews and was not sure what to do. Some were good and some were bad (horrible) but I decided to try anyway. My reason for getting the Mirena was because my period came on one day and decided not to leave. It had stayed on for an entire month. I was told that the casue of it was the birth control (nora b) that I was on. My doctor explained to me that the results of the Mirena were different for everyone and that getting it placed may cause more bleeding.  I had the IUD placed on a Monday and by Tuesday my period had stopped and it has never come back. Having the IUD placed was a breeze. I took 2 ibuprofen litterally about 10 minutes before the procedure and felt nothing. I cramped lightly for about 3 days but nothing serious. I even had sex on that Wednesday and Thursday. Now the first day that I had sex I felt the strings and it was a little uncomfortable for me but not him and when we tried again on Wed I felt nothing. I absoltely love this product and while I know that everyones exp may be different I would recommend this product.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I was very unhappy with the Mirena. After switching from the paragard, I thought this would be a better alternative but let's just say the grass is not always greener on the other side. I had high hopes for this iud but unfortunately this was not a good fit for me. I had the iud removed today after 4 months of 15 day cycles, although they were much 
lighter, I cannot do the long cycles. I experienced long heavy cycles with the paragard but this has been worse in my opinion. I would have thought by now my body would have adapted to the trial period but after going on 5 months and still longer cycles I decided to have it removed. This would be my only complaint. My dr. said I should give it at least 6 months before removing but I just couldn't take it any longer. As we all know our bodies react different to meds. I only hoped it would have been a more positive experience for me. I think I will have the paragard reinstalled. Too hormones sensitive for the pill. Hope this review helps!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Do not use it. It made me very ill.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I'm only giving 3 stars right now b/c it's only been about 7-8 weeks since I"ve had Mirena. I am still in the (warned-about) "bleeding and spotting almost daily "phase. I have not seen my weight change either way, and no acne. I would say I have been slighly moodier than usual. My plan is to wait until at least 6 months pass, as the dr.recommends; and if I haven't stopped the spotting and/or my periods don't really decrease in frequency, I will consider having him remove it. I remain hopeful that I am going to plateau-out and be as happy with it as so many others who have sufferred with heavy period bleeding.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE! IT JUST A BUNCH OF SCARE TACTICS.
I got Mirena due to heavy/painful periods. I'm 32, have never had kids, and have been "dealing with" this since age 14. When I was 16 I was put on Depo and that helped stop my periods for 10yrs. But as I got older Depo started to effect my weight and mood. So the last 7yrs have been me trying other methods to cope. I bleed like a waterfall for 3 days a month, have debilitating cramps along with vomiting, hot flashes and chills. I literally have to take hot baths for 2 days straight and no OTC meds help with the cramps. I was going to get the Mirena 4 years ago, but after reading on line about how much it hurts going in and the horror story side effects, I opted out. But now I cant take it. So I got it today.Waiting in the docs office with clammy hands. I was so scared of nothing! IT REALLY DIDN'T HURT! That was it? No screaming, no crying, no grabbing the table in pain, nothing. Just the pressure (not pain) of the doc pushing on my cervix and the speculum being held open. And I'm the biggest baby when it comes to pain. It was all on my head. I've passed blood clots that have hurt worst. I would recommend taking headphones and music to relax yourself. I sang the whole time due to nerves. The doc just laughed, but it helped. I drove myself to Jamba Juice and home right after. Whole thing took 5min tops!

So my point is its not as bad as the complaints say. I guess most people who have good experiences don't waste their time writing a review because they are living life, but bad experiences stick out.
Just do it! Good Luck!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena inserted 4 years ago. The pain of insertion was strong, but over quickly. I'd had horrible periods that were very heavy and frequent to the point where I had severe anemia. My GYN recommended 3 birth control options that also work to stop or slow periods. The first 3 months on Mirena were bad--constant period for about 8 weeks. At about the 3 month mark, I had a horrible mood swings and contemplated suicide. I came online and discovered that mood swings were part of the side effects and I've been fine ever since. (Knowing what was causing them was very helpful.) (I'd never had that problem with PMS--just when I was pregnant.) The 4 years since then have been AWESOME! No pain, and I've had probably 3 periods total and they were very light. I have had horrible weight gain, but that could be my own fault because I've always been fat.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Great for controlling heavy bleeding. I went from 7 days-3 weeks of heavy bleeding down to 5 days of spotting. Took a few months for the change to occur in the beginning.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: The insertion was so unbelievably painful.  It was not a small pinch as my dr had described.  My hands were numb. I hyperventilated while lying on the table. My lips went numb. Afterwards I was shocked at how inattentive the dr and nurses were to my and my pain.  I was left in the room for several minutes and a nurse brought me water. I finally just wanted to get out of the office & get home.  I could barely stand from the pain without stopping to catch my breath. I left the office walking as if I had just had surgery.  I had to stop on my way to my car & go into the hospital gift shop for Motrin and a water bottle.  The dr's parting words were that if I passed out at home to go to the emergency room.  And that the pain I was experiencing was not normal.  Most women bounce right up & leave. Now I'm at home and very bloated.  I am also very worried.  What have I done????
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: My GP recommended Mirena for heavy periods.  I have two children and my periods got heavier after my first.  Inserting the mirena was painful to the point I had to have a local.  My GP said it could take up to 6 months for it to really start working.  I gained weight during it's placement.  No other side effects but it did not work.  My period turned from 7 days to 17 days on average, with such irregular bleeding - one month I had 4 days off in total so it definitely did not work.  The periods were lighter for sure, but double the length which was not the objective.  In the 5th month it fell out on it's own during a period so it certainly didn't work. The GP removed it and now I am waiting for an appt with a gyne to discuss ablation.  It's great mirena works for some women - it must have changed their lives, but unfortunately not for me.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have always had very heavy periods.  So much so, that when I was 45 my doctor told me I'd need to take 3 iron pills a day for a year just to get to "normal". I went to my obgyn and she recommended Mirena. I had it inserted and though it was a little uncomfortable, it wasn't much worse than the usual gyno visit.  The doctor told me it would either reduce my flow or it could stop all together.  Since my periods were so heavy, it didn't stop it, it reduced it, which was still WONDERFUL.
