And the bonus for me was that it would probably take me through to menopause! I wish it had come around sooner.   My PMS was about the same, but knowing my period wouldn't be so heavy made up for it. Headaches- yeah, but I've always had them and they did lighten up. Overall, the side effects were similar to the pill only less.  And I didn't get the melasma (dark patches) on my face like I did with the pill. I highly recommend Mirena.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have one child and wanted a birth control that lasted a while without being permanent. I can never remember to take a pill so i was excited when my Dr. told me about Mirena. I have extremely heavy periods and have gotten worse after I had my child. I read the reviews and saw the commercial about people having issues with Mirena, and it made me very nervous to try this birth control. The day I had it put in I kept waiting for it to hurt and I never felt much of anything. That evening I was waiting for cramps and bleeding but I didn't have either. So far I really like it and love not having to take a pill everyday!!  Also my periods have been much lighter.( I kind of hoped they would stop all together but I have only had Mirena for about a month now.) I have always been medicated for anxiety before Mirena and I haven't noticed and major mood swings or anything like some people talk about. I highly recommend this! No problems here!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: After reading all the negative feedback online I was really hesitant, but decided to go for it anyway. I got the Mirena 2 days ago. I have 2 kids, so I assume that is why the insertion was completely pain free. So far I have been a little light headed here and there, and some side aches every once in a while. Other than that I feel amazing!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Had Mirena put in 1 1/2 years ago to control my heavy periods.  No birth control needed as I had a tubal ligation 10 years ago.  Slight cramping when it was put in, spotting for the first month, since then, absolutely nothing irregular happening.  For me, this was one of the best decisions I have ever made.  I will gladly have this replaced in 3 1/2 years
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: had mirena inplanted Dec 10th and didnt have a period for 2 weeks, then bleeding for 36 days, then stopped for a week and now I have my period again and today is day 8   UUUGGG!  I just want my period to stop!!!!!!!!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I am a 31 yr old who has tried multiple BCPs and Nuvaring.  I have had Mirena placed in Sept 09 to control irregular bleeding which I'd had since age 12. It wasn't a question of IF i'd have breakthrough bleeding during the month, but when. I'v had both irritability and depression during the month with the best days being 1-2 days after it starts. I fought w my mom a lot and she could always tell when I was on my period during a fight and when I wasn't. I've taken multiple pills including: ovcon, desogen, ortho-tricyclen, demulen, mircette, and yasmin.  NONE helped with my mood and some made it significantly worse and none completely stopped the breakthrough bleeding.  Nuvaring was wonderful for my moods and regulated my cycle, but couldn't keep me from bleeding during extremely stressful times.  On Mirena, I've had my period maybe four times and it's super light.  The BEST thing about it is that my moods have improved dramatically.  I've cried less times in the last year than since my period began.  Once every few months vs. once every few days.  I give a tolerability a reduced score because the migraines are way worse although infrequent.  They were rough the first few months as was the spotting.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I am a mother of three, a doctor, and a runner so I have a busy life.  Since having the Mirena IUD placed I have gradually developed a lack of energy to run which is disappointing because it is my stress relief.  Three
 months after having it placed I now am experiencing insomnia.  I now also have frequent headaches that I never experienced before.  Last but not least, my sex drive is gone.    
I have read other complaints and while this is a great choice for many, it does not work for some.  I plan for removal today and hopefully I will be back to myself in the very near future.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Had Mirena inserted Mar.2010 for heavy periods not bc. I am 45 years and no children. Soon afterward got severe pain - bacterial infection and ovarian cyst. My periods did get light, but spotting lasted 7-10 days. Developed headaches, oily skin and hair, all of which I never had. Also hair loss/no sex drive. Gained over 10 pounds and cannot lose it. I feel bloated and get cramps all of the time. My doctor does not think any of this is related to Mirena, but I had her remove it anyway. May be great for a younger woman, but I'd rather deal with the heavy periods.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: 45 year old mother of 3 who was experiencing heavy bleeding and horrible cramping, I opted for the Mirena in lieu of surgical procedures.  The device did solve the problem of bleeding and maybe one or two partial cycles and nothing since for over two years.  Upon 1st annual pelvic check up the strings to the device could no longer be located.  We then had to do an ultrasound to check for possible expulsion and learned it was still in proper place.  Thus leaving me to pay in full for the ultrasound cost which was deemed not medically necessary.  Now I have been advised I am menopausal and the device needs to be surgically removed in the operating room.  Possibly deductibles and other expenses I never took into consideration upon getting this device.  Seems that strings retraction is a common occurence, maybe this should be mentioned prior to placement so costs could be considered in the event of this happening.  After reading some symptoms others have written I feel I have been symptomatic for many of the mentioned and also wish I had done more research prior to listening to my doctor who I really trust.  Look forward to getting this out as early as possible in 2011 and hopefully not experiencing some of the unwanted symptoms.  BEWARE of hidden costs and ask your physician if this is a common complaint with others.  Never hurts to ask, even though when I reported my dissatisfaction to the manufacturer they mentioned they cannot comment on incidence due to HIPPA privacy policies.  Not a happy camper right now and would NOT recommend this product to anyone more or less friends or family.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: what about ovarian cyst?
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I am 43 I have had 2 children but husband is fixed so no use for birth control. I got the Mirena because of heavy bleeding and clots, I also have fibroid tumors, and my OBGYN thought this would be a prevenative measure to a Hystorectomy. Not, I have had it a yr, gained 40lbs, cramps like when I was 15 and no motovation and my sex drive is worse than ever, almost completely gone. The insertion was painful but I survived, cause the first piece it the procedure broke and mind you I clearly feel this is my luck so the doc had to start all over. It did cause my to have heavy bleeding for about a week and it has stopped my clotting periods. I have had the acne, cramping pain during sex,swollen ankles worse than my granma and break throu bleedin constantly and back pain that is very irregular for me with head aches often. It will be removed after christmas. I have many ppl that like and dislike the same. I just clearly feel that I am not a candidate for the product and so just do your research before the procedure.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Was hoping this would reduce my periods by 50% as I am about to go backpacking off the beaten path.  Insertion was okay.  Not fun.  Spotted for 5 weeks.  Some cramps.  Missed my first period.  Doctor told me I was lucky and I would not be getting it anymore!  Yippeee!!!  Cramps gone.  Spotting gone.  No acne, weight gain or headaches.  Love the Mirena!!  PS.  My doctor was very experienced at insertion.  She works at a women's health clinic.  I read this was a huge factor - if inserted incorrectly, women can experience more cramps and bleeding.  If you go this route, get a doctor who has inserted hundreds of these.  Trust me on this!  Have now had it for 7 weeks, don't even know it is there - feel great.  Love that I will be period free while on the road.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
This is a horrible horrible device. I had it for two weeks and was bleeding heavily the entire time. I had it removed due to severe cramps  and when I did I bled more than I did after I gave birth. My gyn had to put me on oral bcp to stop my bleeding because I was anemic and was rapidly declining. 
NEVER AGAIN!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had this put in almost a year ago and have to say that I am going to make an apt to get it removed. Insertion was awful. I made it to my car and had to go back inside because I felt weird and ended up almost passing out. Since then, my periods all last about 9 days, awful cramps (which is the reason I chose this), and my legs below the knee swell up and hurt all the time. My stomach is always bloated and I think this is because my uterus is always inflamed. My dr gave me pills to stop my periods and antibiotics to stop the inflammation and nothing has worked. It feels like my ovaries hurt after sex and always hurts when I move around a lot or work out. This may be a good method for some but I don't think its the one for me. I have tried to put up with the side effects but I think I have waited too long. Totally loved not taking a pill every day but it is time to go back to it.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I wanted to share my positive experience with Mirena since there are a lot of negative reviews. All the negative reviews almost scared me off from trying it for myself. All women are different though and I figured more people who had problems would get online and complain than woman who had positive results. I am in my 40's, have 1 child and have a really bad problem with extremely heavy flooding menstrual periods. It had gotten so bad I was flooding thru every 2 hrs and that was affecting my daily life during that week. I had to do something so I went for it. Insertion was painful but over quickly. I had mild cramping that day and spotting for about a week. After that I had some discharge for several more weeks that I only noticed when I used the bathroom and then it stopped. I have had 2 periods now after insertion and they have been wonderful. I went from flooding to not even needing to wear or use anything! I have not had any side effects or problems. I am so happy that I did not let the negative reviews scare me off! Good luck to all the ladies who give it a try! Hope your experience is as positive as mine has been!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Insertion was a bit rough because my cervix is very high. Had a bit of cramping after it was inserted. No other problems. I was relieved to have my bleeding stop. It had to be removed because it was in for 7 years and they won't put another in because I am 51...and the crazy heavy bleeding is back because I have hyperplasia which was controlled with the IUD...sigh
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I am using this IUD to treat heavy periods that women my age (51) often have as they approach menopauuse. A few years ago, I had become anemic from blood loss from horrible 3 week long periods before getting treated with low dose BC pills.  This IUD beats pills any day.  No more periods, no hassle with refilling prescriptions and remembering to take the pills.
There was a bit of trouble getting it ready to be inserted--my uterus had kind of 'floated' up into my innards and was in a tough position for the nurse midwife to 'grip' and visualize the cervix. but once in position, the IUD did not hurt going in. I have had no side effects and feel great.
I can heartily recommend this device to any woman--younger ones needing birth control and to those needing treatment for perimenopausal bleeding.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena inserted on March 2015 and it was a very painful experience even after taking pain medicine before and being on my period. I had awful cramping and bleeding for a month, all while being in contact with doctors and nurses who stated it's all normal and that I will have 'breakthrough' bleeding for 3-6 months (like that's normal for anyone). I was full on menstruating; I wouldn't be complaining if I was only spotting. Then last week came huge clots and then before work I passed the worst clot of my life with my IUD embedded in it. I felt absolutely horrible and my cycle became even heavier. This was an awful experience for me, but since going to a new ob-gyn, I am feeling much better now.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I turned 40 in 2014.  I had been having increasingly heavy periods, more frequent periods, painful cramping, and mood swings.  It started at age 35.  I had been discussing options with my doctor including D & C.  During my physical in 2014 she mentioned people were having relief using the mirena IUD.  I have had it since September 2014.  It has been 6 months and I am very happy with the results.  I had read up on reviews and was intimated at first. But I haven't had weight gain, actually lost 5 pounds.  My periods are so light, really just spotting.  My mood swings are gone too.  No more depression the week before I got my period. My insurance covered 100% and I didn't miss any work.  If I would have had a D & C, I would have had insurance cost and missed work.  I just wanted to share my positive experience.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Had the Mirena in for more than one year and had severe headaches, anxiety, depression and after a year began very severe low back pain. Physicians did not recommend removal but my low back pain and headaches stopped immediately after it was removed. I suspect the other symptoms will also improve.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena put in on March 2nd to help with my heavy bleeding each month. I only felt a little pinch and it was done. BUT I've had a heavy period for the past 8 days now, I emailed my Dr. and she said to give it another month, really? I'm hoping that it will stop soon. I was offered to remove my fibroids first, wish I would've done that since the results are instant.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had Mirena placed yesterday afternoon after 30 days of research and indecision. My dr suggested this product for bleeding and BC. The reiews submitted were frightening to read and I almost decided against it. The insertion was not comfortable but I would not describe it as "pain". Pain is when you ram your pinky toe into a table...that hurts. I had mild cramps for about 30 minutes and very minimal bleeding. I was on day 5 of my period and as of this morning it has stopped. My husdand and I went out to dinner with friends about an hour later and I felt perfectly normal. It is early in the process for me but I have a really positive feeling that this product will work for me. No periods? Worth a shot ladies! Don't be afraid to try it because of scary reviews. The worst part of it was being tense and afraid due to what I had read. My blood pressure was off the chart, but once my dr calmed me down by explaining everything that was going to take place it was easy breezy. Try it!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I decided to try Mirena out before performing a hysterectomy for endometriosis and polycystic ovarian syndrome. I had my period for 7 consecutive months and was sick of the bleeding.My doctors recommended trying it out before surgery and I complied. However, I had the mirena inserted a month ago and I have been bleeding non-stop and the bleeding has also increased. I also notice a sort of heaviness in my uterus or pelvic cavity and have moderately painful cramps daily. I noticed that my mood has changed and have been more anxious and tearful. I have heard that it is normal and common for the mirena to penetrate the uterine wall and since I have checked placement, I was unable to locate the strings. I called my gyno and go in 2 days to get it removed. I am very unsatisfied with the results.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Terrible experience.  Went on it for abnormal periods and constant bleeding.  Had it inserted.  Still a lot of bleeding, clotting.  Had an u/s.  IUD positioned wrong.  Went back to Dr. She removed it and inserted another one.  Still the same problems.  Missing work because of pain and bleeding.  Called office.  Pain was horrible.They told me to come in, went to bathroom and Mirena IUD came out!!  I gave birth to an IUD!  Walked into the office holding it in kleenex in my hand.  Never again.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: i suffered from heavy  periods and cramping. My doctor suggested Mirana. I starting having a medium flow shortly afterwards that lasted 30 days  not  spotting a serious enough flow where i thought i was going to go broke buying sanitary napkins. the second month they prescribed medicine to stop the flow it took 3 wks to kick in and then only stopped working when i was directed to stop taking the medicine. I am  considering  have it remove asap. I am not happy with it at all. I wished i had researched the side effects more. the constant bleeding caused me to be tired all the time and the  doctors could not  help at with the situation. I have fibroids they say is the reason for the constant bleeding,was not told it may happen. looking forward to a partial historectomy.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I got mirena in May 2007. Since then I have had nothing but problems. When I first got it they told me i could have a constant period for 6-9 weeks. False, it last nine months straight. Now I dont have a period at all. I have severe cramping almost everyday to the point I have had to go to the hospital 3 times. Going to work has also been a problem. Im always tired and my body feels so drained. I do get acne once a month. As for weight gain I didnt gain any weight untill these last 2 months and I gained almost 20lbs. When having sex, I can only be in one position or im in constant pain. I do not recommened this for anyone. Im 21 and thought this would be an easy way to keep for getting pregant. It is, but the problems that come along with it are not worth it. Needless to say I am having it removed after 3 years and $600.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Yeah works great for Periods - but Beware of the Mirena HELL you will experience!  Mood changes and Psychological effects are EXTENSIVE! BEWARE!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: i had it in for 2 and a half years. i had scar tissue grow around it and it was very painful to get removed. i have been trying to get pregnant for a year now and to no avail i havent gotten pregnant. i dont recommend to use it if you plan on ever having another child again!!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had my Mirena put in after I turned 20. I know that I am young but was told it would be the best decision based on the fact that no other medication would control or help my heavy and painful periods. I have not had childeren and still do not and having it inserted was probably one of the most painful things I have ever had done. for the first 6 months I hardly had a period or very light bleeding, which was great however the cramps were the same if not worsened. It has caused me to be rushed to the ER twice to to rapid growth of cervical cysts and rupture. Which again is very painful. Now after almost a year it still hurts but I do not want it removed due to the rumored statement that pregnancy is extremely likely after removal. I want kids but not now! If you dont want to get pregnant I would recommend it, I have no doubt that while the iud is in me I will not get pregnant. Which I love, no worries on that part. However with my story I am afraid of it making me infertile (Cause eventually I want kids) and continueing to have long severly painful periods, with no bleeding. I just wanted to share my story because of how different it is, with my age and having no childeren.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I'm 33 and I have always had a strong immunity against illnesses.  That was until I had the Mirena inserted.  First, insertion was excrutiating, but after an hour I was fine.  Within a month I had a blister on my gut? turn into a horrible staph infection.  Antibiotics (AB) for a 2 months along with trips to a wound specialist.  While recovering from that, I got pneumonia, with double ear infection and strep throat at the same time. Never had any of those.  3 mos after insertion, I start raking at my labia,first thought it was yeast, dr. said it was female eczema, itching still continues and have been prescribed 3 diff creams with only temp relief.  Multiple sinus infections, and the start of bronchitis when I couldn't breathe, more (AB).  11 mos after insertion (Now) have a UTI that will not heal, and have run out of AB, 10 days worth.  Called dr today and am having it removed in 4 days.  Aside from the infections, zero sex drive, cannot lose weight, severe backaches, extreme hairloss(as told by my stylist), very emotional, I rarely spotted and had minimal cramps.  I had my tubes tied when I had my twins, but had Mirena inserted 6 mos after because of terrible bleeding.  Im very glad it works for many women, but w/o sounding dramatic this device will kill me lol..  For those of you who want this for the same reason, consider novasure, for bleeding, that will be my next option. jmcfaggan@gmail.com  I put my email because I want to know if anyone else has gone thru some of this, feel free to email me and share your experience
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had M inserted on July 18, 2011 at the beginning of that months period. I bled nonstop thru to the next months period with no let up. I figured that would be worth it once my period stopped completely. I have yet to know what september's menstral will bring...I'm hoping nothing! I went for my check up and was told I needed an ultrasound. Got a call that ultrasound came back with no detection of placement so I needed to return once again for a physical check of proper placement. The doctor said he could see it and I shouldn't worry yet some of the side affects I have dealt with thus far have me seriously questioning my choice! Since insertion for one my poor husband has had to deal with the painful stabbing from the strings even after being cut...definitly not the best choice for a well endowed man! I have had over 11 debilitating migraine headaches since insertion which is a lot in a month any migraine sufferer will atest! Periodic cramping that has me still questioning whether this device has worked its way thru my cervix into my abdomine offers no peace of mind! I hate my period but I will only give M two more months to prove its worth or else its outta there!!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I've had Mirena for a year, and have lost hair, had infections from staph, ear, bladder,sinus, pneumonia, and strep.  I have never had any of these before this IUD was placed. And all within a year? No energy, weight gain, dull backaches, were enough-made the appt today to have it removed..  I will not recommend
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I worked at a women's clinic for several years and spoke to many women who were very happy with this method. But after reading so many negative reviews of Mirena (that almost discouraged me from getting one myself), I decided to add myself into the chorus of voices that have had a positive experience with this form of bc.  This is not to invalidate the bad experiences some women have had with this method, but to let women interested in Mirena know that bad experiences are a small minority, and overrepresented on this site.  I have  suffered with dysmenorrhea for 20 years, since my first period, and was not only looking for a highly effective bc, but something that could help manage the pain (monthly vomiting, diarrhea, occasional fainting). Mirena has done that for me.  My first period has come and gone, and the pain was cut in half.  I imagine it will continue improve. I do want to say that while the insertion was fairly easy for me(I had a shot of lidocaine in my cervix, which also helps dilate it), the first month (especially the first week) was definitely uncomfortable. The cramps never got as bad as during my period, but they were definitely no walk in the park. Schedule your insert at a time when you have few demanding activities or work for at least a few days. But in the long run, I'd do it over again in a heartbeat.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: The mirena made me gain a lot of weight even though I had it for only 4 months. I couldn't lose the weight no matter what. After a lot of research I stumbled upon this video: http://mirenadetox.com/mirena-weight-gain/ which helped me a lot with losing the weight and getting rid of my excessive bleeding, and finally made it clear to me that the mirena was the cause of all my problems.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: The insertion of Mirena was absolutely terrible for me. I took Vicodin before and it was still very painful. Just when I thought it was over my doctor said it had popped out and had the nurse grab another and had to perform the procedure again. This time it was even worse. I was in bed for three days in agony. I continued have horrible cramping and very heavy bleeding for the next two months. I almost had it removed but chose to stick with it because all other forms of birth control I'd tried had made me sick. I am glad I did. Since I stopped bleeding I have not had a period and it has been four months. I feel good. No side effects. I am very pleased. I'd say it is well worth the initial pain.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: It has not worked at all and I am entering month 3 of constant bleeding.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Just had the Mirena installed, which was painful for me but everyone is different. I feel fine and think this is going to work out well for me. I'm hoping it stops my periods all together, fingers crossed.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: First- this product is great! I too was skeptical due to negative reviews. My dr had recommended this to me a few years ago and I just too uneasy about it. Then 2 years ago I started with very heavy periods  for 7 to 10 days a month and putting on weight - premenopausal _ tried different birth control pills and then I finally decided to try the mirena as a last resort-- Best thing ever!! Easy insertion, light spotting for a week and now it's been 6 weeks and lost 5 lbs- and had the lightest 3 day period! Very happy I did this..and so is my husband!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have very horrible periods ever since I hit puberty.In my late teens I was diagnosed with endometriosis and polyocystic ovarian syndrome.  I was always afraid to try Mirena because all of the scary reviews. When my periods started lasting over 2 weeks I had enough and I tried Mirena, I am so glad I did. It hurt being put in, but I did take some Advil before the procedure which helped. I would say its uncomfortable it feels like a really bad menstrual cramp/pinch but it goes in fast, it really just depends on your pain tolerance. After the procedure I had off and on spotting and cramps for the first 4-6 weeks and now I have no period. Occasionally I will get a 2-3 day spotting but rarely. Its great! No side effects, no need to remember to take a pill. Pills never worked for me, I tried many different kinds and none of them worked or even came close to helping my symptoms. Mirena took care of everything. If you can grin and bare the first 4 weeks of random spotting you should be happy for years to come. I will def be getting another one in 5 years :)
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: i am the age of 46 have a good experience with this treatment but two side brown paches occured on my face overall experence is good.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have to write another review. Recently got the IUD removed the try and have a baby. I want to tell women if you have bad cramps get the IUD. For the first Tim in 10 yeara I did not have to take narcotics for pain, not even ibuprofen for pain.I did bleed for the first 5 months everyday. I would take the bleeding for the cramps to stop. I had the IUD in for year. Still had a very very light period. I will post again if we end up getting pregnant.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I always had very heavy and painful periods that made my life just miserable. Birth control pills only made it worse; tried three different brand of pills and they only made my situation worse. My new  OB/GYN told me that he believed Mirena would be right for me and he was so right! The first month I got some random spotting and I got my period but this time it was lighter and less painful. I am now on my second month and my period was just a very light brown spotting with only a little discomfort but no pain :)! I am so happy, my sex life is amazing and my energy level is through the roof! No weight gain!
The insertion was VERY painful but now I think it was worth it.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Had the device fitted for heavy menstrual bleeding. It did help in that respect, HOWEVER: instead of bleeding 1 week out of 4 I was now bleeding/spotting 3 weeks out of 4, had very unpleasant smelly discharge most days. Most importantly of all, the levonorgestrel seriously screwed up my already rather dodgy hormone balance as I have Addisons and am also hypo thyroid. After 7 months I became seriously ill with blood pressure issues, palpitations, panic attacks. I had it removed 8 weeks ago and I am still too ill to work.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I thought I'd give a review of the Mirena IUD since other reviews on this site helped me decide which BC method to use. I had a great doctor put the IUD in so that was a painless experience for me. My doctor said Mirena MAY eliminate my periods all together but may not. I've been using the Mirena for 2 months now. The first month after implantation was the roughest. I think I had spotting for about a month, on and off. Not heavy bleeding but enough to be annoying. Month 2 has been better, but I'm still having a period - albeit a much easier and lighter one. I don't have the mood swings anymore, no weight gain and the cramps have DISAPPEARED! The cramps for me used to be devastating. I'm hoping that with time, the bleeding will stop completely too. Best of luck to all who are considering Mirena. My experience has been a good one and I'm looking forward to NO MORE PERIODS!!! Fingers crossed...
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have had the mirena now for 5 yrs. but I am experiencing pain and discomfort under my ribcage on both sides and pulse like pain in my lower abdomen.I had green discharge, which I went to gyno and she said that it is normal. 5 yrs of having green discharge is normal? This is very frustrating,frightening,painful,and takes away from my quality of life as being in pain constantly I am unable to do the family events that I once did before having the mirena implanted. Very nervous of this outcome.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena inserted on Aug 10,2011. Today is Aug 28 and I have been in the hospital for a full week because of blood clots in my lungs that can;t be attributed to anything else but the Mirena IUD. My body expelled the device in a huge nasty blood clot 4 days ago. Thankfully that was not painful, and I feel much better after it left me. The gyn at the hospital says she has never seen this problem with Mirena before, but my regular Dr has reported my problem with the IUD to the FDA. I DO NOT recommend this product.. I am seriously thinking of finding an attorney.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had a Paraguard IUD but switched because I had heavy periods (pre-dating Paraguard). Everything had seemed to be fine. I've been having trouble losing weight and just blamed it on other life changes. I finally recognized the correlation of symptoms to the Mirena. The posts even support my hair loss being attributable. I am scheduled to have it removed in a couple of weeks. I noticed another review saying she felt like being pregnant. YES! I have felt that way, too. My stomach is even rounded and I somewhat waddle, just like when I was pregnant 5 years ago.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Insertion was agonising, but subsided after about an hour. Bled for 6wks on & off. 3mnths later I'm ecstatic not to have extended bleeding. Only downside is bleeding after intercourse, no pain though. Lasts for a few hours so makes me self conscious.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena inserted in March 2011. Insertion totally painless and troublefree. I spotted for 2 months, then had hardly any period. HOWEVER after 3 months, I detected a large, hard , thick area in my breast. Was NOT there previously. Went through some scary biopsies and it was benign, however, I realized that if you read the Physician Insert (rather than the Patient Insert- they are different!) that Breast Cancer is listed as a possible side effect. My psychiatrist also strongly recommended getting it removed. So I am next week. I'd rather have a hysterectomy than live with those risks.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the mirena put in April of 2010 for heavy and painful periods. That was the worst decision of my life!! The insertion was HORRIBLLY PAINFUL! The worst pain I've ever felt. I was in pain for weeks before I felt the tiniest bit of relief. The cramps and back pain was unbearable.I couldnt even sit down! On top of that, my bowels were a mess! I have IBS and it was all out of wack - severly constipated and pains in my stomach. It then switched to severe diarrhea. It got so bad I had to see a GI specialist. I felt like I was having constant problems and constant pain.I was still cramping and bleeding 6 mo later. I had the placement checked and cultures done to rule out infections. I also gained 8 lbs instantly and it was impossible to get rid it. I couldnt exercise w/o having terrible cramps. I also had constant headaches, lasting for a month at a time. After 1 year, my period had regulated somewhat. I could not use tampons as they were uncomfortable and had to deal with pads. The cramps were still bad - 2 weeks out of the month. My sex drive was completely gone and if I did have sex, I usually bled afterwards, cramped or was uncomfortable. I finally found a doctor who would help. She did an exam and found a large cyst on my ovary. I had to have several ultrasounds to monitor the size. The cyst continued to grow and not break down so my doc said it was time for the IUD to come out since cysts are a side effect. I had it removed 3 weeks ago - it was completly painless!! I barely felt anything! It was an immediate sense of relief! I was put on the pill to help break down the cyst. I have already lost most of the weight. My stomach feel great, my moods are better, my sex drive is coming back,I have energy again, I'm not in any pain and I don't feel like I'm going crazy anymore! So far getting the mirena removed was the best thing I could have done! I def. regret ever having it! The pain and side effects are NOT worth it at all! I WOULD NOT RECCOMMEND THIS TO ANYONE
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
After nearly 2 years of bleeding non stop I had an 
iud put in to fix the problem. At first I had cramps and bleeding but then no symptoms at all...no real period to talk about and no cramping etc. Also my mood swings completely disappeared! I am happier and healthier in many different ways!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena inserted June 2009 due to heavy periods. The very next day I woke up thinking I had had a stroke..my eye wouldnt blink, mouth hung down on one side..I had Bells Palsy. I was told it was not due to the Mirena(but I wonder)I have continued to suffer from nuerological ailments and severe pain since that time. I also suffer from recurring infections in and around my cervix. I am having it removed to give my body a chance to heal. In all fairness, my sister also has the Mirena and completely loves it without problems
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: From the beginning 3 years ago, I have had bad pelvic cramps, depression, swollen stomach, large weight gain, hives and joint pain.  Planning to have the device removed as soon as my insurance takes effect.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I am 51 and due to heavy bleeding from uterine fibroids had to choose between the devil (hysterectomy) and the blue sea (Mirena). Actually, I told my doctor if I experienced the slightest negative symptom Mirena had to go right away. It has been 4 months and I can only say good things about it. No mood swings, no acne, 8 pounds extra but already lost 4 pounds with exercise and just minor spotting when in the past I was bleeding so heavily I had to wear Depend. I am still trying to lose the extra 4 pounds remaining but it is a little price for not having heavy bleeding for months at a time. Love Mirena. My doctor was right this IUD is great.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: The insertion for me was one of the most painful and odd experiences.  I felt like my organs were being shifted and she walked out of the room during it which prolonged the suffering.  I felt sharp pains that night and went to the ER thinking it was in wrong or falling out?  It bugged me out enough to think it was perforating my uterus.  Either way, as a small person with no kids, that was torture.  A few months later, no periods but cramping and brown period spotting which requires a liner.  My childhood acne is back again, yay.  If it weren't for the pain of insertion and tremendous fear of removal it would have been out by now.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the mirena put march 10, 2014. Before I had the mirena  put in I read some reviews both good and negative. I called my ob doctor because I was scared , and she assured me that they could likely happened.So, march 10 was here and I was still nervous  but tried to stay positive. then after a couple of minutes it was over . At first I felt  light headed but,  after 10 -15 minutes  of sitting and having something to drink I was fine. Later that night I started to bleed . Then I went for my 2 week check-up  to see how my mirenia  was going.I'm still bleeding my ob doctor put the mirena in because of irregular  bleeding. Then the bleeding turned brown then the brown stop. April 15, 2014 I started bleeding again , the bleeding continue. Until May 6 , 2014 I had a check-up with my ob doctor . She check my mirena and she said it's falling out !! so, she pulled my mirena out I was so sad . I said why did it do that she replied  since I never had  kids and i'm so tiny  !!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I am 39 years old, perimenopausal and was experiencing heavy bleeding and extreme pain with my periods.  My doctor gave me several options, and I narrowed it down to Mirena or ablation.  Because I'm relatively young, my doctor recommended not doing ablation because chances are that my lining would grow back before I completed menopause. So, I went with the less invasive choice of the Mirena, which would also take care of the pain, which ablation wouldn't. I had it put in in early January 2014. It was relatively painless; I had a little cramping and spotting the first day.  The second day, I was a little tender. The third day, I started bleeding. It is now mid-April 2014, and I am still bleeding.  The first month, I experienced a lot of pain varying from mild menstrual cramps to a feeling like I had a bladder infection/kidney stones.  Ibuprofen took care of the pain.  From the second month on I have not had any pain, just constant bleeding.  My doctor tried me on estrogen patches to regulate me, which lessened it some. Now, she's got me on a mini-pill, which oddly enough has made it worse.  My cousin got Mirena and had no problems. She loves it. It seems that I'm the opposite. It seems like it has thrown my hormones into turmoil, and my doctor says my uterus is rejecting it and trying to basically flush it out.  I'm going to give it another month and then get it removed.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I am over 40 and have always had very heavy, painful periods, they started getting worse about 2 years ago. I had to wear a tampon and pad and change them out every hour, alot of times ruining my pants because I would lose track of time. 7 months ago I decided to try Mirena because I heard that it would stop or at least slow the flow. The first two months after insertion was uncomfortable with alot of cramping and spotting everyday, I was starting to regret my decision, however, the third month all the pain stopped and so did the everyday spotting, I forget it's even there. My period is now 5 days of light spotting and no cramping, I wear one panty liner a day. I am a very thankful, appreciative patient and believe this is one of the best decisions I have ever made in my life!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had Mirena inserted and after 1 week I had it out. Awful side effects, I could feel it in me, heavy bleeding which I expected, awful anxiety, worse than I ever had and I was hungry for two days straight after insertion.  Not normal hungry, starvation.  Gave me a awful overall nauseaus and sick feeling.I did not do my homework on this and if I had, I would have never got it in.  I was not going to wait until the symptoms got worse and went on and on.  Not worth it at all.  My doctor took it out when I asked her and did not fight me at all.  Its your body and your decision, make sure you do you complete homework on this awful birth control. I will put up with my heavy periods thank you.  Best of luck to you all.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I developed hypertension due to the Mirena.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: This was my last birth control to try and it failed!  I have horrible heavy, painful periods.  This helped with the heaviness but not the pain.  It also increased the length of my periods.  Instead of 4-7 days they are now 3 weeks long!  I have been insanely moody since having it put in.  After having it put in, I bleed for 3 months straight.  When you have extremely painful periods, that isn't a good thing to have to go through.  This is probably one of the worst birth controls I have tried to date.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: This is a review solely for the insertion as I just had it inserted yesterday. A bit painful but acceptable and quick. I got fibroids and the bleeding is insane. I had my tubes tied when I had my last son so I don't need contraception but I am using the Mirena for my heavy bleeding. It is early to report any symptoms yet but so far have not noticed anything strange. So far so good!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have only had good experiences with this birth control. I've been taking it for the last 5 years and was switched from loestrin. Havent experienced any side effects at all.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: When starting this pill I experienced mood swings and breast tenderness but within a few months, everything was fine. I had horrid acne before and when taking it, it all cleared up. My period was always when I expected them and always short. I would have moderate bleeding compared to what I had experienced in the past. I loved this medication, took everyday at 9, but if I missed a night I would bleed the next morning and keep bleeding for a week. Don't miss a pill but loved this medication.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.
Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I'm having the Mirena removed after 2 years.  I have no sex drive, gained 30 lbs., horrible mood swings and forever having my peroid.  I dont know what to do.  I'm 28 don't want to have kids but dont want permant fix for a few more years till I'm really sure.  Seems all birth control has horrible side affects.  I cant deal with being chubby crying all the time.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: The first 6 months was rough with cramps and spotting but I love it now and it totally took care of the abnormally long and heavy periods.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I've had the mirena for about a year and a half.  Everything was going well until I started getting a discharge.  Then approx. 4 months later, I noticed a horrible smell coming from my vagina and the discharge. I am happily married and have never encountered such an awful weird smell so I was very nervous about it all but discovered it was vaginosis and thought it was really weird since I had never had anything like this before.  The antibiotic seemed to have worked but here we are again about 2 months later and I think I have it again.  I've setup an appointment with my doctor to get checked out but I'm going to ask her to remove it.  My husband is really upset with the whole mirena idea and disagreed with it stopping a period alltogether since our bodies were made to have a period at least once a month.  I think I'll just stick to birth control pills to control my blood flow and cramping, this isn't worth it.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I never write reviews, but after seeing these I felt like I had to weigh in (and I'm glad I didn't read any before starting this pill). I'm now about to begin my second month, and this pill was a lifesaver. I have TERRIBLE periods usually, and my period this time around was barely even spotting. Just some cramps here and there. No weight gain. Give it a try yourself before listening to the scary comments -- clearly every body is different.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I had this put in because of endometreosis and very bad menstrual times...insertion was not bad at all but had pain medicine before hand ask for the meds I have never had children so I needed the medicine...its not bad and I have a low tolerance for pain
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I had been bleeding for 5 months when i finally had an ultrasound performed. I had 1 fibroid said the doctor. I had it removed, I still bled. I had Mirena inserted 3 weeks later to stop the bleeding. I wish i would've listened to my instinct and not had the Mrena inserted because I have: sudden shortness of breath, chest/jaw/left arm pain, confusion, sudden dizziness/fainting, pain/swelling/warmth in the groin/calf, tingling/weakness/numbness in the arms/legs, headaches that are different from those I may have experienced in the past (e.g., headaches with other symptoms such as vision changes/lack of coordination sudden/very severe headaches), slurred speech, weakness on one side of the body, vision problems/changes.

Oh, and when I went to the doctor, she said it had nothing to do with the Mirena. She tried to prescribe anti anxiety medicine. I knew I wasnt crazy so I went to 2 different doctors since. Not 1 doctor agrees with me that Mirena has an adverse affect. 

Went and had another ultrasound performed....(only 1 and a half mos. later) I have several fibroids left in my uterus. 

Mirena does not work for me and I would take an accidental overflow in public  over the side effects i am experiencing. It is very painful for me too.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I started taking minastrin, like everyone else here I assume, after they discontinued Loestrin 24 fe. I loved loestrin and I was told minastrin was similar. Well for starters its chewable and it did the job of making sure I had lighter periods, but on the down side it did slow my metabolism way down and I gained around 15-20lbs so that was a major downside. I did not have any breakthrough bleeding but I did have a very low sex drive which my husband noticed immediately. No mood swings but I was extra-sensitive. Anyway I would have stayed on, but my new insurance doesn't cover it. I would recommend that you at least try. Everyone is different. Now I am on the new generic Loestin 24 called Lomedia. sigh, I hate change but hopefully everyone has good luck with their minastrin!!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been on this for about 3 months now. At first, I was fine with little to no symptoms. I had some spotting, but I figured it would go away later on. In the past month or so, the spotting has gotten worse - it occurs every other week, lasting 3-4 days long. It started making me feel bloated too. This pill was not for me.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena inserted 3/11, it started working right away!  The flow of my current cycle was lessoned to just two days- the day I got the IUD and the next day. I need to comment on the pain because many of the reviews scared me.  The pain was MINIMAL.  I did not even winch.  I have had worse menstrual cramps that last a whole lot longer!  Go in with a positive attitude, ask questions and relax.  So far I love the Mirena.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have been taking this pill for 2 months now and I actually can't say I have experience any of the side effect mention.  It has help me with my flow.. I have lighter flow and no pain.  It's great.  I have taken several other pill in the past and nothing has work like this one.  If things changes I let u guys know.  Thanks..
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I was horrified at the thought of taking this birth control after reading most reviews. My doctor assured me that it was one of her favorites and it would help with my severe cramping and heavy periods. After beginning the medication I did have some slight side effects, with breast tenderness and would wake up with stomach pain.  I decided to continue with it like my doctor said and give the medication at least 3 months. Within my second pack of the pills all of my side effects have subsided and I have not had any issues whatsoever. My periods have are nothing more than light spotting and last about 4 days. I could not be happier.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I was put on this drug to regulate my periods.  Flow varies, but periods are much much lighter and shorter.  This month I didn't have a period.  I have not experienced nausea, mood swings, breast tenderness.  I have gained weight but it was also taken over the holidays so I cannot attribute it to the pill.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have never been happier to say that i'm officially off this pill. Never having more than a few breakouts the week before my period, i now have cystic acne and scarring. I'm an exercise freak with a great diet that turned to the eating of constant shit since this pill. I've never had a bigger appetite in my life and been more unhappy and exhausted all the time. I've taken 2 trips to the emergency rooms because my already risky migraines went to flames on this pill. I would never recommend this for anyone it ruins all the good things about your body and causes severe mood/depression. Whoever invented this should lose their job.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I wish I would have found this site sooner!!!  What a nightmare these last 6 months have been.  I concur with all who have stated Minastrin causes bloating, headaches, moodiness, depression, fatigue, and WEIGHT GAIN!!!  OMG...TO THE TUNE OF 18 LBS!!!!!!!!!  and it was almost immediate for the weight gain.  Like others, I discussed with my doctor, was told let's just try it a lil longer.  What a dumb ass I've been!  
What I'd like to know is that for those of you that DID finally come off this med, how long before you "felt better"...emotionally, physically, etc.  I am up 4 skirt sizes since Apr.  I'm only 5'3"....ANY amount of weight is instantly noticeable on my frame.  I can deal with the crazy factor this drug seems to provide me with, its' the weight gain I gotta do away with.  Can anyone share their experience with me?  BTW, I quit taking this pill last night.  only needed for regulating monthly cycle, not BC.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on and off birth control since the age of 14 (I am now 21 yo) and the reason has never been for contraception but for irregularity.  My doctor gave me Minastrin because they just received samples.  I hate that its chewable, it makes me feel as if it stays on my teeth and I cannot wash it away with water.  I thought I was crazy about my weight gain until I read all of these reviews.  I have actually increased exercise and maintained my healthy diet (maybe even improving it in recent months) and I have gained crazy weight! My breasts BLEW UP.  They are so tender and are just gargantuan.  It hurts to sleep on my stomach because they are so tender and my overall weight gain has to be around 10 lbs or more.  My mood is also very down in the dumps.  I have always been sensitive to hormones and so my moods often dip to almost depressive and I will say that being on this pill has had a negative effect on my mood.  I have also had increased headaches and cramps that I did not have before and this is occurring when I am not on my period.  The only thing that this pill has done for me is make my cycle more regular, but it has not lessened my flow, which is very very heavy.  I gave this pill  about five months to see if my body and mood would level out over time and it hasn't.  I am immediately stopping this drug.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on the pill for about 6 months now, and I have gained 95 pounds. I have been on birth control since I was 11 years old due to my period issues (I am now 24). I have been going to the doctor, trying to figure out why I was gaining so much weight at such a rapid pace. I've also noticed I am fatigued (which could be from the weight gain too) and I have lost a lot of my libido. As far as actual periods, they come and go - I didn't have one last month, but then had 2 days of light bleeding this month, however the cramps were horrible. The pill is great if you don't want to deal with a normal cycle period and flow. However, I don't feel the other side effects (weight gain, mood swings) justify staying on it. Hope this helps!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I was on Minastrin 24 fe for 7 months. The first couple of weeks I experienced the usual very minor symptoms, such as minor nausea and spotting as my body adjusted. The first 4 months I began bleeding a couple of days before I took the brown pills, the amount lessening as the months went on. 5th month was fine. The 6th month, I began bleeding halfway through my pack and bled for 14 days straight. This month (month 7) the same has happened again, and I am now switching pills. 

I did notice that I became more emotionally sensitive and depressed while taking this pill, and felt nauseas a lot more often than usual. But my periods became so much lighter and almost all of my PMS symptoms went away, I didn't gain any weight, didn't get any acne, and I'm not pregnant, so I guess I can't complain too much.

Also, having a chewable birth control pill and having to make sure you constantly have 8 oz of water with you at the time you take it is extremely inconvenient.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been taking the medication for about a week now and I'm suffering horribly. I have been experiencing severe headaches and stomach aches. I have horrible joint pain in my shoulder, knee, and lower back. I'm unbelievably moody and it's becoming a problem. I got put on the medication direct after never being on any medicines, so I'm not sure if it's because of that or the medicine itself. I cannot take a full month of this.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I am very disappointed in this pill! I started taking this pill and 2 weeks into taking it I noticed bloating and gassy feeling, stomach cramping and abnormal bleeding in between periods, lasting over 10 days!!! I have not taken birth control in over 30 years and this was recommended to stabilize my cycle and assit with cramping and heavy bleeding. Did I mention that my breast are constantly sore and I have no sex drive whatsoever--although I have been bleeding longer than a normal period so when can i even have sex?
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I began taking Minastrin to help with my PMDD
I began on a Sunday start and realized I had several reactions to the Rx.  Headaches all of the time, cyst like breakouts on my face and weight gain after I recently lost 13lbs. And talk about emotional and moodiness.  I would snap in an instant. For my sanity, I stopped taking the pill and waiting to start a new RX
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Overall great experience. Helped me go from awfully heavy long periods to almost nothing. Only down side is weight gain.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: i am miserable with this oral pills. Out of work and was rush to ER thought i had appendicitis .Very painful menstruation and bloated for side effect. I act like incredible hulk i snap!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been taking this medication for not even a week and I have been experiencing dizziness and headache when I don't eat for a while, I get to feeling sick to my stomach. I have had to keep up with having food in my stomach. Hoping this will ease up over time
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I had been on loestrin for about 2 years and then when that wasn't being made anymore my doctor switched me to minestrin and absolutely nothing has changed! No weight gain, no acne, no bloating, no weird periods, and well I'm not pregnant. If your doctor wants to put you on this, don't be afraid to give it a chance.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
Thought I was crazy until I came on here to see these reviews; thank God I did and caught it before wasting months on this pill!

Here are some of the symptoms I've exerienced:
-Nausea, EVERY day EVERY meal. Not okay.
-Diarrhea, Gas, Bloating (Stomach is always heavy)
-Acid Reflux
-Worsened my food allergies? 
-Anxiety attacks (Never had one before either)
-ALWAYS TIRED; I've taken so many naps
-Mood swings!! I was so depressed at some points
-Foggy brained/Unable to focus

The horrible nausea has made me lose ALL of my appetite. Literally, I haven't been hungry while taking it... I just ate out of habit and when I did, the nausea set in and then acid reflux, etc. It is HORRIBLE. I was on another birth control for over a year and it never did anything like this to me! 

I wasn't even a month into this pill pack before I realized it wasn't worth the horrible side effects. Loestrin 24 never did this to me when I tried it in the past. I'm trying Lomedia...... This pill was a waste of time and effort.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I had abnormally long periods for the entire month & sometimes longer so my insurance wouldn't pay for a albration that my Dr. first want to do. My insurance requested Mirena instead. My periods still lasted the month & sometimes heavy w/ cramping, a little back pain every now & then, bloating, a little weight gain, & a whole lot of stretch marks on my abdomen/ stomach & was heading to my breast & itching, yeast infection, bacteria vaginosis, pimples on my chest, arms, back, neck, & face. I really did not like this experience at all & it made my self esteem go down because of all the markings it left on my body. I was also having itching & hives on my face, neck, stomach & legs. I definitely had it taken out & praying my insurance will now cover the albration. We will see.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
was given this for heavy painful periods.  Periods did lighten but lasted 7-10 days, pain was to the point it interupted my everyday life for 2 weeks a month. Painful intercourse, pain between periods.  Treatment resulted in hysterectomy 9 days before mirena was due to be removed.

Other side effects:
hair loss on head
hair growth on body
acne
weight gain
headaches
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
MIRENA CAUSED MY HAIR TO FALL OUT. 

Two weeks after Mirena was installed (for the purpose of spotting) my hair started falling out to the degree that my kids thought I was going bald and the hair in the tub covered the drain. I tried not to brush my hair since it would just fall out. I had to 'roll' my clothes to pick up all the hair several times a day. 

I saw 2 dermatologists who confirmed hair loss but had no idea why.  I had a full battery of bloodwork done which came back NORMAL.  My hairdresser couldn't deny the hair loss either.  

It wasn't until I removed the Mirena 5 months later that my hair stopped falling out. My ponytail was around 1/4 -3/8" in diameter at that point.  Thankfully, 2 weeks after having the Mirena removed, there was new hair growth.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Following up from a review about a week ago. I have now started bleeding/spotting and having cramps every day for 5 days on my second week of the pack. Just as miserable as I was before I started any birth control. Now it's actually worse because of the cramps. At least with the never-ending period, I wasn't cramping.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I tried Mirena a year ago at my doctor's suggestion and a lot of personal research.  Mirena was to help relieve the extremely heavy periods and cramping that I have experienced since I started having cycles.  The insertion was slightly painful, just for the fact the strings were caught in the tool used to insert it and pulled the device back out.  Once it was inserted the cramping continued for a couple of days, but my cycle continued for another seven-10days, I chalked this up to the insertion and hormones.  I then experienced "spotting" and periods as irregular as could be.  One month about 2 weeks after my "period‚Äù and I started "spotting" and continued for 3 weeks.  Other months I would have a period or "spotting" for 2 weeks on and 1 week off or 1 week on and 2 weeks off.  I never really knew when I was going to "start" and definitely never knew if and or when I would stop.  I finally made the appointment to have the Mirena removed in 2 weeks, but this is after "spotting" from Feb 21, 2013 until Mar 22,2013 = 4 weeks.  Until I had a conversation with my OB nurse, I did not fully realize the depression, weight gain/inability to lose, and a few other issues  I have been experiencing for the past year may have been exacerbated by this this device.  Mirena might be the best thing for many, but for me it has been far from it and I cannot wait until it has been removed.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I was spotting between periods WITH daily cramps ( no buenos) seriously considered hysterectomy because couldn't figure out problem. Extreme nausea. Switched to 
LoMedia and was back to normal.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Experiencing severe migraines and severe pain during intercourse,nausea abdominal pain among other things.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Had a never-ending period, lasting on and off with spotting and full-on for about 7 months. Always had irregular periods, but that was just crazy. Went to doc, prescribed me this, insurance won't pay for it, so I'm going to have to switch eventually. But so far, Minastrin has controlled my period and managed to bring it to a screeching halt after only 2 pills. I am anxious to see what happens when I get to the placebos, though. The only side-effects that I've noticed have been that I've developed new acne. I haven't had acne since high school. =/ So that's a bummer. And I also have managed to get 2 cold sores within 2 weeks of taking this pill. But as for my period? I am satisfied with how it worked on that.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I got my mirena in about a week ago, so I am just gonna post about my insertion experience which was mainly positive. I took 1 ibuprofen the night before and the following morning of the procedure. Then before I left for the procedure took 2 ibuprofens. Getting it in did hurt, there were 3 cramps, the first one was like noting, the second was a mild period cramp and the third was the measuring the cervix part which does hurt like a 6-7/10 kinda like a bad period cramp but it only lasts a few seconds. I walked out of the doctors office and spent the rest of my day running errands with little to no cramping. The following day I worked out and had no cramps. My gyno recommended I get a heating pad but I never needed to use it. The procedure wasn't bad for me but I may have a higher pain tolerance for things too. The only problem I have experience thus far was an episode of kinda a sharp pain going up my spine but it lasted like 2 minutes and I have never had something like that happen before so. Assume it was a mirena symptom but it wasn't bad I would consider getting the iud out. I recommend that when you're going in for your procedure don't over-think the procedure because really it's not that bad and I am only 20 and I have never been pregnant.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Contrary to most of the reviewers on here- I love this pill. I took loestrin 24 fe and it made me an emotional mess. And I had breakthrough bleeding and longer periods. I've been on minastrin for 3 months- (just finished the 3rd pack) and it's been good to me. I did have breakthrough bleeding during the first month, but none after that. Everyone's bodies react different to these birth controls. I wouldn't dare tel someone else not to take the pill because I had a bad experience. We have different things going on in out bodies. Take different medication and all have different gene makeup. I say to anyone who is thinking about this pill- try it for yourself. I real all the negative reviews before taking the pill- have it a shot. And I love it-  good luck and go with your gut!  BTW- I do not work for the manufacturing company- nor am I getting paid for writing a positive comment!  This is my actual experience!  Good day ladies! ;-)
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I started taking this medication on the first day of my period and since then I have had NONSTOP, HEAVY bleeding. Some days, I have to change my tampon 6 or 7 times. I also feel nauseous, bloated, and always have headaches. Also, I have extremely clear skin. I have maybe 2 zits a month total. But once I started taking Minastrin 24 fe, I constantly have acne. As in like 10 zits on my face at a time and more as soon as the others are gone. I am extremely unhappy with this product and am asking my doctor for other options!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: It has worked wonderfully. No noticeable weight gain and my periods have already stopped. I had very mild cramping on insertion and for a month or so after, but nothing bad. So many horror stories, but it has been a blessing for me so far.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I've had my Mirena now for a week and so far so good!  Only a little spotting and a few mild to moderate cramps but that's it.  

The insertion process was not the most comfortable in the world but it only took a few minutes.  Going to have it checked in a week to make sure it's still in the right place.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have taken Loestrin 1/20 for many years and in the past three years taken Loestrin 24 fe.  It has been the best birth control for me.  My skin is beautiful, my moods great, controls my crazy periods.  Then my pharmacy gave me this horrible pill in October.   My skin now has huge cysts and pimples.  I am moody and cry a lot.  And now I keep spotting.  Nothing else in my life that changed except for taking Minastrin.  I am going back to to my pharmacy to have them change my precription to something else.  Why would they change something that was so great? Very disappointed.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.
Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I did not do all the research...I wish I did.  I just received the Mirena September 2012 and these few months have been terrible.  From September 19th until November 19th my cycle stayed on, then my cycle came back on December 5th and it has been on continuously.  So on Monday December 24th I had the Mirena removed.  On Christmas Day the cramps were unbelievable but I survived.  These few days have been blood clots the size of quarters every time I use the bathroom...I use Tampax plus Always to stay protected.  I don't know how long my cycle will be on but I heard it will be at least three months...One of my doctors gave me a pill to regulate the bleeding.  I was not sure if I should continue to take the pill because I thought the pill was causing all this bleeding.  My doctor also suggesting a shot very similar to the "depo" shot but this shot actually puts you in a state of menopause for a few months but she said once I am done with that after three months my cycle is suppose to come back much worse than before....So I wasn't sure if I should get the shot which I believe was called Lupron...Has anyone ever had that before?  I will keep you updated on my progress...  I don't mind seeing my Cycle come but at this point I want it gone forever...Why would a doctor suggest for you to get an IUD that causes so many problems....I should have done my research Shame on Me and Shame on my doctor for telling me about this IUD
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: 9 days into taking this pill, I am nauseous, ravenously hungry, depressed, bloated, cramping and exhausted from experiencing anxiety attacks in the middle of the night. I thought I was going crazy until I read these reviews. Thank you to everyone who has posted their side effects here so that I can see it's not me, it's this pill. I'm not taking it any more! I just requested the Lomedia 24 FE and I'll give that a try.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I just started taking this medication on 01/25/2014 which was the first day of my cycle and Ive been spotting for then on out ever since. its also makes me moody, my ankles are swelling alot and cramps lastig longer than usual. I never took bc before as this is my first time, Im 29 years old and need to regulate my heavy periods. But my main concern is at night my right arm tingles and aches with pain. Last night my lips kinda started feeling numb, the whole right side of my body in fact. I thought I was having a stroke. Since I never took bc before I just figured my body needs to adapt but after reading the reviews these symtoms are long lasting. Therefore, i'll be switching to another brand after my next appointment. Overall Im disappointed.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I am a mother of two kids and I wish I had read the patient reviews before I decided to get Mirena. Even if I had, I, like many of you probably would have discounted them.  The insertion process was exceptionally difficult-- with my doctor becoming very stressed and frustrated and having to insert some contraption to ‚Äústabilize‚Äù my uterus. It was very painful.  It took about an hour, and my doctor said she was thankful I was on my period, otherwise she could not have inserted Mirena at all.   The next three weeks were also problematic.
