After the first week and a half of extreme pain I finally went to the ER thinking that the lining of my uterus had been perforated (punctured).  After all the tests, I was surprised to find that everything was ‚Äúokay‚Äù with the IUD.  I am not a wimp about pain.  I have degenerative spine disease so I am in pain every day and often in extreme pain.  The pain from this IUD was bad enough that I went to the ER.  The second problem is the resulting depression and weight gain.  I am normally a very happy upbeat person, but have been consistently depressed since I got Mirena, and now it is so bad that I was considering going to get depression medication(!)  The ironic thing is that there hasn‚Äôt been any change to my life, and there is absolutely no reason for me to be depressed.  In addition, I have been hungry ALL the time.  It used to be that I would have a crazy appetite for a few days before my period, but now, that is the norm.  I‚Äôve only gained about 8 lbs, but that is by fighting it all the time.  I‚Äôm thankful for all your reviews, because otherwise I would not have been so sure it was the Mirena.  For those of you who are ‚Äòblaming the victim‚Äô in your reviews, be thankful you have not been adversely affected, but never assume that their (our) symptoms are not real.  I will have the Mirena IUD removed in the next few weeks and I will report back.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I agree the insertion was VERY painfull ( I almost passed out) but overall I loved it! I still had a light spotting for 3-4 days every month but very tollerable compared to what I  was dealing with before. After 2 years I had it removed ( not bad at all, similar to the contraption the use for PAP smear removal) I had it removed November 10th, today is December 6th, I've expirenced very sensitive breasts both last month and again now (last month I grew an entire cup size) I'm not sure if its from stress or from d/c the Mirena, and I have taken 3 tests since and am not pregnant (so far). I definatly would get another in the future, price per year its well worth it!!! My will-be-husband is quite large and said he never "felt" the strings during intercourse, I had no worries about forgetting to take it, and when I would spot, it became like clock work every month same day start. Saved money on feminine hygene products ( bought 1 box of reg. tampons lasted 3  months vs. 1 month... I was a heavy bleeder) I would reccomond this for any woman to at least try, If you're expierencing constant pain CALL YOUR DOC!!! The Mirena could've shifted and is puncturing your uterus.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.
Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had mirena put in in March of 2010 and have been bleeding/spotting continually for 8 months.  I expected this to last up to 6 months, but this is ridiculous.  I can't even tell when I am actually having my period.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: This medication helps with heavy flooding perimenopause periods and night sweats. I'm 45 and will stay on this until 51 or menopause.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.
Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been stacking Microgestin for about a year now. I switched from another type because I wanted something with a lower dose of estrogen. I have had no periods or spotting, very little cramping, and it has helped to stabilize my moods which are all over the place without birth control. I do have a bit extra puffiness and tiredness since taking birth control but the side effects seem to ease when stacking consistently. This is worth it to me since my periods cause intolerable pain and heavy bleeding that resulted in nil ferritin levels. Overall, everyone√¢??s body is different and there is no one pill that works for everyone, but this seems like the right one for me. I should note that I do not rely on this as a method of birth control.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I was on Loestrin for 2 years with very few side effects.  Minastrin has made me miserable.  Moody, cramping, acnes... awful!!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Ive been taking this pill for well over 6 mths. Initially, I bled for almost 6 weeks, while my body adjusted to the hormones. My doctor continued to reassure me to continue taking it. Finally the bleeding stopped, days into the 2nd pack of pills. I started the pill to regulate irregular periods. My period has been more irregular since starting. Out of a 3 week pack, I usually only have maybe 2 solid weeks where I don't bleed at all. That's the equivalent of having a period every 2 weeks! It's just not worth it for me!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I had the Mirena IUD inserted six weeks ago for abnormally heavy periods.  My periods lasted two weeks out of four and the bleeding was so heavy, I became anemic.  Insertion was a breeze--I had no pain at all.  There may have been a little cramping here and there after the first day, but not enough to be notable.  Since I have had the device, I have had a period for five of the six weeks which I'm not thrilled about, but the bleeding has ranged from light spotting to a light flow.  As for side effects, I do have them, but they are all positive:  I have an increased sex drive and my sleep has improved.  I have not gained weight or experienced moodiness. I'm hoping that the spotting curtails in the next few weeks. 

My 24-year old daughter has used the device for birth control for 2 years and she loves it.  No periods at all and nothing to remember.  As for side effects, perhaps she has a little acne, but that's a small price to pay.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I just discovered that I have been taking Minastrin instead of my usual Loestrin 24 FE.  I am not pleased at all with this change.  I have headaches, dizziness, very tender breasts, and am sick or feel bloated most of time.  I made an appointment with my doctor because I have all the symptoms of being pregnant.  My pharmacy did not alert me to this change.  I have been taking this pathetic excuse for a substitute since November 15th.  I am very upset, the changes this drug has made to my body and how I feel is horrible.  I go to my doctor today, I am over 35 and now am going to have to face a pregnancy test after years of being on the trusted Loestrin.  I'm not happy.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Obviously everyone will have different side effects of experiences with this birth control, but personally, I do not like it. I haven't ended up pregnant yet ( have been taking for almost 3 months) but I have not had pleasant experiences. I was on Loestrin 24 FE for one month before having to switch, my period was barely there and was amazing! When I switched to Minastrin, I got moodier and more easily agitated. My period was almost just as heavy as before I started bc.  I also had my painful cramps and sore back again. I have had a decreased sex drive. And now, near the end of my 2nd month, I am having heavier bleeding than what would happen on my period. This has been going on for 5 days and I am just now on my last active pill. This birth control has not been anything but a hassle and if this irregular bleeding doesnt stop, I will be switching. I am not on birth control to have the same periods as before. I wish Loestrin would come back!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Medication has worked very well for me especialy with my menstrual periods.. I went from 8 days to 1 1/2 days. very satisfied.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I am taking the medication for about 2 years  due to moderate to severe anemia. I am avoiding periods and have 3-4 periods a year with the pills. It works. However, my skin got unevenly darker (especially my neck),  my face and ears are itching all the time. Sometimes I have cramps in my pelvic area. It is tolerable, but of course I wish I had less irritation with the pills.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been taking this medication for only a week to get my hormones back on track and keep me from having an irregular period almost every day. So far the medicine is doing well at it. I haven't had any spotting since I started it. However my right ovary has started to throb and ache randomly through the day. My sex drive is lower (not gone) but for me personally, that's a good thing. I'm going to stop taking the meds and talk to my doctor about it after the holidays. I haven't been on it long enough to feel any of the emotional drawbacks others have described.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena IUD put in because I didn't have very good luck with the depo shot. Days after getting Mirena I got my period and I have had it ever since, that was three weeks ago. I have been bleeding very heavily and have had very large blood clots. I went back into see my doctor and was given a shot that I was told would help stop the bleeding. The blood clots stopped but the bleeding is still very heavy. Now for the last two days I've had a pinching feeling where Mirena was placed. This has been miserable. Between the Depo and Mirena I've had my period for 9 weeks.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I have been taking this med for about 9 mos. now and have only had 2-3 bleedings of 2-3 days each. Maybe they're periods, maybe stray bleeding. The doctor says it's nothing to worry about. I still get PMS symptoms, but no blood. That's what was making me itch. The doctor says I was allergic to my own menstrual blood. I am fixed, so birth control was never an issue. Weight gain has not been an issue with this med, but fainting and fatigue have.
It's hard to remember to take one of those pills EVERY night even though I have reminder alarms everywhere.
I also expect it has worsened my acid reflux and frequent stomach pain.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I was originally put on LoEstrin for a uterine fibroid to help reduce pain and bleeding and LoEstrin worked great! Since switching to Minastrin it has gotten increasingly worse and my blood pressure has been high since starting Minastrin 3 months ago.  I have never had blood pressure issues until I started Minastrin.  From reading the posts, I could bet some others are having blood pressure issues and may not even realize.  I think it is ridiculous that the company switched Loestrin to Minastrin so they could continue to make gobs of money!!  (From what I understand, it's time limit was up where others would be able to produce a generic....that's why they changed the pill and changed the name...then other companies could not provide a generic)  They need to go back to Loestrin.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: It hasn't been horrible taking this. I had a lot of spotting the first week I began taking it, and very tender breasts pretty much the first month but since then it's subsided. I see a lot of other people have said it causes libido to go down as well as lack of lubrication. I can (quite happily) say I haven't had problems with that! My periods are also significantly "better", better meaning that I don't spend five days curled up in bed. I can be a lot more active and since I'm in college I can't afford to miss classes every month. This pill changed everything. It's not 100% perfect, and you have to be on top of taking it, not just to prevent pregnancy, but to help keep it all regulated. Hope this review helps!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: While a reliabale source of birth control and a blessing for heavy periods this device has made my life miserable. I have had it for nine months and have spotted nearly every day, with incessant cramps since day one. I'm sick of living on Aleve and having to use period protection every day. I will have it removed soon.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have been bleeding for 2 1/2 weeks now straight from this birth control pill. It'll give me one day then come right back and start all over again! Also I've been angry when I wake up and didn't understand why until I did more research about this pill!!!! I have more mood swings and in a minute no one is going to be around me...lol! I had to quit taking them they just make me sick!!!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I HATE this pill. I was on LoEstrin 24 FE for years and never had an issue. Nothing in my life has drastically changed but now I am almost 10lbs heavier, acne like crazy, cramps when I'm not on my period and am ALWAYS bloated. I hate it.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been reading horror stories about some people's experiences with Mirena, and I have to say I have not experienced any of these problems.  Insertion was a dream - no pain, no discomfort, no cramping, no use of ibuprofen... and the nurse had warned me.  I had Mirena inserted about a month ago.  I have had light to moderate spotting the last couple of weeks, slightly heavier this week since this is the week of my period.  So far, this is WAY better than the extremely heavy periods I was having.  But, its also early in my experience.  Time will tell, but so far so good.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Switched to this birth control after being on Lo Loestrin Fe for about a year, as it was the cheaper option. Within a few weeks, I would cry for no reason at all and feel extremely irritable at times. Then came the cramps, breast tenderness, and bloated feeling when on my period‚Äîsymptoms that I never dealt with when on Lo Loestrin Fe. I have recently become depressed and stopped taking this pill. I cannot wait to switch back to my old birth control. Thought it was just my body adjusting but after 3 months I can definitely say that I am not satisfied with this pill.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Mirena has been a wonderful choice for me. I couldn't take birth control anymore due to my age and my blood pressure. I had heavy periods as well. Mirena was not comfortable to have placed, but after three months, the cramping stopped, my periods stopped and I had no side effects. My sex drive is better than ever and I have had no pregnancies. I would highly recommend Mirena. I am not looking forward to having it removed, as the strings did move up into my uterus but the doctor said he will just have to use a tool to extract when I want it removed. So if you are thinking of trying it, I think you should!! Don't listen to all the side effects of others, it is good to know because I researched it long and hard before deciding but everyone's body is different.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I was on lo-estrin originally for six months due to heavy and long periods.  Lo-estrin worked magic.  I have been on minastrin for 2 months and noticed that I am incredibly moody, fatigued, lower sex drive, and a very serious case of dry mouth and nose.  I need to find a better alternative.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I had Mirena inserted after having a miscarriage.  I the insertion procedure was not painful it was the cramping that followed that was horrible! It was so painful that I passed out and vomited.  I have had it in for 2 years now and have not had a period for the last year and a half.  I have had considerable weight gain even with exercise. I am an avid runner, running everyday and my diet has not changed but I continue to get bigger. I feel like I am constantly pregnant.  My breasts have increased in size.  I get intense side pain/cramping which my OB/GYN assures me that it is just ovarian cysts that is common with an IUD.  Which how can ovarian cysts be common?? I am seriously contiplating having it removed because the symptoms are not going away.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I absolutely hate this medication. Like some of you, I was switched from loestrin to this med. In the last two years my period had almost subsided. It took this bc only one month to reverse that. Heavy bleeding this month. I'm not staying on it any longer. Very disappointed!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I been on this pill for about 2 years . The one thing I noticed was my lack of getting a period. I would spot alittle but I contacted my GYM and he said it was alright that some people adjust differently. I haven't had a real period in quite a while lets say. But at first I felt hungry but now my body has been way adjusted that  I don't feel any side affects too it. I would recommend this pill
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Due to prolonged heavy periods (heavy flow for 5-8 days) I became extremely anemic.  I had the Mirena IUD inserted in December 2008.  For the first year, I had irregular periods, but they were very light.  I also experienced hair loss, which has since stopped, and weight gain (almost 40 pounds!).  The biggest complaint I have is with the icky brown discharge that just won't let up.  And now, I'm suddenly having a slightly heavier period every 2 weeks.  When I'm not experiencing a "period" I'm going through brown discharge.  Needless to say, I'm dealing with a lack of sex life.  No fun for me or my hubby.  I'm tired of the discharge and the constant need for a light/regular tampon or liner.  I'm going to the doc tomorrow to see if there's something that can be done.  I went through a 2-week course of estrogen last winter that helped for awhile, but that has since stopped.  While the Mirena IUD has been great for slowing down the bleeding, it has caused enough side effects that I'd consider taking it out tomorrow if I could.  My husband has had a vascectomy so birth control is not an issue.  I've had 3 kids, which is probably why the insertion did not hurt at all--no worse than a pelvic exam.  In fact, I don't remember much about that.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Well, where to start, where to start. Ok, so I was on Sprintec birth control for about 3 years after having an ovarian cyst rupture. Sprintec controlled that problem, and it regulated my period, and, of course, it worked as a birth control (I assume, though I use condoms as well). Now, I didn't like the idea of being on my period for 6-7 days while most other females around me were having 4-5 day periods, so I asked around to see which birth controls were best for shortening/lightening periods. I came across Microgestin through a friend of mine. The first month I had started, it was like heaven for me. I had a day of light bleeding and that was it! The second month is when it started to get worse for me. On the 3rd week of active pills, I started spotting. I spotted until the week in which I was to have my actual period. I bled straight through for two weeks.I have always read that one needs to give a birth control at least 3 months to adjust to your body. I gave it 5. It just got worse and worse. Random bleeding throughout the month, unusually moody, and I always felt fatigued? I have finally decided that 6-7 days of a period is  better than spotting and then a period. Only good thing I found about this pill was that my boobs seem to have grown a bit. I don't recommend this pill to anyone. I read a lot of bad reviews on it before I decided to take it, and I should've listened.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I was on Loestren for over 8 years and it was a wonder drug. I had no problems, light periods, my acne was under control and no weight gain. I have been on Minastrin 24fe for a month and have gained 10 lbs. I am a tiny girl so this change out of nowhere can only be blamed on the pill. I feel sad and moody and my acne is out of control. I am stopping the pill at the end of the cycle in 7 days and hope I can get my life back. No birth control is worth all this nonsense. IT IS DEFINITELY NOT THE SAME PILL.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I loved Loestrin 24 Fe it worked well with me and my body and it had positive effects on my body. I was switched to Minastrin and was told it was the exact same. I've gained weight after taking the pill, started getting acne (what?), PAINFUL period cramps, and extreme bloating. It has increased my headaches and spotting has occurred. Not a fan of this, I am switching to the NuvaRing next month. Also it tastes bitter/sweet and I feel like it all gets stuck in your teeth because it is chewable, you cannot swallow it.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I was on Loestrin 24 fe for three years. I had no problems at all. I went to go pick up my bc from the pharmacy and the pharmacist told me that Loestrin has been discontinued and that minastrin is being used in its place. I have been on minastrin for 2 DAYS and I have noticed that I have been feeling super depressed and I cry for no reason. I didn't take minastrin today and I feel a lot better. Minastrin sucks.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I was switched to this pill because my other was discontinued. My 2nd week of taking this pill and I started bleeding again. I have been nauseous and experiencing headaches, mood swings and cramping. I am not pleased with this pill and will be switching
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have happily declined free generic pills and paid hundreds of dollars over the years for Loestrin 24 FE. This was the only b.c. that seemed to control my explosive periods with zero side effects, so the cost was worth it to me. Since the change to Minastrin 24 FE, I have had constant nausea to the point where I am losing sleep and I never had that with Loestrin 24 FE. I have had crazy mood swings as well as weight gain (which is insane since I can't hardly eat with all the nausea). I don't understand why making the tablet chewable was necessary, but in my experience it hasn't had a taste at all. I haven't had a period during the 2 months I've taken the new pill- took a test just to rule that out and it was negative. It seems to be working ok, but I am eager to visit my doctor to try something else. The cost is now not worth it to me, as I see it as I'm volunteering to feel sick, fat and mean all the time.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I initially went on Microgestin to regulate myself and because my periods were increasingly painful, to the point where i could not get off the ground. Whereas this took that away, it also took my entire period away. I haven't had a period since May, and it is now August. Which is fine and dandy, but my moods have been everywhere, and as of right now i've been spotting for three weeks straight. I'll get slight cramps every so often, but it's rare.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: This has been the worst birth control I√¢??ve ever taken. My mood has just been sad all the time; I feel like I√¢??m walking around with an umbrella over my head all the time and I have been so anxious and moody. I have also had horrible stomach cramping.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: This is the only birth control that has helped me with my periods. Since I was a teen my periods were super heavy and lasted a good week. I had horrible cramps throughout the entire time. I was skeptical at first as to how these would work for me but they have been a lifesaver. I have been taking these pills for approximately 8 months now. I could not live without these. From the very first month of taking these pills there was a drastic change. My periods were WAY less heavy. Every month has been better and better. Last month my period was non existent.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: This is the worst birth control ever.  My daughter has been on it for 6 months and is having horrible mood swings.  Either she is so sad she doesn't want to get out of bed or she is mad at the world.  Having her Dr change it immediately.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been really sad ever since I started taking this. I've been breaking out which I normally do not. And I have been eating more as well. I started spotting a lot and just felt so tired all day long. This pill makes you feel insane. Do not take it. I do not recommend it at all.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been using this pill since I switched from Tri-Sprintec a little over 7 months ago and I've had nothing but problems. I started taking it so I won't have heavy periods and desperately painful cramps, but now I have to deal with long periods and constant cramps! My periods have lasted up to two weeks on a regular basis - not to mention inconsistency and heavy spotting. When my fiancee and I started to talk more seriously about having sex, I found myself without a sex drive. I use to be ready for anything but ever since I've started this pill, I've haven't been in the mood at all. It makes my fiancee feel inadequate and I feel terrible about something that's not his fault... and don't get me started on mood swings! I'm either super depressed or super aggressive - there's rarely an in between for me. I spent entire weekends doing nothing but crying over nothing at all and once I've even had a suicidal thought. All my friends are worried about my sudden change in mood so I'm going to change pills next month... but I'm afraid of loosing my libido for good...
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I nearly died, landed in the ICU with Massive bilateral  pulmunary embolisms after taking this medication for 2 WEEKS, thats all, just 2 weeks. i had tests ran afterwards to be sure i did not have a clotting disorder and it was confirmed that it was from the medication.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been on this medication for almost 8 years now, and it's wonderful. I have yet to use it as a birth control, but it controls my periods wonderfully.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've always had some acne, but this birthcontrol made my skin TERRIBLE. I broke out so bad with tiny little bumps all over my face and I also got a good amount if big red pimples. Not only that, but I started taking this BC to help with my heavy two week long periods, but once I started taking this my periods became insanely heavy and remained two weeks long. I was GUSHING blood all the time and a lot of my underwear and pants have blood stains now because my period just overflowed so soon. Somedays it was so bad I would change my pad or tampon and withing 40 minutes it would be overflowing and completely full. Also I have been very sad a lot if the time, but I'm not sure if that is the pill or a seasonal thing.  I definitely did not like this pill and I switched to zarah. Hopefully I will have better results.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been taking Microgestin for 3 months and it is the first birth control I have ever been on. I am 5'2 about 125 lbs and I absolutely cannot stand this birth control. My breasts hurt without me even touching them; They have swollen and my clothes are tight even though that is the only part of my body that has gotten larger. I have random headaches and I get very VERY moody and short with people, even though I am normally quiet and patient. I hate how this medicine has changed me and even made my acne much worse than before I started it. I used to experience a lot of random spotting as well. Overall, I dread taking this every night. I am trying to switch to another bc in order to limit some of these side effects.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
Months 1-2= no cramping, came right on time, incredibly light, period lasted 1-3 days, no weight gain, no acne
Month 3= crazy mood swings, not myself, didn't feel motivated, hurt my family/boyfriend's feelings a lot.
months 4,5= felt normal again, happy in my relationships, acne normal, no weight gain still, period came a week early both months with lots of brown discharge and then bleeding the week of my period
month 6= period came right on time, mild cramping, no mood swings, acne normal, period not heavy but not as light as months 1-2
Overall, stick with this pill. It can be rocky, but I think i've gone through everything and am leveling out.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Took a while, but I'm starting to be happier with this medication. The first 2 months on microgestin, I felt really ill. I took it with dinner, but I would wake up in the middle of the night with extreme nausea. During the day I would be bloated / gassy, but I have IBS so this could be a side effect that others don't have. My periods have been regular and extremely light (no cramps, either), which is making me really happy considering normally my periods are a nightmare. No weight gain, acne, mood, sex drive, etc changes other people complain about that I've noticed, and now that I'm on my fourth pack I don't get any regular side effects unless if I take a pill on an empty stomach. This is my first bc and although I nearly quit during the 2nd month, I'm glad I stuck it out because I feel like I'm back to normal but minus the cramps / periods / awfulness that dominated my life several weeks out of the month before.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: My hormones were all over the place after having my second child. I was enraged one minute and crying the next. I was also breaking out all over and had the heaviest periods ever. After going on this birth control, my face is clear, my moods are stabilized, and my periods last a day or two max. I've also lost about 5 lbs. So happy to  be back to my old self!!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: My 15 yr. old started this BC last month after trying one other pill. She has had a headache for 13 days now, as well as dizziness, weakness, crying, and very tired. Been to three doctors in 10 days with no relief...think after reading these comments, she shouldn't continue this pill.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I love this birth control pill - I am taking Microgestin (generic of Loestrin FE) for a few reasons: abnormal periods and also for the obvious reason of birth control. I was worried that it would cause weight gain, but it hasn't. In fact, I have noticed a slight weight loss. I've been on the pill going on 3 months and have seen my weight fluctuate a little, up to as much as 5 lbs in a day. That's why I believe the weight gain associated with the pill may just be water retention and swelling. I recommend using a probiotic to help with water weight gain. I've found that it works like a diuretic.

And a side note ... Microgestin and Loestrin increase breast size. Have noticed a slight increase! This is a great pill. ;)
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have never had a problem with acne... I was on this medication for over a year (it was free under my insurance) and I broke out all of the time.  I would randomly get periods mid-month and I was extremely bloated and emotional. I eat very healthy and workout all the time so I did not gain too much weight but I did notice I was not as motivated to be active because I always felt gross.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I used to have irregular and heavy periods. While I do use this as my main birth control, the main reason I started using this pill was to do continuous cycling. I have been on this pill for 5+ years now and love it. I have never, ever had breakthrough bleeding, not even the first six months I started this pill. I have been on many other pills before this one, but they all gave me breakthrough bleeding. I never want to change my prescription for this pill, this has worked best for me.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 for four months now and I have an appointment to switch in two weeks. I have very long periods that are close together, 12-14 days on, 7-10 days off. I have taken multiple types of pills off and on for 16 years, taking time off for pregnancy and due to insurance costs at times. On this I have had break through spotting every couple of days with a one or two day period. I don't mind the short period but hate having to wear a pantyliner every days just in case. I have also been much more moody on this and being bi-polar already makes that an issue at times. This does help with my cramps, which makes life so much more bearable. But again, constant break through spotting is annoying and the mood swings are not worth it.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I abosolotley love this pill, other people seem to have major problems with it but it works wonders with me. sometimes my period would last to be a whole month long and now they are 3-4 days and they are very light. everybody is different and for me, it works.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Some light bleeding on and off and cramps during the first month. No issues since then.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been on this pill for 6 weeks now and haven't decided if I like it or not. My OBGYN prescribed it because I had incessant bleeding. My periods lasted two or three weeks and after many tests, she thought I should try a pill to regulate the bleeding. While this pill has helped tremendously with the bleeding(my last period lasted only four days),the side effects have me kind of concerned. Since taking the pill, I am tired all the time and ultra sensitive. I actually cried at work and I never do that! Although I am on antidepressants for a preexisting diagnosis, my depression has gotten worse since starting this pill. It feels like I am unhappy almost all of the time.If this pill didn't help so much to regulate my bleeding, I would seriously consider switching.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have now had my Mirena for almost 5 years and would recommend it to anyone considering it. I had extremely painful and heavy bleeding with my periods, since having the Mirena i have no pain and only rarely have period cramps. I usually only bleed lightly for 2-3 days (would probaly have no bleeding but am on long term anticoagulants).
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: My GYN started me on Microgestin prior to being considered for an ablation due to heavy, painful periods.  It has been a miracle for me!  I am perimenopausal and it has virtually made my symptoms disappear.  In the past, I had been on Ovral for about 20 years.  My partner had a vasectomy so I stopped, but when I started having heavy periods I knew I needed to do something.  I have not had one side effect.  I had a very scant period which lasted about 3 days; the last period I had prior to starting Microgestin was 10 days of the Red Sea!  What a difference.  I would suggest to all the ladies who have had problems to talk to their MDs and switch.  Everyone is different; not all BCPs are for everyone -- that's why there are so many out there.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I am 42 and have two kids.  I was having very heavy and long periods.  I did have polyps removed and mirena was recommended by Obgyn.  The 1st period was about the same then the 2nd was shorter and lighter only about 4 days.  This has continued hoping they will stop all the way but happy with this result.  I feel so much better.  No side effects at all for me.

Reviews: This is my 2nd month on this pill and ive been having breakthrough bleeding for 5 days now and i also had it last month for 3 days . I am really annoyed that i keep spotting randomly . Has anyone else had this side effect & if so did the break through bleeding stop ...
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: My experience with Mirena was a one time thing that lasted me about 13 months. I  experienced so much pain when I had my Mirena inserted, then my periods stopped for 6 months, then came back with a vengeance. During the time I had my Mirena I experienced problems with cysts on my ovaries multiple times. Finally during my 13th month I started bleeding so bad my doctor had to remove my Mirena. I couldn't have that done again between the pain and the bleeding problems that was enough for me. I'll take a pill everyday.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had my Mirena put in almost a month ago. I'm 22 and haven't had any children. My doctor recommended I get it because I am anemic and she was concerned that I was losing too much blood during my periods. Surprisingly, when it was put in I wasn't in much more pain than my normal cramps during my period. But when the time came for my period to start 2 weeks later I started getting terrible cramps. Normally either a Midol or a heating pad would work to stop the pain, but even with both I was in so much pain that it was hard to get out of bed. I decided to look it up on the internet to see if that was normal and I came across a couple discussions similar to this one. It's a relief to know that the side effects I'm experiencing aren't all in my head. I've noticed terrible cramping, non-stop bleeding (lighter flow though), no motivation/extreme fatigue, depression... I have not ran into acne or weight gain but I'm worried that it'll only be a matter of time. I know everyone's body reacts differently and it may take a while to truly know how my body will adjust to the Mirena, but after reading others' experiences, I can't help but want the thing out... now! I suppose it's serving the purpose my doctor and I set out for by lightening my periods, but at what cost?
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: i have used this bc for about 3 yrs now. i love it so i thought id share it. the first month or so i would have to say my body needed to adjust to it, feeling a bit sick but got over it fast. didnt gain weight, didnt lose weight. cleared up my ance when i used it, but in the past year or so i have had acne problems dont think it has anything to do with the pills tho. i started the pills because my periods were so severe that i was basically bed ridden the first two days and going thru a tampon pad double up every hour! my doctor say i can get my period up to every 3 months on the pill too, by just skipping the period pill weeks and starting a new pack. (this i loved) gettin a period every 3 months. yes please. been very satisified on the pill for years!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I received the Mirena 10/10 for heavy periods, and severe emotional behaviors. I could not take hormonal contraceptives because of my history of severe (daily prescription drug treated) migraines and my cycle was beginning to be unbearable. My last child was born in 07 and in 09 I began having reoccurrent bacteria vaginosis problems (consistently). Since the mirena, my labibdo remains high, no weight gain, migraines haven't increased, periods are much lighter, OH but there is a big BUT!!! Since 10/10 I will have what appears to be periods for at least 3 to 10 days twice a month and most of the time without any warning. Now the procedure was 20 mins but it was guided ultrasound, it felt a little bit more uncomfortable then a pap, holding my inhaling and exhaling when my doc told me to helped. Its something one has to weigh their pros and cons and the reasoning for using this device. I will say that I am exploring other another option that does not involve the use of any non/hormonal drugs,or insertions of devices. I am either going to keep the Mirena or go the surgical route.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I was so nervous getting the Mirena due to all the negative reviews and I have been so sensitive to birth control pills; gaining weight; acne etc. in the past it was only in desperation I decided to take the plunge and go on the Mirena and I am so glad I did. My period was getting so heavy over the past year I became iron deficient, therefore loosing my hair and getting bald spots and lethargic every month not to mention running to the bathroom every 2 hours to change my tampon and pad from bleeding so much.  Insertion of the IUD was a little painful and spotting for a 2 days after then nothing. My periods so far are great; light bleeding and spotting and thats it. I wish I've done this sooner. Plus my sex drive had increased since being on it my husband loves it too. I can't praise the Mirena enough for giving back my life. Not everyone is the same of course but I just wanted to tell a positive story instead of adding to all the negative reviews that almost scared me away from getting the Mirena and almost missing my chance of getting my life back.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have been on this pill for a few years and never had any problems.  I started with this pill because of the iron in it.  I've read some bad reviews but had to say I haven't had any of the side effects.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
If you are considering Mirena, do NOT be scared off by negative reviews! Read on for details, but I certainly don't think there's remotely enough pain involved to avoid this device, at least not if you have a competent doctor!

I'm almost 23, and - after extensive research - asked to be prescribed Mirena to treat my very irregular periods since suffering a second trimester miscarriage 2 years ago. The birth control aspect is a major plus. I had Mirena inserted almost 2 weeks ago, which is the only reason I only gave it 4 stars for effectiveness, as I haven't had it long enough yet to judge that.

For those worried about the pain... don't be. Insertion was certainly not comfortable, but it was far from unbearable, at least for someone like me who has been pregnant in the past. For the record, I did not have any pain killers before or right after insertion, and it was performed 4 days into my cycle. Dilation of my cervix did not hurt one iota. The clamp used to pull the uterus into the proper position for insertion causes moderate cramping, so that wasn't too pleasant, but was not even as bad as period cramps. The only point where I felt even noteworthy pain was the brief "pop" when the insertion device made it around a bend in my uterus that had been causing the doctor trouble... that was a fairly sharp jolt of pain for a few seconds, but it wasn't tear-jerking or anything like that. As soon as the clamp, speculum, and inserter were removed, I felt nothing but very mild cramping which lasted one day and went away the second I took a Midol.

I spotted very lightly (only a nickel-sized dot in a pantyliner every few hours) for the first week, and now only notice light traces of blood when I wipe. I have not had any pain related to the Mirena since. I cannot detect any side effects from the hormones. I can't feel the device at all, except for the strings if I check for them, and they're very unobtrusive. They even get softer with time.

Mirena is great so far!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: awsome aside from spotting for the first month,very happy with it.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I started taking this pill about a year and it worked for me for about half the year with lighter periods not necessarily shorter. it also my first pill I have every taken. Then I stopped due to insurance reasons and recently started again. The only major side effect i'm having is NAUSEA so bad and not being able to sleep at night which I have never had when I first taking this pill. also in genera feeling AWFUL! if you are a person that can deal with nausea, then this is the pill for you.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: i was on this and had to get my gallbladder out.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I had Mirena for 3mos,,,,the worst 3 mos I can remember!  I am 48 and have endured long painful periods last couple years and decided to give this a try before ablasion surgery.   
Within first month I gained 7lbs!!  I excercise like crazy and get nothing from it because of the mirena.   In last 3mos, maybe only a few days where I have not had spotting.   I have been PMS'ing for 3mos, and after reviewing my last 3mos, I see I am one of the less than 5% that has had about every side effect.   I would rather have my old life back and deal with the periods than all the side effects from last 3mos of "hell".  I am having it taken out this week, would have actually done it myself with the mood swings, but I overcame that!
I now know why I sleep so much including needing an afternoon nap or a grande expresso everyday, have had acne breakouts, weight gain (my watch is tight on my wrist!!) and been so depressed.
I wish everyone better luck than me with your Mirena....guess just not for me.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I just received the Mirena on yesterday. My doctor gave me to pills one to relax me and one to open up my cervix. It was extremely painful. I am 24 years old with no kids. I bled afterwards and was in so much pain when I got home. I took two 800 mg ibprophens which helped a little. After I showered I have not bled at all. It may take some time for my body to get use to it. I am still experiencing mild cramps but other than that I am ok. Every womens body is different and no two people will experience the same thing. So if you wanting to try it, you will have to take the risk of trying it on your own and see how it affects you.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I HAVE THREE CHILDREN I DECIDED TO GO FOR THIS IUD TO HELP WITH MY ENDOMETROSIS I GOT IT MAY 11 2010 HAD ONE PERIOD IN APRIL AFTER THAT IT COMPLETLY STOPED . I WENT TO MY DOC THEY SAID IT WAS NORMAL I SAW HIM FOR BOWEL ISSUES AND ADOMINAL PAIN FOR TWO MONTHS. I WAS SENT TO XRAY CT SCANS TO EVENTULLY FIND OUT I WAS THREE MONTHS PREGNANT AND THE IUD IS MISSING IN ACTION MY DOC THINKS IT CAME OUT BUT I AM STILL HAVING BOWEL ISSUS AND LEFT SIDE PAIN THERE IS A SMALL CHANCE IT PENATRATED THROUGH THE WALL AND IS IN MY ABDOMINAL CAVITY THEY CANT HELP ME UNTILL THE BABY COMES OUT I AM TOLD I PERSONALLY DO NOT LIKE THIS IUD VERY MUCH
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had Marina for about 8 month.  Few days ago I got it remove. In the end of second day, I started to bleed with big blood clots. I was about to go to ER.  I got Marina  to prevent heavy periods,  but  while having it,  I experienced  very painful  breast  (enlarged  two sizes up) , gain 10 pounds in first two month , hair loss and  constipation, that I end up having a colonoscopy ,which it did not show anything that would cause   such constipation. Also, after five month a mammogram and ultrasound showed that I have a lump in my right breast. It did not show any lumps a year ago in a mammogram. I'll have another ultrasound after six month.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Here is my experience so far. To have it put in was not to bad. 3 large cramps but my Dr. gave me valium before the procedure. Its been a month and I have not stopped bleeding or passing clots. I get waves of cramps that make me sweat and dizzy along with lower back and pelvic pain. I feel like Im in a constant state of PMS. Im moody and sooooo very drained. Im sleeping up to 13 hours a night and always want to nap. I have IBS/Colitis and I "think" its causing a flare. Im hoping in time I will even out and start to feel better?
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had my IUD inserted in Jan 2010.I have had bleeding/spotting almost every day since then. I get about a 5 day break per month and then right back at it. I am experiencing bad side effects. Very bad fatigue, extremely bad mood swings, Acne like never before in my life, and cannot lose weight for nothing. I am very active. 5-6 days per week for about an hour a day. I run, I cardio train and watch what I eat and cannot shed a pound. I will be calling my DR. in the morning to see about having this thing removed. Works for Some but not for everyone.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: After reading many and I mean many reviews, I was extremely nervous about having mirena placed. That was 2 yrs ago and I am now so glad I made the decision to have it placed. Many of the reviews are terrible and downright scary. The insertion was very painful as I have never had children. I had light bleeding for about 2 weeks after insertion, then spotting for 8 months after. I have not had a period since(love)! I have some minor cramping at the end of each month, when I should be getting my period. I have had some side effects but nothing I won't or can't deal with. Mild acne and some facial hair growth. I have my acne under control with the right skin care. I was worried about the decrease in sex drive many had reported. This was the problem I encountered with many of the pills, this is not the case at least for me with mirena. I now have an increased sex drive for once in my life! I use this for very heavy periods and birth control and could not be happier with it's effectiveness. Everyones bodies are different but this has been great for me!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I was 44 years old and my doctor recommended Mirena to control heavy menstrual bleeding. At one month follow up appointment, my doctor discovered the device had shifted out of position so she removed it and re-insert a new one, which meant I had to endure the pain and discomfort of the procedure again. Less then three months later, I had a very painful and uncomfortable menstrual cycle and the device came out on its own.  My doctor said this has never happened to any other patients she had.  I am very disappointed with this entire experience.  I will not recommend Mirena to any one.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had Mirena inserted in Oct 2009. It did resolve my issues with heavy periods however, after several months of spotting, I have been left with a discharge. In Feb 2010 I had a really heavy period in which I lost a lot of clots. This prompted a visit to my GYN. An ultrasound in March 2010 found that I had now developed cysts in my right ovary, my fibroids had grown and my uterus went from being 8x8 in Sept 09 to 12x8. My 2month follow-up in May 2010 found that the cysts have almost doubled in size, the fibroids have grown more and my uterus is now 16x8. Based on blood tests, I have no sign of cancer. My visit to the GYN Oncologist today ended with the decision to remove my right ovary and uterus. The doctors have NOT said that these problems are related to the Mirena however, I did not suffer from problems of this magnitude before the Mirena. I discovered my fibroids in 1996. 14 years and 2 children later, they remained slow growing and unproblematic with the exception of the heavy periods. The rapid growth occurring in my body at this time comes without definitive  explanation however, I find it questionable that these problems began shortly after the device was inserted. I think that Mirena could be a great fix for most women with heavy periods. Unfortunately it just wasn't for me.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I got Mirena yesterday, insertion was not too bad, but after I got home for about 6 hours the cramping was horrible. It felt like I was having a miscarriage. The cramping has almost completely went away, only minor spotting that has stopped now.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Horrible!!!Removed in 25 days: constant pain, bleeding, hair loss, mood swings, acne, back pain..It's a TORTURE!!!!DO NOT USE IT!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have had this for about 30 days I have spotted everyday. I got this so I wouldn't have a period. Frustrating I'm going for my check up this week. I also cramp a least once a day.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I am 38, and have never given birth.  My doctor recommended Mirena for my long and heavy periods.  (My periods were 10-12 days long, and I would go through at least 2 boxes of super sized tampons.)  Honestly, the procedure itself was the worst pain I have ever felt, I almost passed out from it.  I was given a prescription for 800 mg ibuprofen to take during and after, it didn't help much.  The aftermath wasn't much better, I had moderate to severe cramping off and on for about a month afterwards.  I had light to moderate bleeding for 5 weeks afterwards.  
I have now had Mirena for 10 weeks and I never thought I'd say it, but I love it.  I think I've had one period, but it was so light, I wasn't sure if I was spotting or what.  I haven't gained any weight (and I like to eat) and no complexion or personality changes like others have complained about. I don't know if it's relevant, but I didn't experience any of those side effects when I was on the pill many years ago either.
So, in summary:  if you are considering this option and haven't given birth, see if you can get some kind of stronger pain med, and be patient with the cramps and bleeding afterward.  I have been very pleased and look forward to easier periods for the next 5 years!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I love this birthcontrol! I use to take pills but I could never remeber it and I had really bad periods so I got mirena but when I got it,it was very painful (never had a child) after that lot have cramping then 1 month having a period after that  I had no more periods and I only had for 7 months now and love it!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I don't usually review products but i noticed a lot of reviews for mirena are negative.  so i thought i would let everyone know there are positive outcomes.  I got Mirena placed 4 weeks ago. had very light spotting for about 24 hours after placement and mild cramping.  The first 24 hours were nothing like my first 2 days of my normal periods, much easier.  I normally get large cyst like acne a couple of days before my period and these have completely cleared since the placement!  My skin is actually MUCH clearer.  I have had no cramping or spotting since the first 24 hours after placement.  Yesterday I had some very, very light spotting, breast tenderness, and mild cramping.  I was supposed to start my period 2 days ago.  As of today...nothing.  No spotting, tenderness, or cramping. I suppose i just had my first period after placement! Amazing!! I went from acne, 8+ days of heavy periods, extreme cramping, back aches, moodiness, etc. I can honestly say I feel better and have actually lost a couple of pounds since getting the mirena.  Just keep in mind everyone reacts differently.  There are those who are very greatful for Mirena. So far I have nothing negative to say.  I only gave 4 stars due to the fact I have only had it 4 weeks. So far best decision I have ever made absolutely life changing for me..
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I read tons of reviews of Mirena before finally taking the plunge. I had REALLY heavy periods after my period returned after having my second child. We had decided to stop having children and the IUD seemed like a good choice. I really wanted my periods gone and this seemed like the best solution on all fronts. I am VERY happy with my experience. 

I had it put in when my son with 10 months old after a V-BAC. I felt only very mild discomfort and had minimal cramping that night and tinges the next day. Very little spotting as well. My doctor had me come in as my period was ending, which is key to the minimal bleeding I believe. I am now at my first period post Mirena and I am THRILLED! I am basically only spotting, already. Amazing. Last month I had to use a super plus tampon each hour for two days and nights. Now I may only use two for the entire event! I feel so much better while on my period. I did have some period related acne briefly, and some intense carb/salt cravings. 

So happy I went this direction. 


I have not gained nor lost any weight and have kept a very close eye on it. I don't detect any change in libido either (higher if anything but with two children we are so tired it is hard to tell!)
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: well i had the mirena for about 9 months but me and my hubby have taken it out to try to have a baby but i can not stop bleeding and have big blood clots iam not to happy. should that happen?
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have had the Mirena IUD since April 2009. The insertion was the hardest part about the whole process. And even then it wasn't THAT bad. I've had 2 children and it took about 6 minutes. I did have cramping and it did hurt. But compared to child birth it was nothin.I would compare it to bad period cramps. Today I have a light period and 1 day of cramping.Other than that I can't tell I have one. My advise: GET ONE. You can always have it removed later.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I opted to have Mirena inserted because I have endometriosis, and since suffering a blood clot in 08, I am no longer able to use any of the more practical methods of treatment (like the pill or the nuva ring).
It hurt like HELL...so much, in fact, that I could not go through with the entire procedure. I only made it through the 1st measurement and had to stop my doctor. I could not stand the cramping and burning pressure in my cervix and abdomen. I have no children, and I've heard that it's far more painful when you haven't had any, but he never warned me that it would be so painful.
I will not get mirena now, knowing how difficult and painful the insertion is. I wrote this review for others to know--It is not a gentle procedure as it is described. Be advised, it can be very VERY painful!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have had the Mirena since May 2009.Almost 1 year now. I had long,heavy periods and very bad cramps. Yoday I have a very light 4 day period with maybe 1/2 day of cramping. It did not make my period disapear but helped dramatically. I really only need the regular sized tampons anymore. I recommend this very highly. I wanted no period but am very happy with the outcome.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena but then started spotting everyday. I called Dr and he said it would go away...but it didn't!!!  I spotted for 9 months!! Argh! So I had it removed after the 9 months. 2 days later I had my regular period, bled for about 6 days, and now no more spotting!  But I did like the progestrone it released because it increased my sex drive. So now the Dr put me on Camila.  Hope it works!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I have been on Mirena for 4 years now. In fact I have to get it changed out in about 8 months. After being on Depo for 8 years and not having any periods I felt this was the best option for me.  I do not have children and actually found the insertion procedure quite pain-free.  I did find they could cut the springs short enough not to bother my husband (you need to have this conversation with your OB-GYN up front to make sure you are on the same page).  I haven't had any bleeding except some spotting this last year.  It can be a little annoying but it only lasts 1-2 days.  I haven't had any weight gain or cramping (but I do take Topamax so that can effect the weight gain or lack there of).   I have noticed tenderness in my breasts and also mood swings especially as it gets closer to the 5 year mark.  Actually my husband noticed them.  It seemed as it got closer to the 5 year mark my mood swings almost resembled those close to severe PMS (irritability, moodiness, etc).  Those mood swings were not present in the first 3 years.  I will be asking my Ob-GYN on my next visit if this is a normal side effect as it gets closer to the 5 year mark for some of these things to return because it took my and my husband by surprise (it was a pretty marked change in behavior).  I would recommend this form of birth control to anyone not looking to start a family that is in a stable relationship, but I caution you to get all the information first and def. talk to your partner and doctor.  The mood swings were very surprising to both myself and my husband and were not present until much later.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
The insertion was extremely painful for me, however I have friends who have had it placed with no pain.

It has greatly lightened my periods, which is why I had it placed.  However, the side effects are annoying.  I continue to have spotting between periods, mild acne, tender breasts, mood swings, less sex drive and less intense orgasms.

My husband says he can feel the string but it does not hurt or distract him.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I got Mirena insterted over 4 yrs ago, the insertion was painful and I wasn't even warned about how painful it would be. I bled profusely for 2 months and have had 14-21 day periods for the last 4 years. I was never told to check the strings, now they aren't even there. I had cramps stronger than contractions that would paralyze my legs from the pain. All of a sudden, I missed my period and have gained weight, I'm fatigued, I have a constant headache, and sore breasts and found lumps 3 days ago. I got Mirena to stop having irregular periods but it didn't work now they're just long, I've never had a pregnancy scare-until now. My doctor has already warned me that removal without strings will be painful since they will have to "blind-probe" because sometimes the ultrasound can't help guide them. If you are considering Mirena please think about it thoroughly especially if you are breastfeeding because the hormones do go into your breastmilk and can affect your child. Something my previous doctor also failed to mention. Mirena is definitely not for everybody so really consider your own body/situation before being amazed by end results.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: Its been almost five years since I started using Mirena and I so far have not had any problems.I do suffer from anxiety sometimes but chalk it up to family stress not the Mirena but who knows? I have gained weight but do not blame it on Mirena,its my eating habits.I have Mirena because my periods were getting heavier and really messy. It has worked wonders for that. At first I had bleeding,sometimes spotting for two weeks but after about six months that tapered off. I have had no periods or bleeding in almost 4 years or more.Only time I bleed is after my exam with OBGYN. I am having this removed in about four months and will have to wait and see what happens they can,t tell if I,m in menopause yet because of the Mirena. I had no cramping with the insertion and am hoping I do not have a problem with the removal of it.I am a little concerened because I have cysts and I hope there is no problem removing it.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the mirena inserted Sep 1st 2009 and had it taken out Oct 14th 2009. I am writing this because I feel that I was not fully informed, my concerns were pushed to the side, and that I suffered numerous side effects (nausea, insomnia, sore breasts, anxiety etc). The mirena has been one of the MOST taumatic experiences I have ever had and I am STILL recovering from it. I was in a lot of pain and bleed constantly from day one! 1 week after insertion I suddenly wanted to bawl my eyes out for no reason, and the mood swings (eg anger/dispair) steadily got worse! I didn't want to be around my own self, in my own body - like who the HECK is this person!!!  This experience nearly destroyed my family, I had to quit work, and ended up under community psych care (which I am no longer under). The hormones in the mirena caused MY hormones to go totally out of balance. Ever heard of PMDD? I hadn't but in a nutshell it's 10 TIMES WORSE THAN A REAL BAD PERIOD!!! Everyone is different so if you are considering the mirena ASK LOTS OF QUESTIONS AND KEEP ASKING! The pamplet said the mirena may not be suitable for treating abnormally long and/or heavy periods. If that is you then think TWICE! If you do not handle hormonal treatments well once again think TWICE! Quite frankly DON"T DO IT! As for the rest of you I really do wish all goes well as the mirena CERTAINLY is a blessing for some women. In regards to weight gain GET OVER IT. There are things A WHOLE LOT WORSE!!! I certainly KNOW AND UNDERSTAND why some women CHOOSE NOT TO have the mirena. Best of luck
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: It's been 2 years since I had the Mirena inserted due to heavy and irregular periods. I started noticing about a year ago that I became very anxious and sometimes had panic attacks. My doctor put me on Cymbalta and that seemed to help. But then I noticed my hair was starting to fall out a lot more than what would be considered normal. At first I thought it was due to stress and some changes in my life (new job, move to a different state). It's now 1 year later and nothing has changed. It has made me a total "basket case" at times and my relationship with my husband is suffering. Thank god he is so understanding. My hair has thinned to the point that I am actually considering a hair transplant. It's taken over my life. I am getting this thing removed ASAP. I've heard horror stories from different people about the hair loss. Hopefully as soon as I get it out of me I will feel much better. If you have fine hair to begin with, DON'T DO IT!!!!!!
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: I had the Mirena for 8 months and it was horrible! acne/boils, depression, irregular heat,anxiety, just to name a few. Had it out and had the ablation procedure now back to normal. I would NEVER recommend.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews: To anyone who has had Mirena inserted with no issues, I am so happy for you. But for me, this is the worst form of birth control, at least for my body.  I have had Mirena for a year now, and pain from the insertion was unbearable. But ob said it was probably because I had a c-section so my cervix had to tampered manually, whatever! I have bled more than half the time its been in.  I have a period every month like clock work, but it last 14 FREAKING DAYS!!!!! Where does that happen, I would have rather not gotten implanted. Sex drive, dont have any, weight gain....oh yes...feel like I am pregnant, all the time. Moody? Very, hair loss? any negative side effect you name it I got it, oh and because of the constant bleeding, I have constant odor, I am afraid to douche because of those side effects, but something has to give.  This birth control method is definitely not attractive and as soon as I am able to, this thing is coming out.  The only positive thing I can say about Mirena is that it has kept me from getting pregnant, other than that its the worst and I don't recommend it to anyone. FYI I was also told that if you haven't had birth control with high levels of progesterone, then Mirena inst for you.  Found that out 7 months too late.  Hope this helps.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

Reviews:
I was on depo for ten years and decided to transition to the Mirena due to some negative side effects from the shot. I travel across ten time zones on a routine basis so the pill was not a viable option, and did not want the random bleeding from the implant. I read many reviews before getting the Mirena and almost backed out based on the negative reviews. I am so glad I went through with the procedure.I have not had children, but have a history of severe and demobilizing cramping associated with periods. Therefore, my pain threshold is fairly high. 

The insertion was not bad at all. There are two uncomfortable times during the insertion - one when the sounding is done and again when the device is inserted. The pain only lasted for about 20 seconds with each step. Thus, I found this to be very bearable. Who can't handle 40 seconds of pain? What probably made this event a non-event was the prep work I did before the procedure. First, my doc prescribed a cervix softener which I placed intra-vaginally the night before and then the morning of the procedure. Second, I took OTC pain medicine starting the night prior. Third, I found a doctor who had a lot of experience placing the device. Overall, these steps probably helped tremendously. 

It appears that the depo left my system very quickly, probably because I have a high metabolism owing to my 10+ mile runs every day. I note a normal cycle except my period last for about two hours each month, which is a tremendous relief from my long and painful periods.

I did not have many negative side effects from the shot (same hormone as the Mirena), and do not notice any difference with the Mirena. The progesterone can aid in weight gain, but only by increasing your hunger. Thus, you must control how much you are eating and exercising while on this drug rather than simply blaming the medicine.

Overall, long-term solutions such as the shot and Mirena have given me my life back. Don't be afraid of all of the negative reviews.
Sides: Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.
Pain, bleeding, or  dizziness  during and after placement of the device may occur.

When I got it put in I lost about 10lbs within the first week. And the drs say that within 3 months I'll have regular periods and they might even stop too, the medicine is only for sirtent people. But as a young female j would recommend this to anybody with bleeding problems and before this the clots were sizes up to a small orange, and heavy bleeding were u could walk a foot without something happening. So girls if u had problems like me trust me do it and you'll do fine. I did have cramping and little pain but it's normal it went way after I think 4 days. And hey if u don't like it u can get it out but wait at least 3 months to c any changes before u decide. Thanks for reading!    :)

Reviews:
I was prescribed this type of birth control because this is my first time taking any. The doctor told me this is a very basic type of pill that has had positive results/effects.
I have experienced a bit of weight gain, which has never been an issue before taking this medication. On the upside of this side effect, I have much larger breasts (I went up an entire cup size, and then some!). 
My acne seems to remain the same, although, I was prescribed an acne medication years ago, which has yet to fail me.
I have not experienced the extreme moodiness that others seem to be going through. I feel that this actually regulates my emotions better.
I am using this birth control to only receive my period every three months, or four times a year. I have not reached this point yet, but I have not experienced any 'break through bleeding' either. 
So far, everything seems to be working out fine with this birth control and I would recommend to anyone who is trying to regulate and control their menstrual periods better, and for anyone who is just starting/trying it for the first time!
