Reviews: I had been on birth control in high school and stopped. Every one that I tried either made me gain weight or become an emotional mess. Quartette has done wonders for me. It's effective--have not gotten pregnant. I had very little symptoms when starting it. After dealing with years of extremely heavy periods it is nice to have my period every three months (it's lighter too!). I get spotting at the end of the second month/beginning of third without fail. It was annoying at first but since its consistent in its appearance I do not mind. One thing I will say, my PMS symptoms have changed. I now get sore boobs--which would have been a pregnancy deal breaker in the past. I also get gassy. These symptoms can come as early as one month before my period too. When my period actually comes it is usually late and lasts only 3-4 days. It has taken some time to adjust to, and I miss the regularity of my pms symptoms, but the benefits of my period being lighter and less painful is magnificent.

Reviews: I took this from when I was around 16 to 18 1/2 for long heavy periods and then again recently paired with the Mirena IUD for 3 months to help control constant breakthrough bleeding (this didn't work, I'm getting the mirena removed. I have almost no side effects with mirena though). I experienced occasional nasuea in the morning, occasional breakouts, my breasts were not very tender but they did get slightly bigger (they have returned to normal now), and I did gain a few pounds early on but lost it after a year. I did not get pregnant while taking it and as long as I took it every day at the same time, I did not get spotting (if I did skip a pill or two, my period would start and sometimes did not stop for 2 weeks). The main reasons for stopping it were I would get very depressed before my period and it caused noticeable hair thinning. When I stopped taking it I got a lot of acne and my hair thinning was even worse. After a few months of not taking it my skin cleared and my hair is growing back. I am genetically predisposed to depression and hormonal hair loss so this pill just didn't work out for me.

I went without birth control for 6 months and now I am on Sprintec. A slight loss of appetite and some headaches but beyond that I am very pleased with the lack of mood swings and feeling calm. I also have more energy so I am switching to taking it in the mornings. In the last 6 months I have been ridiculously sluggish and exhausted. Although diagnosed with MS it is a different type of sluggishness. Like my body wasn't cooperating hormonally not physically. I hope this works out because I am really tired of not having answers. Also got tested for hypothyroidism the same day they prescribed this and waiting to get the results. Don't know if it's related but I workout everyday and wasn't losing weight whatsoever. I can't wait to have all the answers very soon and to hopefully get back down to my healthy BMI. Hope this continues to be a good birth control.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Remember everyone is different, so for the people that are having problems, if it does not get better my the end of the first month, I would talk to your doctor about getting off it, and trying something else. 
Good Luck to everyone.

Reviews: I have been on this med for a few weeks now, and I have to say, that I am very pleased so far.  As with any birth control pill, we all worry about the usual side effects, such as, weight gain and mood swings etc. I have been a many, and this one so far has worked well with my body.  I used to have all over body pain, much like that of fibromyalgia, and ate things like motrin 800 and advil all day everyday.  Curiously, on my second week of taking the pill I realized That I had not even had any pain meds in at least a week! That is unbelievable to me, and my husband pointed out that my mood is much better, He said Im the "old me". So I hope this continues, and this just proves that you need to keep searching for the right medication for you! My doctor had told me that this medication delivers a more balanced even dose of hormone, rather than the usual dips you may get with others. I think being 36, this is right for me, where it may not be good for a young woman who is "at the top of the hormone game".  Keep looking for the pill that works for you.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: While this pill has done its job preventing pregnancy, it has not done a good job of regulating my period. I bled continuously for fourteen days and my symptoms began to worsen. I became much more moody, getting upset or mad for no reason at all, and my acne worsened as well. And although I have always been prone to migraines, taking Sprintec made them much worse! This drug gave me terrible migraines (that even my prescription medicine couldn't help) every day for almost two weeks. I also began waking up early in the morning with extreme nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea, which all lasted all throughout the day. This medicine made me miserable, and I am switching back to the birth control I previously used.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I have been on Sprintec for 2.5 years and I was not in a great state of mind due to other circumstances in my life, such that I could not even properly notice what was going on with this pill. This pill made me lose vision. My contacts were 6.0 and 6.5, then after a year I went to the eye doctor and paid out of pocket because I could tell something was off. I didn't connect it to the sprintec though. I just thought it had been several years since going to the eye doctor, so my prescription changed. Then a few months ago, I went to the eye doctor again, a different one- and he mentioned casually, your prescription shouldn't change much at your age. and yet it had gotten worse, is now 7.0 and 7.5. After that visit I finally connected the dots, and realized that this drug has caused loss of vision. They had asked me at the clinic if I had loss of vision but I didn't know what that meant. I thought it meant blacking out. Years later when my head had cleared a little I was able to put this together.

Other side effects I have had with sprintec is that my legs feel strange, like there is not enough circulation in there. They are a little numb. It is frightening. I also gained weight, though I attribute that also to the workout I was doing-- a lot of people in my gym class seemed to be blowing up in their stomachs. 

I experienced a loss of libido, though this I didn't mind because I am single and don't have anyone to do that with- it was always more a distraction anyway so in a way sprintec helped with that one. You could go on the pill and then go off it when you get a bf. 

My hair also has fallen out a lot over the last several years, but I think that is only partially because of sprintec- I remember my mother's hair fell out a lot in her 30's also. I think my hair loss started when I started getting heavy periods several years ago, due to the fibroids. And it has continued.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

I'm exhausted all the time and nauseous most of the day.  I feel slightly depressed and have no energy.  Usually I'm very active and happy but this drug has made me grumpy and tired.  I just threw it in the trash!  I'd rather have heavy bleeding (reason it was prescribed) than deal with all of those horrible side effects!

Reviews: I had been on YAZ for irregular/infrequent periods for 9 months.  That pill had put me through utter misery for the first three months, with swollen breasts, depression, no sex drive, leg pain, and constant spotting.  Then the side effects subsided, but I had a two-week period beginning the first day of the third week of active pills.  This happened every month for six months.  Finally I begged for a new pill and my OB/GYN put me on this one, which is generic Ortho-Cyclen.  The contrast with YAZ was amazing.  The first day of Sprintec I experienced nausea for about 12 hours after taking it, but that did not last, and I have had no other side effects at all this first month.  I don't expect any in the future since the first month is generally the worst.  My period so far has not started, but that's fine, because I am about to begin the placebo white pills.  I am a little surprised that so many women had terrible side effects with this pill, but what can I say, no BCP is one-size-fits-all.  It has been a very good experience for me, though, and if the pill does work well with your body, it's even better because it is so inexpensive.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I started taking Sprintec 28, 3 months ago. I have none of the risk factors. Under 35, non-smoker, athletic, walk 2-3 miles/4-5 times a week, exercise daily, excellent and better than textbook lab results according to my doctor during my last physical in January 2008. After completing my 3rd month, I started having pain, cramping, swelling, and discoloration in my leg. Went to the ER. I spent 5 days in the hospital due to 3 blood clots in my upper thigh and groin area of my left leg, and a blot clot in each of my lungs. Be very careful.

Reviews: I have been on this pill for 10 months.  It is suppose to prevent periods for 9 weeks at a time;taking it straigt for 9 weeks.  I have never made it that far. I can go 5 weeks and even that does not work.  It starts at the end of 4 weeks and then your period stars. Then it takes 5 days to get your period once you start the sugar pills.  Then cramps and heaaches are worse!!  Even Advil does not respond to the pain.  I would say it does not work for me.  At age 46 it scares me to take it with blood clots risks.  Also does cause major mood swings.  After taking it for 2 months I was somewhat depressed for 4-5 months.  I am going to stop taking it this week.  The weight gain and moods are not worth it, not to mention the headaches and cramps.  I think its more of a risk for the problem I have than the benefits, which the only thing it has done is decreased flow but the other things are NOT worth dealing with.  thought it would work better but does not.  I did notice more acne.  At my age its not worth taking, and it is not the right plan for birth control and I don't plan on any other pill option.  Had I known how it worked I would have never used this product.  It is more hassle then its worth.

Reviews: My doctor presribed this birth control to me and I had never heard of it, so I went online to look at some reviews. I must say, I was really scared to take this medicine after some of the horrible things I had read about it. However, I have been taking it and so far I haven't had any issues. I do have occasional lower back pain, but nothing major. I also have some tenderness in my breasts sometimes, but nothing worse than what I feel when that time of the month rolls around. I used to have a couple of places on my face where I would have the occasional pimple, and those are clearing up. Everyone's body reacts differently, so I would encourage anyone to give it a try! I had extremely long and heavy periods, so clearly my hormones were out of whack and this has helped!

They are a lot rounder than they were and have been pretty sore, but nothing that can't be dealt with.  I plan on reviewing again when I have been on Sprintec for two months.

Reviews: After having my period for over 4 years (yes I'm quite young), it has always been EXTREMELY heavy and PAINFUL. It would hurt to sit down or even get up. I would go through 2 pads, in which I had stacked to prevent a leakage, in about an hour. TWO PADS! There had to be a solution. I researched ways to help, and oral contraceptives was the only option, after a long time waiting for the approval from my parents; my doctor prescribed me this. This is the end of my second week taking Sprintec and yes, I'm new to this, but this medicine has made me MISERABLE. I was a Sunday Starter and took the pill around 7pm. The next morning, I felt extremely nauseous and vomited. The nausea wouldn't go away until I started my second week. I even had to leave school early. Then the side effects changed to a terrible case of diarrhea, I would have to go several times an hour. It lasted about 4 miserable days. So the most important thing is that my cramps are still very present and VERY painful. I had built up a resistance to ibuprofen and the only thing that somewhat helped was acetaminophen(Pamprin). My main need of taking this pill was to regulate my heavy period and stop my cramps,or at least minimize them. It is now Saturday and I have officially had my period for a WEEK. Honestly, this pill has done nothing but make me feel bloated, probably gain a pound or two, break out into horrible acne, and an inevitable heavy and painful period. NOTHING has changed. Yes, it could take a little while for my body to get used to it, but I don't feel good on this pill. I spoke to my doctor and she changed my prescription to Junel 1/20. Hopefully it is going to work! I wish everyone luck and I good experience, I hope yours doesn't turn out like mine.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have to say I was afraid to take this pill due to the many scary reviews it got. But I am so glad I tried it. I have been on it for a week, I started it during my period and right away I noticed a difference. I have very heavy bleeding during my period and on day 2 of taking the pill and of my period I noticed it was lighter. I have had no side effects so far **knock on wood** I def agree that everyone is different. I take the pill every day at the same time, I eat something 30 mins before I take it or right after I take it to avoid any nausea that I noticed people mention and so far so good. I also asked friends on FB if they have used it and those that did said they had no issues at all. Def don't let the scary reviews sway your decision to try it...everyone's body reacts different than others to different medications. So glad I went with my gutt decision to try it even tho I was scared at first.

As I don't really have acne, so it doesn't really help with that. Oh, and I guess if you are trying to loose weight, or don't want to gain weight this pill would be great, but seeing as I am not in either of those categories it seems that I am stuck between a rock and a hard place. I guess it is time for me to go back on Junel Fe, which has a smaller dose of hormones. What a great amount of problems that has befallen upon me since I have taken this pill... Best of luck to those of you who are searching for the pill that works the best for you.

Reviews:
I have been on this BC for about 3 weeks now, and although it is not as long as some other reviewers, I felt the need to report this. My breasts have gained a whole cupsize (which is good for me) but that might be bad for others. However, I don't have the breast tenderness that others talk about.
The only thing I am very concerned with about myself being on this BC is that it makes me extremely susceptible to sun burns & blistering... and it's very extreme. Right now my forehead is a mass of blister, and small blisters on my nose. I have never, ever blistered before, and although I have semi-fair skin, I did apply SPF50 sunscreen repeatedly throughout the day. 
Doctors appointment tomorrow to make sure-- but if you are fair skinned, I would be aware of this.

Reviews: I started taking this medication because I have always had very irregular periods that were long & heavy. My gyno put me on this drug to help the length & intensity of my periods.  Also, I wanted to get on the medication because my wedding was upcoming and I didn't want to have a surprise period on my wedding day.  The first month I started to bleed after the 1st week of pills & bled for 3 weeks straight.  After a consultation with my dr. They told me to stop for 4 days & 'jump-start' my system & try again.  Long story short I did have bleeding on my wedding day.  As time has progressed I've noticed my periods are more regular, not lining up with the pills exactly but I am having a period every month unlike before where it would be months at a time.  My periods are shorter only 5 days instead of the 8-10 before and they are lighter than they were before.  I haven't had acne problems or headaches.  I have realized as of late that I have been experience insane mood swings & after the end of each pack I have a 3-6 day depression.  I have decided to try this medication for another 2 months if the depression continues I will be switching to another form of oral birth control.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Day 1 I started get migraines every other day and feeling really frustrated. The brain fog has gotten so bad that I didn't get a job because I couldn't think in my interview! I've gained 15 pounds in less than 8 weeks and can do nothing but cry and sleep for long periods of time. My acne has persisted on my chin for five weeks without healing and going away. I'm constantly constipated and nauseous, my sex drive is either 0 or 100 and I've been bleeding non stop for 17 days and counting starting on week 6 day 3. Its heavy enough that I have to use a tampon. I haven't had sex in weeks! I'm constantly sweating and hot! This is AWFUL and my doctor tells me I should keep taking it even though I've lost a dangerous amount of blood. He says this might continue for another five and a half weeks or beyond and that it's normal! I dont want to do this anymore. I've been on 4 birth controls and they all do this! Wtfff! Do NOT take this pill. My cramps are so bad I cant get out of bed.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

If you aren't good at remembering taking pills, or always seems to skip them this isn't for you. I'd suggest a birth control injection you get every 3 months at the doctor, since you would be taking this drug daily for months at a time.

Reviews:
I've been Seasonique for almost 5 years now and I'm pretty happy with it.  It's great for treating my migraines and my period is now regular (every three months!) and much lighter and my cramps are far less painful -- I can function like a normal human.
I have noticed my period starts about halfway through the placebo week now, but I don't have any spotting between periods.  That happened in my second year on the drug and only twice.
I didn't notice any weight gain (not due to the pill, anyway!), but my chest definitely got bigger.  I have some acne, but less than I did when I was a teenager, so I guess that's a win.

Reviews: I noticed a trend during the first 5 reviews under most recent; females ages 25-35 are experiencing bad results but females ages 18-24 report good results. My first quarter of Seasonique was ok accompanied by light pain near my vaginal region when I would stand, light spotting. My  sex drive is normal. I use proactiv so no unusual blemishes. My cycle came on as scheduled but lasted 7 days with bad cramps. The second quarter of Seasonique the 1st pack was the same as the 1st qtr. The frustration began with the 2nd pack in the 2nd qtr. I was in severe pain & bleed the entire pack until I went to my ob/gyn office & began meds for a bacterial infection. Once I compleyed the rx I still bleed but wasn't in as much pain. Thr last pack of the qtr I continued to bleed until my period. My period is on now & I have had cramps everyday. I'm use to cramps the 1st & maybe 2nd day of my 5 day period. So far no babies! I hope by the 3rd qtr these symptoms minimize & I can enjoy the benefits of Seasonique. The Dr told me to hang in thrre your body has to get use to birth control. I wanted to switch to Morena but she said my body would go through the same process all over again. Plus this is affordable, $12 for 3 packs. Yeah!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: It seems like others have had this problem..but this pill gave me full periods for months at a time. The first pack went fine. On the second pack, around the second month, I got my period. It lasted for over a month. I went to the doctor: he said it was from stress (I had just graduated high school) and to take the sugar pills for a week, then start a new pack. Kind of like restarting a computer. So, I did that, and everything was good till I got to the second month again. I started a period, but I thought it was from the stress of going to college. I've been in college for a month now, and have had my period for almost 6 weeks. I have also had mood swings, which I originally thought may have been from moving out of my home, but reading the reviews, I am beginning to think otherwise. Needless to say, I'm going back to a regular pill. Hope this helps.

Reviews: After I stopped nursing my son I decided to get back on the pill due to my periods were irregular and lasted 9-10 days. I asked my dr about Seasonique and he gave me a prescription saying it was pretty much like every other pill.  I liked the idea of only having 4 periods a year so I started taking it.  The first two weeks had some minor spotting, then it gradually became enough that I had to start wearing a tampon. By the fifth week the spotting turned into bleeding like a period.  I was moody, emotional, tired, nauseous the whole time I was on it.  I've been off it now for 8 days and the bleeding still hasn't stopped.  I'm calling my dr tomorrow to see how to get this to stop.  I never would have tried this pill if I had read these reviews first. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.  I would rather have one period a month then bleed endlessly.  This is SO not worth it.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
July 2009 was when I noticed that my menstral cycle was freaking out and there was no more 28 days in between. I was lucky to get 18 days. Also, they were lasting longer - instead of 5-7 days, they were 7-10 days and heavy cramping, bleeding, and pain. 

Now - I am 40 years old. I am expecting things to go a little out of control but this was severely impacting my life. 

In February 2010, I went to my doctor because I was anemic and exhausted from the constant battle with this issue. My doctor prescribed progestrone to hopefully stop the cycles and help me to get back on track. This made things worse and my anemia was very bad. I was ghostly white, no energy, and missing work because of pain. 

I was prescribed a new drug named Seasonique. Seasonique stops mentral cycles for 3 months at a time which was what I needed to fix the anemia and low energy. It worked. I had energy, was hitting the gym 4-5 times a week and I felt great. With my long awaited vacation coming up where I had 5 days at home and a 4 day hiking trip planned, I needed this. 

One month later, my doctor noticed some superficial blood clots in my lower left leg. No big deal. An aspirin a day would take it away. 

Another 20 days later, I get a doppler, an ultrasound of the veins, which informs me that I have some very big and bad blood clots that were very serious in my left leg. Immediately, I was pulled off the Seasonique and on April 28th, I was given Lovenox shots to inject myself with and Coumadin. 

April 30th, I was placed on bedrest for the weekend as my doctor suspected something more but couldn't get me into the specialist until Monday, May 3rd. 

May 3rd, I go to the doctor and was immediately hospitalized with a CT of the chest within hours of admission. They found several blood clots in both of my lungs. I was in bad shape whereas the week before I had felt great. 

I have a long road to recovery. Six months of Coumadin, getting blood tested every Monday, seeing a specia
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Seasonique definitely gave me shorter, lighter periods and no cramping; however, this medication gives me chronic yeast infections! I have been having them for the 3 years I've been taking the pills. I long suspected that it might be the pills causing them, but I didn't stop because of the aforementioned benefits & I thought the onset of the yeast infections could have just been coincidental. Recently I went off the pill for 3 months & went from 2 infection a month to 0 in 3 months. I got back on the pill Wednesday & I already have a yeast infection (It's Sunday). No other pill has done this & I'm taking the low estrogen this time. Oh well, I'd rather suffer from the heavy periods than the infections :(

Reviews: I have a special needs daughter who has CP and is moderate mentally retarded so she does not need to deal with all the issues of having a period every month. She has not had any issues with this, it is small so she can swallow. We did the depo shots but there was weight gain & can effect bone growth and doctor did not want her to use it more than 2 yrs. This is a great solution. She was having a period 3 wks out of 4. Now during the one week it is just a couple days and not heavy at that. She can talk so if she had a headache or anything she'd let me know and has not said anything, plus she doesn't complain about her stomach hurting anymore-cramps. It straightened her periods out the first month of taking them. She has no spotting or anything in between.

Reviews: I have been on Seasonique for a year now. When I got to the end of the first pack I had light bleeding the week before my period, somewhat heavy the week of and light again the week after. When I got to the end of my second pack this did not happen again as it states in the information provided with the birth control. I admit I have increased acne but this was easily remedied by seeing the dermatologist and getting acne cream. Other than these minor issues I have not had any problems and I love only having my period 4 times a year. This birth control has also decreased the occurrence of my migraines. Everyone's body is different, with birth control it is a trial and run basis. Also, always read the information provided with new medication. It addresses the break through bleeding in the informational packet for this birth control.

Reviews: I was given Zenchent 28's for a large ovarian cyst and heavy painful periods. I'm 44 and a non-smoker. The only problem I have is headaches and stomach upset at start or end of a new pack of pills and during my period which is now what I call "normal". It is nothing compared to to the pain and heavy bleeding I was having before taking the pills. I am going into my 4th month of taking this drug and will have my 2nd pelvic ultrasound next month to see the progress I have of shrinking the cyst on my ovary. HOpefully it's working and I won't have to have any surgery. Before taking this pill my periods kept me at home and I was having "accidents" all the time due to a lot of large and painful clots. I no longer have this problem. I haven't seemed to have any of the side effects mentioned in the pamplet I received with my pack of pills other than headaches. I'm very pleased to have gotten some relief taking this drug! =)

She switched me to ortha evra in march which depressed me and i bled alot too. I went to see a OBGYN in april and found out i have a fibroid tumor in my uterus that is 7cm. He put my on Zenchent to control the bleeding and try to shrink the tumor before surgery is an option. SO FAR this BC has done wonders for me. I bled for about 5 days in may which was very light and for june it was only 5-6. The only thing i dont like is the cramping and discomfort but i think that is the tumor rearing its ugly head. I finally found a BC that works for me

Reviews: I√¢??ll soon be 48. I took bcp√¢??s In my 20s with zero issues. Went off of them until last year. Periods were lasting forever and heavy, severe, unbearable cramping was increasing and lasting several days, and my moods were all over the place. I was very worried about all the negative talk about the pill for older women but my life was miserable and no prescription drug or natural remedy was working. I took the plunge, went back on the pill, and voila! No cramping, regular periods, and my moods, anxiety and panic attacks are nil. That hasn√¢??t been the case since my 20s. I√¢??m always stunned by how much hormones affect so many aspects of a woman√¢??s life. If they√¢??re out of whack, it√¢??s hell. Due to a number of outside factors, I am just now realizing that triprevifem is to thank for  my increased emotional state. I used to be the girl who NEVER cried, now, I'm luck if I make it a week without crying. It is nice to finally have regular periods, however, it would be nice to not cry, too, especially considering it has almost been detrimental to my relationship. Reviews: I took these pills to regulate my periods,but the end result side effects were absolutely terrible. I had a accident at work and had to have a MRI done of my back, when the doctors read the MRI they noticed an abnormality on my liver. I went to a liver surgeon who read the MRI and discovered that I had 15 tumors on and in my liver. The first question he asked me was if I was on birth control. Of course I told him that I was, and he told me to stop taking them immediately. I asked what the issue was, he explained that the estrogen in the pills caused the tumors and that 35% of women on the pill would get these tumors. I then asked why are they still on the market then, his answer was because the benefits out weigh the risks. Two weeks later I had surgery to remove the entire right side of my liver and my gallbladder which was also affected by the pill. I am telling everyone I know that is on the pill to have a simple blood test done to check their liver. I am a 21 year old who may never be able to have children due to the strain it would place on my liver. Also I still have 8 tumors on the left side of my liver which I will have to have bi annual MRI's done to monitor any growth. If they should grow, I may need a liver transplant, all because of the birth control pills. So ladies, please take heed and if you are taking these pills, have your liver checked!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I first was prescribed Tri-Sprintec back in March 2014. Then 3 months ago my pharmacy switched me to Tri-Previfem. I haven't noticed a difference in the pills, they both work the same to me. I had crazy periods before getting on the pill (months without having a period & long, heavy periods when I would have one.) When I was put on birth control back in March my first two periods were heavy and extremely painful, I was emotional, and my breast were tender. Now everything is normal since my body got use to the BC. I know exactly when I'm going to start my period, it's light, lasts around 5 days, cramps are minimal, no acne, no weight gain & normal PMS mood swings. No pregnancy either!

Reviews: This pill is total shit....it was prescribed to me to regulate my periods and while it did do that, the side effects were horrendous and far outweighed the benefits..therefor I cannot and will not rate this as an effective medicine. The third week of the third month on this pill  I suffered a severe panic attack at work and was out of work for the rest of that week. I barely left my house and was afraid to drive for the remainder of the week.I had subsequent panic attacks and severe anxiety for the rest of that week along with chest pains and heart palpitations. At one point my anxiety levels were so high I thought I would vomit. I was so scared that I would drop dead any minute from a heart attack. This drug made me a severely anxious emotional irrational mess of a human being and I ve struggled with scary and irrational thoughts for months...many of the side effects have lingered for the past five months....I am now seeing an anxiety counselor and at oneoint spent 24 hours hooked up to a heart monitor because I've been having heart palpitations ever since that wk back in March. My experience with this pill was truly the worst of my life I suffered with severe mental anguish for months because of this garbage.5 and a half months later and I m actually starting to feel like a human being again and slowly getting my life back.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Although the first month was a bit on the uncomfortable side , adjusting to the BC, it's a totally normal thing to go through. I only suffered from a bit of nausea and that subsided as soon as I got my first period on the pill. I do love that the hormones are easier on my body , not overly emotional or moody, haven't gained weight and my skin is clearing up. I did notice that within two weeks my breasts grew and are continuing little by little. I never suffered from soreness of breasts before or during my period until this birth control, but it's minute and I can deal. I would 100% recommend this BCP - especially for people sensitive to hormonal changes, like myself. I've tried yaz , and a couple of others and they were awful. So I'm happy to have found something that truly works for and with my body.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Prior to taking these pills I did not have acne or any of the other sx. I've made an appt to speak w/my doctor about changing my rx immediately and I would absolutely not recommend this pill to anyone!

Reviews:
As I take this for medical reasons and needed to up the estrogen, my dr. switched me from Yaz to this. No spotting etc. during the transition, however the first thing I noticed is hunger pains like no other, out of nowhere. Literally, I have to eat or drink something every 2 hours. The pain is like what I would feel if I didn't eat all day. I have not gained weight because I am snacking/eating healthily or drinking water to help curb the pain between meals but I have never experienced this increased hunger business with any of the pills I've taken before. [Ortho-Alesse-Yaz-Previfem]. 

It took a few weeks to fully adjust to this one, my body was a bit achy and I had some cramps, but otherwise this is doing what it should do in terms of preventing cysts/minimizing periods and associated pain etc.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I first got on the birth control pill august 2012. I went to the gyn my mom goes too, and she perscribed me lo loestrin fe. On that pill everything was fine for 5 moths, then shortly after i became sexually active (i became sexually active while on this pill) i started having a ton of problems, a lot of irregular spotting, that was the worst of them, and made me think my pill wasnt effective. After 3 months of that nonsense (and 2 trips back to the same gyn) i switched gyns, the nurse practionar i saw was young, she told me she personally tries out different types of pills to see for herself if their good or not. She had personally tried lo loestrin fe, and hated it, had the same problems i did. She switched me to tri sprentec. This pill is great overall. Before i was on bc, i had really heavy flow god awful periods. The 3rd week of pills i do PMS (pretty much every symptom in the book) and when i get my period on the 4th week i do cramp, but the flow is lighter than before i was on bc. More bearable periods, plus now much needed pregnancy prevention, plus a zero dollar copay. I would recomend this pill to others.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been taking this birth control for 7 months now. The first to 3rd month wasn't all that well, but it was nausea nothing major. I am 17 and I was having painful long periods and it was just awful!(I have low iron so I would pass out) But after taking the pills it helped me stay regulated and less pain during periods. However, I did not get a lower sex drive and my bodily functions stay the same. But girls do not freak out reading the "over dramatic" responses. All women are different hormone wise with level's of estrogen, mental states, and how much your body can handle. If you start to have trouble simply switch to a different medication brand. From what I see it works in Birth-control methods so I would recommend it if it works for your body. Don't worry about the other reviews that are basically going over-board with the "scare factor" do whatever is best for your body. And if this medication works then keep using it if not talk with your doctor and see what you can do to find a medication that fits your standards.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

I've been reading reviews from other users that have experienced the same side effects, and feel I should spend a little more to find a better birth control.

Reviews: I am not a sexually active girl, so I started taking this for my acne, to cut my horribly long and heavy period duration shorter and lighter. I've been using this for about 5 months now and am just starting to enjoy it. About a month into taking TriNessa, I woke up during the night with the worst cramps I've ever had in my life and the longest/heaviest periods I've ever had. The horrible cramps only happened that one night, but I've just noticed that my last period was much lighter and half the time it normally lasts (used to go through a super tampon in 2 hours and lasted 1-2 weeks.. now a super tampon every 6 hours or so and about 4-5 days). I weigh about 115, 5'5", so I would be considered thin, but since starting this I've gained a lot of weight in my inner thighs and in my stomach/back areas. I used to have horrible acne and took specific pills just for my acne, but not I don't use those pills anymore. TriNessa completely cleared up my skin (yes, I still get a zit here or there every once in a while, but I'm not complaining anymore!) If you are like me and using it for these reasons and just starting out, I would give it a few months to see any changes.. As for sex, I couldn't help you out on if it prevents pregnancy ;) Hope I helped anyone on the fence with TriNessa!!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been taking tri -sprintec for 2 months now, i just started on my 3rd month. This is the first form of any bc i have taken. I  was prescribed sprintec for my abnormally spiratic and long periods. In the first month of taking it, i was miserable. My first menstrual cycle while using sprintec lasted 2 weeks and was very heavy. I was kind of freaked out. But i took my doctors advice and waited it out and continued to stick with it. Here i am going on month 3 and am extremely pleased. I now know almost to the day that my cycle will begin and have 3 wonderful cycle free weeks every month! My advice to anyone starting bc for the first time with my kind of situation is to wait it out! It is well worth it in the end.

Reviews: Before an endocrinologist put me on Ortho-Tricyclen, the "gold standard" as she said, I'd tried a few different generics to stop a continual though light flow that went on for three months. Ortho-Tricyclen worked very well for me for about 6 years. I would have continued to take it but a poor choice and drive to make more profit by Medco mail order pharmacy backed me into a corner sending me TriPrevifem. Instead of being assertive, I gave this generic a try. WRONG WRONG WRONG. significant increase in mood swings, anxiety, acne (even on my scalp!), breast tenderness, and joint pain. After only 14 days, I'd had enough, called my doc and the mail order pharmacy, and refusing to use anything other than ortho-tricyclen.

Reviews: I wanted to tell you other users, that if you experience nausea, you may  want to try taking this pill right before bed, it helps a lot. My first day starting this pill I actually lost 4 pounds! Then gained it all back a week later, boo. But I also slept the WHOLE day, I was so exhausted. I was sleepy and light headed for the 1st week but that wore off. I do still get nausea and hot flashes every night, at times waking with dry heaves. But that does seem to be improving with time. I started this pill because my periods are so heavy theyre causing anemia. It has not made it any worse or better, but it caused a lot of menstrual clotting, which was weird. Breasts are slightly larger, which to me is a plus. Overall the nausea is a LOT better than it was on ortho tri cyclen. Remember it  takes 3 months for any type of BC to stabilize inyour body. Reviews: I originally started taking TriNessa at 20 years old due to abnormal periods.  Within 3 months, my periods were regulated and my moods were back to normal. Reviews: This was my first birth control, and I'm pretty sure my doctor pointed at random to a name on a page because this was the WORST bc for me to take.. it started off alright, a little bit moody but lighter periods.  THEN, my moodiness hit an all-time high, I started having black outs and panic attacks, my cramps became a different kind of pain (more like a stabbing pain rather than spasms), my entire personality changed drastically and I felt like I was trapped behind thick glass and detached from the world.  It wasn't until I went back to my doctor and told him about my problems with it that he decided to ask background questions and I finally found one that works.  Two of my other friends were on the same pills and they had experiences identical to mine.  I would rather eat ninja stars than recommend this to ANYONE!!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

The pain has been getting worse but hopefully once my body gets use to the pill it will go away. Other than that I am satisfied with this pill so far.

Reviews: I began taking Tri-nessa in July, 2007 when I moved to a new city and the pharmacy didn‚Äôt carry Tri-sprintec.  I really didn‚Äôt think much of the change because I figured they were both generic forms of ortho tricyclen.  Boy, was I wrong to think it wouldn‚Äôt make a difference!  After a few months on tri-nessa I began getting very irritable, almost irrational on a regular basis.  The smallest thing would set me off.  I also began experiencing horrible anxiety. To top it off, I lost my sex drive.  I went from having a very healthy sexual appetite to nothing at all.  I began to think that it was just hormonal changes that you go through when growing up.  I had just turned 23 when I switched to trinessa, so I figured this was me growing out of my young-adult stage and into adulthood.  When I went to my annual exam over a year later, the topic of my lack of sex drive and anxiety came up.  The doctor then asked me if I was having mood swings.  She also asked if I was having frequent headaches and I told her I was.  She said that we needed to switch me back to Tri-sprintec.  She wrote me a prescription for Tri-sprintec specifically.  The pharmacy didn‚Äôt have any initially, but they apparently were willing to order some for me since it was SPECIFICALLY prescribed to me by my doctor.  After just one month on Tri-sprintec my mood stabilized and my sex drive was back in full force.  I never knew a drug could have this big of side effects, but I am here to say that if you have any problems on Tri-Nessa, please speak with your doctor! I spent more than a year of my life thinking I was going to grow into an old crazy lady, and little did I know that all I had to do was stop taking a pill.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on tilia fe for about 5 months.  I cannot express how awful my experience with this drug has been. I switched to tilia fe from microestrogen after that had no effect on my abnormal periods. While tilia fe did resolve the problem of my periods being long, painful, and almost constant to make it a relatively light 6 day period once a month, the effect this drug had on my mood and other aspects of my physical health was horrible. I became so depressed all the time, I would lock myself in my room and cry about absolutely nothing. My anxieties were heightened and I became easily angry and irritated to the point where I once left a school class early due to my inability to tolerate people. I developed formication (the feeling of bugs crawling on the skin) that made me intensely paranoid, and it itched, all over my body. I have had barely any appetite felt so constantly nauseous that I have lost weight from not eating as much (around 3-5 lbs). I will be switching to a birth control patch in around a week after I have finished this round of tilia fe. As I am not sexually active, I can't speak for how well this drug does in preventing pregnancy. But overall: I regret staying on this drug as long as I did and am very happy to be able to get off of it soon. Would not recommend.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have noticed there are not enough reviews on Vyfemla, so I decided to share my experience. I take birth control because I have heavy periods and cramping when I am not on the pill. I was on another brand for 6 months, Natazia and it was the worst experience. I would bleed for almost a month, and then get my period. I tried it for 6 months and I begged my doctor to give me something else. He prescribed me with Vyfemla and since I have been on this pill I have not had the side effects that I felt on Natazia. I have only been on the pill a month but even with the other brand, the first month I took it I bled the entire time. With Vyfemla I do not have those issues (so far, I hope it continues like this). The only difference with this pill is I have to take it the same exact time everyday. With my other pill it did not have to be, I just had to make sure to take it. But that is not the end of the world and I rather deal with this than anything else.

Reviews:
At first I was scared to try Aviane then I looked up the reviews! They made me extremely hesitant to try it. However, I've been on it for almost 6 months now and I have not had 1 side effect or symptom. My body hasn't reacted negatively towards it AT ALL! my period has shortened and lightened up! It's usually 7+ days and I can now count on it being a solid 4/5 days long. I'm very satisfied! EVERYONES body is different & mine is in favor of Aviane! 

God Bless
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been taking aviane for 2 and a half years now. I love it. I actually lost weight when I started taking it. It regulated my periods, and I only have to have one every 3 months. Which is really nice considering how bad mine used to be. I'd stay home from school they were so bad. I finally got to live a normal life. After I started having sex, I had a period for almost 2 months and my dr had me take a double dose for a month, and I've been great since.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I am on my second pack of aviane. The first week was harsh...i suffered a lot of headaches, nausea, dizziness, tiredness that lasted all day. All the symptoms disappeared a week later. Now i am loving it. I take it everyday at the same time thats in the morning after kids to school. I dont feel like i am on any contraceptive. The only thing is i am having a slightly higher temper. Other than that all is good. I havent noticed any weight gain. If at all i feel like i ve lost a little coz some of clothes are a little lose. Its just about the best...I ve tried IUD the metal one, six months down the road i had an ectopic pregnancy not to mention heaviest periods. I became pregnant on a patch. Nuva ring could not stay in. Aviane is the best at the moment and i am hoping to stay with it for a while longer.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: i have only been on this pill for two weeks now and i see some good and some bad. i have had no headaches, bloating, or spotting. However, i have been very moody and i feel slightly bloated. Another couple of good things from this pill is an increase in breast size and clearing of acne. So far I like this pill but have yet to experience a period on it. Also, i would recommend it to someone because everyone reacts differently to all different pills so i don't think someones final decision should be based on someone elses experience with the pill.

Reviews: I recently began taking Aviane after taking Aranelle for several years because I wanted to start taking a low estrogen pill. I took Aviane for 4 days and had no side effects. Then on the evening of the 5th day, I received a terrible migraine. By the next morning, I was dizzy, nauseous, had no appetite, and had an awful headache. By that night, I was so dizzy I could hardly stand up, and was I vomiting painfully. I did not take my normal dosage that evening, and I continued to vomit the following day. I finally started to feel better about 48 hours after I had taken my last dosage. It was truly the sickest I have been since I had the flu several years ago. Of course, everyone is different so I understand that not everyone will react this way. But for me, I am definitely going back to Aranelle, which never caused me to have a single side effect.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I had horrible periods where I was unable to go to school for the week I had one. I've been on aviane for almost 2 years now and have had 2 day periods with very little bleeding and no bloating or cramps. It has been wonderful.

Reviews: I gained honestly 8 pounds in less than a week when on this, yet I've been the same weight for 2 years before taking it. I took Min-Ovral for 5 years to regulate my periods, but it all of a sudden stopped working. So I started taking Alesse, but the doctor sent me Aviane instead, so I decided to wait it out to see how it worked. It was horrible. Didn't do anything, I had a full blown heavy period for a month plus I gained 8 extra pounds... I don't know how this would affect anyone else, but all I know is that it's not something I would ever take again.

Reviews: My daughter took this medication for six months before it killed her..  She was 24 and the apple of her father's eye.  Nothing could possibly knock the wind out of my sails as the evening she had a seizure and subsequent stroke. She died the next morning.  Look at the side effects and if your head starts to feel funny or your headaches intensify, stop them immediately.  I am not a doctor, just a dad who misses his baby.

I will continue with this BC for awhile longer to see if the spotting fades, but, if it doesn't, I will be looking for another product.

Reviews: I started using Amethia in November.  My doctor didn't want me to have a period for 3 months after I had 2 surgeries in October and November.  I needed the surgeries to remove multiple fibroids that were in the uterus on the endometrium line.  This caused VERY heavy bleeding with extremely large clots.  It was very painful. My period since August 2014 would last for 2 weeks and the only way to stop it was to go to the ER and be admitted.  It caused me to have 3 blood transfusions since and made me anemic.  Having said that, Amethia stopped my period and has allowed me to have 3 period free months.  I'm very happy that it has stopped but there are some side effects that started in the second month.  I have noticed that my hair was thinning out a lot, my face broke out really bad and my mood swings were unpleasant...for everybody.  When I relaized it was the birth control I mellowed out and am now able to control my moods better.  There was also brown discharge...not so sure if it's left over blood or not.  I would bleed a little after I tried to have sex.  i kinda stopped having sex after that so that there wouldn't be anymore breakout bleeding. By the middle of the 3rd month the side effects started to subside.  Also, the spotting ( with no sex) was once a day for the first month until I decided to workout.  The spotting stopped after 7 days of yoga and ab exercises.  To make sure that it was the workout that was helping I stopped working out and after 3-4 days the spotting continued.  Started working out again and after a few days it stopped again.  But now since I'm only 1 week away from having my period the spotting has come back and it's kinda heavy, 2 times a day, and I have cramps but I'm ok.  I have yet to see how this period is going to be.  Hopefully it's not out of control and goes away once I start the new pack. I will make an update to let you all know what happens.  I hope this review helps someone and wish everyone the best.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I got prescribed lybrel (amethyst)in 2009 . April 2018 im still on it , i have never stooped, I had the worst periods lasting 9 days of extremely bad bleeding then I'd have 3-4 days of spotting. This went on for 5 years , and it controlled me I couldn't stand it anymore and talked to my doctor begging for help and a solution ,  I got a job as a fire fighter and was not going to have change a pad while hiking up a hill! This pill has changed my life , I am free I can camp and swim whenever and not be scared of when my period will come , I do get random spotting throughout the year but it's nothing compared to the hell  I went through when I used to get my period. I have recently thought of going off just because it's been so long. But then I think about bleeding in all of my clothes and the cramps  and I just change my mind.  If you're suffering from horrid periods  don't hesitate to try this you won't regret it! It saved me.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Give it time-I love this pill! Before taking this, I was saturating a tampon and maxi every 30 min, and I was done. GYN suggested this, but warned me that it could initially start prolonged light bleeding and eventually nothing. The first three months were miserable-bleeding every single day (not as bad as my heavy periods, but still needing maxis. I decided to give it six months and then I was going to quit. By month four, every bit of bleeding stopped, and I had no bleeding or period until I hit the one year mark and then the bleeding started again for about one month, and then it stopped until I hit the two year mark, and then it was light bleeding for about three weeks. Fast forward to five years later, and I have not had any bleeding since the second year mark-no period, nothing! This has been a blessing. Yes, the first three months were miserable, but it eventually faded and I no longer have a period. I have checked with my GYN and she said there is no reason to stop taking this (even for a short time) just  for me to have a period as I am getting proper estrogen/progesterone levels.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I was originally on Watson for 2 years which gave me periods every month which really wasn't a big deal but I had gotten on BC because of my LONG (10 days) periods and so heavy to the point that I would have clotting and would have to change out the heavy pads about every hour so this BC was suppose to help which it did until my body got used to it and my doctor was worried that I was losing too much blood for my health so I switched to Amethia which has honestly helped with every one of my period problems! Though I did notice some mood swings and periodically I will randomly cry or be mad for no reason. Another negative is my sex drive went down tremendously.. I used to be the one who would always want it now I have to force myself to want to have sex sometimes which honestly sucks. I would still recommend this BC for anyone with the same period issues though cuz now when I do get my periods they are shorter (4 days) and not nearly as heavy.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've always had bad periods.  In the last year or so, they never went away.  I was bleeding every single day for about 3 months, and not only that but also had really bad cramps to the point where I was missing work regularly.  I was placed on a different birth control and my period continued.  I started taking Amethyst, I continued to cramp and bleed badly for about 5 months into it.  My doctor told me to just keep taking it at the same time every day.  It has now been about 4 or 5 months so I have had a period.  It is ABSOLUTE HEAVEN!  I was in pain every day, it was making me depressed and isolated.  Taking this birth control has dramatically changed my life for the better.  The only problems I have had is around Christmas, I didn't take the pill at the same time everyday and I did bleed for about a week after that.  But I no longer have cramping or bleeding at all.  Like I said, it has been absolutely wonderful.  I have not noticed any side effects, it does not seem to have effected my mood or sleep at all.  I would recommend this drug to anyone who has tried other birth controls to regulate their period and has not been successful.  I am very grateful to have found this product.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: When I first started my period at 14, my cycle would last 3 weeks out of 4 weeks instead of only 1 week out of 4 weeks. Whenever I wasn't bleeding, I was lucky. I also had severe pain with my cycles as well. I tried a low-dose birth control, and it didn't even phase my menstrual cycle. I also tried the Mirena IUD, but that caused serious complications for me. Within 1 month of the IUD insertion, my body had almost completely pushed it out of me. It also caused liquid build-up in my uterus, so I looked like I had a little baby bump. I have heard wonderful things about Mirena and do not knock it; it just didn't work for me. Then I started taking Amethyst (generic for Lybrel), and have loved it! I have been on it for approximately 6-7 years and almost never have a period. I have occasional spotting for 24-48 hours every few months, and I may have actual bleeding for a couple of days once or twice a year. It has been a life-saver! And as far as I can tell, it works wonders as an birth control option; I have never gotten pregnant on it.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I took Lybrel for years before switching to Amethyst.  I love the idea of not having a period, but I could never go more than 4 months without spotting and severe cramping. I also still get ovarian cysts which cause a lot of pain (especially when they burst!).  I've been spotting for a month now even though I took my pills religiously.  My doctor is switching me to a different pill.  The problem with Amethyst is that the dosage is simply too low to maintain the uterine lining for more than a few months at a time.  I don't remember having these side effects with Lybrel, but that's unfortunately no longer being produced.  I love the convenience of Amethyst but it needs to come in a higher dose.  If and when it does, I'll gladly switch back.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache , abdominal  cramps / bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (retaining fluid), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I took Seasonique for a couple years before a generic came out.  The first generic I was first given Camrese.  The first packed worked great and for $10 I couldn't beat it.  Seasonique was $55 so I was thrilled with the much cheaper alternative.  Then 2nd pack of Camrese was terrible.  I had a period almost every single day for 3 months.  Terrible cramping and much heavier flow than when I was on Seasonique.  I was going to switch back to the name brand but though I would try it one more time.  The 3rd generic pack the pharmacy gave me was Amethia.  Thought it was worth a try.  Amethia, for me, has been wonderful.  My periods which normally lasts about 2 solid weeks was only a couple days and no break through bleeding or periods at the wrong time.  I've had almost no cramping with Amethia which for me is a miracle.

Reviews: This is the first time ever I have used birth control (43 years old) I wanted to limit my periods as I want to travel more. I have no kids. I've been on this for one month and 5 days ago started my period and for 5 days it has been the worst period I have ever had in my life. I have the worst cramps, clots the size of golf balls. I almost passed out the other night because Im bleeding so bad. Called my doctor this morning to tell her my concerns. She is ordering me to have blood work and possibly a sonogram? After reading this blog I think I need to tell her to change to the other pills that everyone is talking about.  This has been a nightmare. I rather have my period every month than deal with severe clots and cramps.  So glad I found this site it makes me feel that I'm not crazy and alone.

My husband and I are gonna wait a little while and start trying for a baby. I will def have to request something else later on.... Do not like it at all...

Reviews: Hate it! Worst generic birth control pill ever created! Not even close to the brand name. My period is now going on TWO WEEKS and my breasts feel like they've been pounded with a meat tenderizer and I have never had soooo much cramping. On Seasonique, my period lasted for ONE day, no mood swings, no cramping, no fatigue, no weight gain = PERFECT. This generic is a piece of crap.! I'm only taking it because they decided to raise the price to $250...and I can't take it anymore. 3 weeks in and I'm ready to murder someone. The first month I was ever on Seasonique, my period was 2 days and I felt wonderful and ever since my period was maybe ONE day.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I started birth control when I was 15 for my period. I am 21 now and still a virgin BTW. Before birth control pills, my period would last 6 months then stop for 2 days, then start again for another 4-6 months. It was extremely heavy. I would use at least 8 ultra heavy overnight pads a day. I went to the doctor & asked for Seasonale. At the time it was new & only had brand name. I took it & 2 days later I had no period. I took it for years before having to switch to generic Seasonale, called Jolessa. Jolessa is just as good too, with a little spotting. Also I've never taken the inactive pills. I have not had a period in 7 years. Then one day I needed a refill but my pharmacy didn't have any Seasonale or Jolessa, so they called my doctor, & she gave me a free sample pack of brand name Seasonique, which is exactly the same as Seasonale, except for the last 7 pills, which I have never taken on any of the 3 birth control pills. I love brand name Seasonique. Then I recently went to my doctor for a new prescription and asked for Seasonique & was given a script. When I got to the pharmacy, they only had generic Seasonique, called Amethia, so I had no choice but to get it. Amethia is made by a different company than Jolessa. I had no problems with either brand name, or generic Seasonale. But generic Seasonique (Amethia) is HORRIBLE. My face constantly feels like it is on fire, my stomach always hurts, and I am throwing up. Remember I am a virgin so this is not morning sickness or anything. I won't be able to get a refill for over a month, so for now I have to suffer with these side effects of generic Seasonique. But when I can get a refill, I will pay the extra $100 to get Seasonique, or have them call my doctor for a Seasonale prescription and get the generic Jolessa.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been using this for awhile now. I was put on it because after my car accident 3 years ago I had my period continuously for 2 months. Once I started the medicine my period went back to once a month. My period has been 5-7 days since I first got it when I was 11. Ever since I started taking this pill it has dropped to a two day period. I was told this is normal for my body now. I have recently been feeling extremely nauseous after taking this pill. This started about two weeks ago. I dont understand cause I have been on it for about 3 years and now all of a sudden I juat want to throw up after I take this pill. I have a doctors appointment this week in which we will be discussing whether or not I should stay on this pill. Overall it has not been a horrible pill for me... just these past couple of weeks have been horrible.

Reviews: I had gotten this BCP as an oral contraceptive as well as relief from heavy periods. It's worked perfectly, and my periods are much lighter. I haven't gained weight, nor have I had terrible mood swings, like most BCPs warn you of. Acne wasn't a main concern for me, but it definitely helped that, as well.

Reviews: My doctor started me on Apri a few months ago to help with my very heavy periods. I am 41 and have never smoked. Yes, my periods were lighter and shorter--down to 6 days instead of 8 and I no longer slept on towels. My skin cleared up for the first month, but then went back to the usual, but with a little less oil. However, my libido tanked, and the headaches started around the third month. The headaches became a daily occurrence, and started waking me up around 4 A.M. Nothing dulled the pain. I went back to the doctor and my blood pressure was *extremely* high (188/111). I immediately stopped taking the Apri, and now I'm on medicine to lower my blood pressure. It took about 9 days before the headaches stopped, and now it has been a month and my b/p has started to level out. The Apri did what it was supposed to do, but if you start having headaches I would advise you to get to the doctor quickly.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I was hesitant to go on birth control but I figured it was time because I would get incredibly painful periods for 6 days with other side effects to the point that I missed school or work.
I was prescribed Generess in June 2014 and I love it. It's chewable (I can't take pills) and he has lightened my periods, I have my period 3 days a month, and it's not as painful. I do still get cramps but it's the annoying small cramps. I adjusted to this pill within 2 months.
In the beginning I was nauseous and incredibly hungry for the first few pills but that went away by month 3. I did not gain or lose weight. I did cramp the usual week I would have had my period but that went away by month 3 as well. Overall I really like this pill and I'm incredibly upset that I have to switch to a birth control I can afford.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've been on this for about 3 weeks and the medicine made me nothing but sick, I would wake up feeling fine then take my medicine and go back to sleep, by the time I woke up the medicine would make me feel nauseous & give me stomach pains and very bad anxiety,I also couldn't eat much and lost 5 pounds over a week . The pain and nausea would get better throughout the day, but not until late at night, it took complete control of my life, I was bed ridden for a week , and it also made my depression worsen! I wouldn't recommend this to ANYONE to try.

Reviews: I was on Loestrin 24 fe for a couple of years and began having horrible side effects(hair loss, mood swings, painful periods, etc, so my dr prescribed generess fe. At first, compared to Loestrin, this pill was heaven sent. After about 5 months of being on this pill it became hell! I gained over 30 lbs in about 6 months. I know that this is bc of the pill bc I began working out twice a day and eating healthy (something i never did prior to the pill). My breasts were huge and i gained weight in places that i NEVER gained in my life. I even had neck fat. I began crying at the drop of a hat. This pill was horrible!! Pleas beware when taking this pill
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: The reason for me starting Generess was because I have an abnormal period...my first period with this birth control made me have a period that lasted two weeks long, which is not okay! That is way longer than anyone should ever have a period. Secondly, it made me feel violently ill. I would get random waves of extreme nausea, I felt like if I moved the wrong way I would throw up everywhere without a chance to hold it back. Also this medication made me feel like a diabetic, I would get the shakes and feel like I had to eat something sweet to get my sugar levels back to where they needed to go. At the beginning I figured this is my body getting used to it but it would happen everyday randomly for hours at a time. As far as other side effects go, I did not seem to gain much weight, maybe a pound... if that, slightly more pimples than usual but nothing I can't handle.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: After Loestrin 24 FE was taken off the market, my doc gave me a free sample of Generesse FE saying it was closest to Loestrin AND with the discount card I would only pay $25. WRONG. Read the fine print on the card. You pay the 1st $25, the company pays the next $50, then whatever is left between those and the retail cost is YOUR responsibility. Retail is nearly $100. I was LIVID at this sneaky advertising. My doc didn't even know the whole story. So, I was shocked when I went to fill prescription. But I covered it, knowing that I can't keep paying that amount. This pill has made me an emotional wreck. I cry a lot! I am anxious and irritable and sinking into depression. Since I already take anxiety and depression meds, this is not good. My first period on this was longer than I have had since my teens and twenties (over a week), and heavy for 6 days with clots. Couldn't leave the house. Right now I am unemployed, but once I get back into the workforce, I cannot have periods like this and still go to work. I hate feeling this way and bleeding so much, which also made me exhausted. This is nuts. Wish I could just get a hysterectomy and be done with it. My hubby has a vasectomy and I am done having kids. I don't want this anymore. The whole point in taking it is to lessen periods. Well... it failed. I am into my 2nd month on it. I'm an emotional train wreck. As for the ease of taking it, I had to get past the chewable pill aspect. Wondering how much actually gets in my system as opposed to staying in my teeth. They taste okay though. I just prefer to swallow my pills. I then know I am getting the full dose. I would be hesitant to recommend this pill to anyone.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I usually have irregular periods. I missed 2 months so my doctor prescribed Generess Fe. It's cool that it's chewable but taking this drug was not a pleasant experience. 

For one, my mood swings were incredibly out of whack. I was so depressed and angry and irritable. I couldn't stand something like this having so much control over my emotions. I had serious bloating and my breasts were super swollen and I am already very busty so this was not very comfortable. I had painful migraines. The worst part about it was the CRAZY LONG PERIODS! I've only completed 1 pack and I got my period last month but it's still going on, 15 days now!! It's not really heavy but it's more than just spotting. I am on Week 2 of the second pack but I have decided to discontinue. It just makes me feel worse. 

Not ever birth control is for everyone. For me, my best BC was Loestrin. I hate when doctors try to push new products on you.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

I have treated others badly and not even realized until it was too late. Patience is gone, I am not the same person I used to be. I have been a BI***. I have had the WORST rage, depression and psycho episodes EVER! Felt like I should commit myself before I hurt someone or killed myself. ANYONE WITH DEPRESSION/ANXEITY ISSUES SHOULD NEVER TAKE THIS DRUG. BEWARE and BE CAREFUL.

Reviews: I ended up bleeding more days on this pill than off - frequent spotting and outright bleeding. I also had extreme mood swings (I probably could have killed somebody if I had a weapon). The entire family was shocked by my continuous, severe PMS (it was every day). I had horrible night sweats - so bad I thought I'd developed cancer overnight. Hot flashes, cramps - it was a nightmare! I stopped taking it after 6 weeks and I'm never taking birth control again. My heavy/long periods (I'm 45) were MUCH more preferable to the nightmare this pill put me through. I noticed lots of comments about people having horrible moods (mine was rage). Why is this stuff still on the market?!?!

Reviews: i'm 22, and this is my first form of birth control. the first couple days i felt very slightly nauseous. that's about it. after that it's been completely fine. i was nervous at first because i'm in the process of losing weight, but my doctor said weight gain has not been proven to be associated with this drug. and i haven't gained anything, but have lost. no tender breasts, no acne except for the one or 2 around my period but i've always had that. nice minty taste, and it's chewable so it's easy. so far so good.
