Reviews:
This birth control pill might work well for someone else, but unfortunately, it's not working well for me. I do not know how effective it is for pregnancy either, since I'm not taking it for that purpose.

I'm 30 and have been on birth control pills off and on since 14 due to irregular periods. Before Generess Fe, I took Ortho Tricyclen and never had a problem with it, but then my doctor switched me to Generess this past time. I started out spotting on Day 1 and have been bleeding heavily since week two. I've been nauseated since I started the pill and tired. Then, I started getting headaches, but they went away. The worst is the cramps. I've never had cramps like this. I'm on my last couple brown pills, which I can't take because the blood taste of them makes me feel sick. I don't think I'm going to take the other sample pills I have and plan to call my doctor to see if I can get a prescription for something else.

The easy chewable nature of the pill is easy and convenient, though, and as I said at the beginning, this might be a pill for another type of person, but it's not working for me.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I been on the pill for 3 months and it has been a roller coaster ride from month to month.  My cycle before starting this pill was regular and predictable knew when I was supposed to start within an 2-3 day window.  Now the 1st month i started taking the pill was fine I only had a light/normal period for 3 days, then not even 2 weeks later i got my period again and have been bleeding for 12 days and still counting, it has gone from normal to light to spotting to heavy bleeding.  I started this pill to prevent pregnancy which it's effective in that since I'm bleeding so much I can't have sex and also to help lighten my flow during my period and it is having the opposite effect.  Also other side effects have been breakouts, nausea, and mild depression (I don't feel like getting up and playing with my kids or doing anything motivational), also noticed that my temper has been on edge the little thing pushes me over.  I would't recommend this pill from my experience.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: My daughter started taking this for long and very heavy abnormal periods. She wanted to stop taking it after the first week because she had severe nausea and dizziness from the first day on. I took her back to the doctor who said to stop taking it for one week to let her body get over the nausea and dizziness and feeling sick, and then to start it again where she left off and see if it does any better.  The doctor said after the first one to three months, the side effects should subside.  My daughter doesn't want to take it so I'm not sure if this is an option for her.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on this pill for 6 weeks now. The first month I had a couple of weeks of spotting. But my period was lighter and more comfortable than I'm used to. So far month #2 has been fine. I have lost weight since starting this pill. This is the first OC I've taken in 8 years. I do get frequent headaches, but I'm not sure they're from this pill. Overall I'm happy with this OC and will continue to take it. Oh, it has prevented pregnancy too.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: The first month I experienced nausea, headache and spotting. The second month, I experienced a little bit of acne, but it disappeared in the third month. My breast did become fuller. I had no or little period. I didn't get pregnant.  My doctor told me to switch to a different BC pill since I was experiencing extreme breast tenderness.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I thought I was going crazy until I read this post.  After 5 months of not feeling like myself, I finally decided to google the reviews vs. side effects of Generess and I felt like everyone was living the same nightmare as me.  I was totally depressed almost to the point of lethargy.  My anxiety was way above normal.  I gained 10lbs and my breast were huge.  Not to mention I was bleeding and clotting so heavy I was afraid to leave home.  And the cramps were crippling.  I also felt like I had more of a vaginal discharge in between periods.  However, my periods and the spotting went on forever.  I also have lack of vaginal lubrication and no sexual drive.  I have stopped taking this pill and was wondering if anyone else could say how long it takes for the symptoms to disappear.  Please post if you have any "post generess termination" information.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I started taking the pill 2 months ago and I think I've bleed more in 2 months than Ive done in 2 years. I cry all the time, I've gained weight and I have no sex drive. However, I have very little cramps.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I began the pill because I had my period 3x in one month. I have never been on the pill and have always been regular. Naturally, I was initially anxious about the side effects. The first week I had some spotting but my period finally stopped and I felt great. The rest of the month was horrific. I got every negative symptom in the book. Migraines, bloating, sensitivity, mood swings, etc. However, I understood that these symptoms were temporary and so I grit my teeth and pushed through the first month! I recently got my first period and I have to say it is the easiest period I have ever had. Usually for the first two days of my period I am doubled over in pain and bleed like someone shot me! This period has been without cramps and with a very light flow! I am shocked and so thankful I do not have to endure the pain and discomfort of my periods of the past. Also, I have been without negative symptoms for 5 days and feel like my body is finally adjusting to the pill!!! My boobs are bugger (a def. plus) and I have lost the bloat weight I gained initially. Overall, I think this pill is a must try for those that are looking to regulate their period with a low dose pill.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I'm 36, mother of eight. I have been on many forms of birth control (Norplant, pills, ring, patch, Mirena IUD). I was put on this pill because I have been experiencing extremely heavy, long (12+ days) periods. I started taking this pill not even a week ago and I will not be taking it any more. I have been so nauseous that i can barely eat or drink anything, alot like morning sickness. I know I'm not pg, hubby had a vasectomy over 2 years ago. I'm not going to keep taking it to find out if I get any other side effects!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I have taken this pill a total of 5 times. The first day I was fine. The second day I got nauseated a few hours after. Third day I felt nauseated and a little anxious. Fourth day I felt nauseated and even a little more anxious. This fifth day has been by far the worst. My heart is racing, my stomach is killing me and everything I have tried eating or drinking has made it so much worse. 

NEVER again.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I switched to this pill from seasonique/amethia and had no trouble at all. I work out a lot so I don't typically have trouble with weight gain, but i did notice that my body fat percentage seemed to go down after I made the switch. My face has cleared up more for sure. I loved only having four periods a year on amethia but overall i think my body does better on generess. Everyone has a different reaction unfortunately but hopefully this review helps anyone who might be satisfied with amethia but wants to switch pills.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Here comes the nausea and weakness.If I smell anything harsh sweet like laundry detergent or candles,I feel like vomiting.Even tho I started it just over a month ago, I can't continue it any longer because these feelings effect my work life. I've also had my period 3 times in a little over a month! I'll take back the long heavy periods over this ANY day.

Reviews: So far, I've been on this pill about a month. For the first two weeks I was taking it just fine (first time on birth control in 3 years, and GYN prescribed it for my pain associated with possible endometriosis). In the third week, I forgot to take two pill in a row... So I followed the directions and started a new pack. Since I started the new pack two weeks ago, I've had a regular period. Not spotting, and full blown period. I figure if I keep up with the rest of the pack, as planned, I should stop bleeding, but for now I have to deal with the aches, pains, and bleeding... It's unfortunate...
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I started to take this pill because my periods would last for like 9 days and would be really heavy. I have a hard time swallowing pills so this was the best option. I absolutely love it too. I've never missed a pill and I haven't had any problems like I used to. Sure my face breaks out once or twice in a blue moon, but I'd take that over what I used to go through. The only thing I don't like is that the last four brown pills taste horrible, it's manageable though. Now that I'm married, I'm extra happy to have these pills, they work fantastic.

Reviews: When I first began this birth control I was moody and had some break through bleeding. I also experienced some nausea and felt cramp-y and tired. However, this was only within the first month and half of using my Generess prescription. Since then I‚Äôve felt awesome! I haven‚Äôt gained any weight, I don‚Äôt get extremely bloated, and my moodiness and the heaviness of my periods have severely decreased.  In fact my periods are like nothing at all compared to my flow before this pill (I hardly have to change pads or tampons). I highly recommend this birth control, it is low dosage so you are not just shoving tons of hormones into you system but it remains effective and efficient. I‚Äôve been a new person since Generess! My periods are shorter and more tolerable and I feel confident that I am having safer intercourse.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I've just completed my first pack of this birth control. I started my period  on the 3rd inactive pill and I have to say that I am more than pleased with how this pill has changed my period. I usually get two periods a month with terrible, debilitating cramps. My period on this pill is so light ( lightest period I've ever had in my life). I also had no cramps! No cramps!!  I've never had a period without cramps. This is definitely a big deal for me mentally and physically. The only downside is that I've experienced nausea and a headaches. No acne or weight gain. I'd rather deal with nauseau than all the complications due to my periods off of the pill.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: After two back to back pregnancies I started using the paraguard IUD, I had extremely heavy periods and was uncomfortable for over a year with that method of birth control.  I am on my third pack of the Generess FE.  Tomorrow I take the last brown pill in the pack and have yet to start bleeding or spotting.  These have dramatically shortened and lightened my periods.  I am happy with it.  I usually get a lot of acne with my periods, especially after child birth.  (Hormones gone crazy) I have noticed that my break outs aren't as bad these past few months.  I like that the inactive pills have iron (FE) in them. I still get that week before mood swing issues that I have always had, so the pill did nothing to help that or make it worse, just the same as always.  No weight gain or weight loss.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

My breasts are sore, I'm angry all the time, I'm depressed, I'm so tired. This pill didn't help my terrible cramps and it didn't help my heavy blood flow. I did not, however, gain weight nor did I break out in acne. This is my forth month on the pill and I'm done. It's ineffective for me and it's way to expensive.

Reviews: I've only been taking this pill for 3 weeks, but so far - so good. I haven't had any side affects whatsoever. No acne, bloating or weight gain, mood swings - nothing! I did get my period recently (right at it's normal time) and although it is extremely lighter than usual, it does seem to be lasting a little longer than I'd like. Without the pill, my normally heavy period is always on time and lasts about 5 days. With the pill, still on time, much lighter and lasting longer than 7 days.

Reviews: After a nightmarish two months on Nuvaring, my gyno switched me to Generess, and I have never had such success with a birth control. I am now finishing up my third month on this pill, and my period is so much lighter and I no longer have cramps. Absolutely no breakthrough bleeding either. My breasts are noticeably more sensitive, but nothing unbearable, and they've grown, which is exciting for someone who's always been an A cup. I've noticed that I am slightly more emotional, but again, nothing unbearable. I am also on Pristiq for anxiety/depression, so it is almost a relief to be able to cry once in a while, as the Pristiq can really numb you out. Overall, very satisfied!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on this pill for about 4-5 months.  After switching from a higher dose birth control (I needed that pill to control breakthrough bleeding)  I am very pleased.  My reasons for trying Generess were because my old pill was causing a lot of bloating and fluid retention, as well as breast tenderness.  I have had none of these symptoms with Generess, and feel a lot better on this dose, I just hope it keeps working.  The only negative aspect is that I haven't had a real period while taking this pill.  I am definitely not pregnant, but I would like to see my period every month for a piece of mind

Reviews:
I haven't been on BC for a few years, and I had to start something b/c my periods were getting to be 1 1/2 to 2 weeks long! This BC has helped with that. My last period was VERY light (I usually get heavy and clotty especially after having 2 kids.) and very short (4-5 days). BUT, BIG drawback: I am getting horrible stomach aches and lots of nausea. I sometimes do get stomach aches, anyway, when I'm under a lot of stress, but I'm sure the pill is causing these. They are worse and almost constantly, every day. Not only that, I just feel so sick to my stomach almost like I'm pregnant (I'm not). I just have to burp a lot to feel better. I also have a lot of bloatedness and feel tightness in my chest. I don't remember any of these symptoms from when I took BC about 8 years ago. 

I am unsure, but I'm now in the beginning of the 2nd month/pack and I might be feeling a little better. I will probably continue a little longer, but I can't deal with this too much longer! Oh, I'm also VERY fatigued, but perhaps the feeling of sickness is just making me want to sleep to get rid of the discomfort for a bit!

Reviews: After 7 years of being off birth control I went on this one after doing a lot of research into the types of progesterone and estrogen it contained. Originally I went off the pill because of depression so that was my main concern. This pill did not cause depression, cleared my acne and shortened my cycle. However after just 1 week I got severe stomach cramps, bloating and diarrhea. I went from 120 lbs to 114 in 3 weeks. It stopped during the plecebo week and started again with the 2nd month of active pills. I believe that it was the type of estrogen causing this problem with me. I'm going to try a different pill combination or possibly Mirena.

Reviews: I've only been on this medication for about 2 months. I started March 17th and it is currently May 3rd. The first month was fine, but just three days later on April 20th I started experiencing terrible side effects. I started getting really dizzy and then suffered a panic attack soon after. I then had diarrhea and severe nausea for about a week and a half along with throwing up twice. The nausea for the most part had subsided but the dizziness is still very persistent. I also started abnormally bleeding that keeps getting heavier. I've been having terrible anxiety attacks as well. Sleeplessness and waking up extremely anxious and nervous for no reason.  My doctor told me I had to finish my third pack before I can be switched because it might get better before it gets worse. I think it's absolutely ridiculous because these side effects are ruining my life. I've never felt like this before. I just want to be myself again. UGHHH.

Reviews: I started to take this pill when I was 16. Not because I wanted to have sex but because before this pill, I used to get my period 2 times a month (7 days each) and they used to be extremely heavy, to the point that I couldn't go to school. My gyn prescribed me this birth control and I have to say that it did its job. I didn't get any strange side effects like mood swings or headaches. In fact, I was probably more happy on the pill. I had lots of energy. And my period had greatly reduced. I had my period once a month for 5 days and it was always predictable. I had spotting for 3 days during the first week that I started. But then it was all good. This pill helped me alot.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I wish there was a better overall rating system.  For birth control, it works well seeing as I am not pregnant.  It has shortened may periods to 3 days with very light bleeding and no breakthrough bleeding.  I have not had any side effects.  The only thing I am a little disappointed about is that I am still breaking out like a teenager when I haven't been one for quite some time.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
This is not a real review.

Please take note that most of these reviews were placed within a month of these people starting this medication.  The medication, as with MOST BC, states that you WILL experience anomaly fluctuations until your body is accustomed to the med and that you need to wait 3 months for your body to become regulated.  
Nearly every review on this site is useless.

Reviews: I was taking Yazmin for as long as I can remember (over 3 years)and it had always worked until about a 7 months ago i started getting periods every other week.  And this was no spotting...seriously a period every other week.  I told my Doctor and She put me on Fem Con Fe.  I bled the first week of it but thats common when switching BC.  but i have been on this for about 4 months and have not had 1 period and i couldnt be happier!  At first i was concerned but after talking to the doctor she told me that no period is a common side effect!  Im loving it! Period vs no period....i'll go with no period thanks!

Reviews: Although this pill is easy to use and is very effective against pregnancy, I don't like it. I've been on Femcon for about 6 months and for the last 2 months, I've been getting really heavy periods that last for at least 2 weeks, my lower back feels like someone ran me over with a semi, and makes it almost impossible to have sex! I mean, it's bad enough that I feel like crap when i'm on my period and I feel like I look like crap, but to go through the hell that is having a period for AT LEAST 2 weeks is pretty unbearable. I've tried 3 different kinds of birth control pills and this is by far the worst one.

Reviews: I went to the doctor about having long periods. the doctor gave me this pill to stop my period. b4 i had this problem with the abnormal cycle, my normal cycle was 4-5 days no cramps, no headaches, no heavy bleeding. i was so ready 2 get back 2 that. the pill did not work for me. it was not effective. it was easy 2 use since it was chewable so if i was busy, i could chew the pill and later go drink a glass of water. however i was not satisfied. within two 2 weeks, i began to bleed more than i had ever bled in my life. i started having blood clots and i was changing pads AND tampons almost every hour. i never stopped bleeding and the bleeding continued to worsen. it was the worst feeling ever. i was dizzy and my head was pounding and i felt terrible. i could feel the blood clots running out and filling up the pads. i went to another doctor and they took me off that pill and prescribed another pill called ortho novum. the other doctor informed me that my blood count was very low and i was becoming anemic from loosing so much blood so she also prescribed me some iron pills.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I have been on Femcon Fe for several months.  I've been on bc for almost 10 yrs for irregular and long periods.  Even with other bcs I was bleeding for 8-10 days.  This med has dropped my bleeding to 3-4 days, although it makes me nervous about being pregnant sometimes b/c I'm used to much more bleeding.  I weight has been fluctuating more than normal, with weight gain up to 5 pounds at times.  I do seem to be more moody around the time of my period.  My face is broken out, but I have always had a problem with acne, so again I'm not sure if this is due tot he med.  I think I like this med OK, and will probably continue to take it, even after reading these other reviews, b/c it has shortened my periods.

Reviews: I started this medication back in march. I had  been experiencing really long and irregular periods and wanted to regulate them. After a few months my periods did regulate a bit more, although they are still not completely normal which is why i did not rate them completely effective. The reason i  did not like them, however, was that over the past several months I have been experiencing serious emotional issues. I've  been feeling worried and sad and i get upset  over really silly things. At first I thought I was just stressed from school or something but eventually I realized that it all started when I started the pills. I will definitely be switching to another type.

Reviews: I haven't been on birth control in over a year, but when I had abnormal bleeding that lasted almost 4 weeks and after the many tests I had done came back normal, I began taking Junel fe 1.5/30 at the suggestion of my doctor. I was nervous after reading the many terrible reviews that I would gain weight or my skin would break out or I would feel crazy. I told myself to try it anyway because most people who go onto message boards do so when they are upset about something and I should see if my body would normalize. It took about a month, but my irregular bleeding stopped and I have not had ANY adverse side effects- not one! Everyone's body is different and will react differently, but I am very happy on this BCP.

Reviews: I've been on Junel a little over a year, and  I started birth control mostly because of my very unpredictable periods that came early or not at all and were very heavy and painful. The first few months on this pill I thought it was fine, but over time I've noticed the side effects have gotten stronger and worse. I began with flawless skin, and now my face is covered in acne that is also now on my back for the first time in years. I have also gained 15 pounds within the past year regardless of the fact that my physical activity levels and eating has been the same. I don't feel confident anymore because of the way this pill has changed my appearance and my mood. I'm tired all the time and get constant headaches, and feel nauseous often. On top of that, my periods are still as irregular as ever! I alternate between going 4 months without them randomly to bleeding and having periods during the middle of the pack. I've had up to three periods a month sometimes. My cramps have gotten worse - WAY, WAY worse. It may seem good at first, but trust me, give it time. Only negative changes have come of Junel, I am throwing it out tonight and switching. It's not worth the loss of self esteem and all the negativity it's brought to my life.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I was on Microgestin for years as a low dose hormone therapy. My doctor gave me samples of Loestrin 24.  I took them and my period would not end, it continued for 2 weeks.  I asked her for my microgestin RX, but the pharmacy substitued Junel FE, they didn't carry Microgestin.  So, I started that but had her call in an RX for Microgestin to Caremark.  I had breakthrough bleeding after sex for a day, which worried me.  And I'm tired and achy all over.  I've had muscle pain in my groin the whole time I was on the Junel.  I just don't feel good and I think that I'm more stressed than usual.  I've been on the placebo week for a few days, I can't wait for my microgestin to get here from Caremark so I can take that.  I just hope that I don't have to go through an adjustment period all over again, we're going on a cruise soon.  This is crummy.  I'm going to take a couple months of the microgestin and see if things get back to normal.  If not, I'll have to see the doctor.

Reviews:
I love this pill!  My old period lasted at least 7 days, usually much longer.  I tried taking Yaz, but I would get two periods a month or my period would start half way through the month and last until the end (and I'm talking a FULL period).

Junel Fe 1.5/30 has been great. I had a full period last month, non this month but typically I have a very light period of 2-3 days.  No weight gain as far as a can tell (my weight fluctuates between 127-130 and that's been the same), and I have gone up a cup size.  Some moodiness and acne problems towards the end of the non placebo pills, but better than I used to be without.  I only take some of the iron pills, but they help lessen how easily I bruise while on my period.

Reviews: I started birth control because my periods were insanely heavy and never seemed to stop: it felt like I never stopped bleeding and I was anemic and stressed. Junel has been a lifesaver in that regard. Now my periods are regular and 3-4 days long. Thank god. I did gain a bit of weight but not much, and my sex drive is weak but that's okay cause I ain't gettin' any action. Depression? Yeah. Dont think it's caused by Junel though. Acne's not a huge problem. It's sad to see that so many women have been so badly affected by this drug; it's worked pretty well for me. No more waking up in a pool of blood!

Reviews: I have tried Jintelli 3 different times in the last 3 years (about 12 months apart each time).  Each time after about 2 months I experience menstrual cramps and breast tenderness for days.  Previously, I had been on FemHrt for 12 years with no problems. I had switched because my insurance company will only pay for the generic.  I will go back to FemHrt and pay out of pocket.
Sides: Stomach  upset,  nausea / vomiting ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness,  headache , or  weight  changes may occur.

Reviews: Words can't describe how disappointed I am with this birth control. I'm a pretty big skeptic of birth control (I feel like it is going to be our generation's cigarettes in about 20 years when we all have cancer), but I digress. I hadn't been taking anything for a few months, but had extremely heavy periods each month that were almost unbearable. My gyno assured me that Junel Fe was my solution and would reduce my periods down to 2 days a week per month. Looking back that was the funniest joke I've ever heard. I've had the pre-period brown spotting all month now except it is a little heavier than spotting forcing me to wear liners, pads, and tampons ALL MONTH. I've been taking it at the same time every night too so there is really no excuse for it being this crazy. On top of this it has put me in the worst mood ever and has made me feel both physically and emotionally sick almost every day. I got in the WORST fight I have ever been in with my boyfriend over absolutely nothing and if you know me you know that this is not like me at all. I'm depressed, have trouble sleeping because I'm so stressed, and am completely physically and mentally exhausted. Guess I'm just going to to have to deal with heavy periods from now on because trust me when I say Junel Fe is a NIGHTMARE for your body and those that have to deal with you on a daily basis. KEEP YOU, YOUR LOVED ONES, FOOD/DRINKS, AND VALUABLE OBJECTS AS FAR AWAY FROM THIS PILL AS YOU CAN.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I started taking jolessa November of 2016 to regulate my periods since they were all over the place, and at first it was great I had little breast tenderness, a little cramping, little to none spotting and a little bit of mood swings, and I thought wow what a great experience I'm having on jolessa. But now that it's January of 2017 and about 2 weeks away from the sugar pills, I've been bleeding like crazy ! At first it was mild and I put on a pad and I thought it would be like that for a while , but now I've been bleeding for 7 days and I have terrible cramping that's waking me up OUT of my sleep at night, One night I had a crazy large blood clot when I peed and it scared the hell out of me, once that happened I contacted my doctor and she said to keep taking it so I'm gonna give it another week. But if I keep bleeding I'm going to have to stop it's making mad a little depressed. Everybody's different so this may or may not happen to you, by the way I'm 17 and 5"1, started at 16 ( I went in on November 5th and my birthdays that 11th).
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I love my Jolessa! I used to have incredibly heavy, painful, and sometimes very long periods that would drain my energy. I've been on it almost a year and am at the end of my third pack. At the end of my first pack, I did have breakthrough bleeding before the withdrawel pills, but not since then. My period during the withdrawal pills has been much lighter and less exhausting, nothing like how it used to be. The only concern I've had is that I seem to bruise more easily than before, but my doctor does not think it is related. I do sometimes get a bit of cramping if I don't take it on time, but I just see it as another incentive to take it on time. The benefits far outweigh the slight side effects I've experienced. I recommend it to all my women friends.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

After I begun taking Junel I didn't have a period for more than 6 months, I gained 14 pounds, and I couldn't predict my periods. But I had spottings on alternate days. I stopped taking Junel because it caused me to gain unwanted weight and I couldn't predict my period. I'm never using Junel again and I wouldn't recommend Junel to anyone.

Reviews: I began taking Junel after switching from brand name birth control due to insurance prices. I started taking 3 years before due to a heavy and extremely painful menstrual cycle. When I switched into Junel, everything started off fine. By the end of the first month, my moods were insane, I was depressed ALL the time and cried almost every day. The scariest part was I even became borderline suicidal- something I NEVER was before. I also noticed that I would still have a rather heavy menstrual cycle, something I had not had since first starting bc 3 years before. I'm not one to chalk up symptoms to a particular med but once I spoke to my gyno and switched to another brand, everything went away. My depression and mood swings were gone as if they never were there. Needless to say, it was a pretty scary side effect so be cautious!
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Every bc pill effects every person different. Every person has a different body chemistry and will be effected differently by the hormone combinations. You should take a pill for 2-3 cycles before deciding if it's right for you. I personally love Junel. No probs. I skip the placebos so I no longer get my intensely awful unbearable period. I don't get nausea, headaches, breast tenderness, or weight gain. It helped my mild back acne and also reduces the little hairs I get on my chin. The hardest part is remembering to take it around the same time every day but I'm pretty much in a routine.

Reviews:
I've been taking Junel for over a year. This past spring I missed 3 consecutive periods, which is pretty nerve racking. I took pregnancy tests although that option was out of the picture because I took pills regularly and my boyfriend would pull out.  Finally, I saw my doctor. She said this can happen sometimes up to 4 months consecutively on birth control and it is normal. For me, it isn't...getting my period is a sign or regularity. I just started freshman year of college and it seems to be happening again, but now it's more stressful. I do know that periods become irregular with stress and change of routine, which is exactly what college consists of. Also, the healthcare bill recently passed which made my cost of this prescription jump $10 higher. Looking at other reviews makes me think my weird moods may also be caused by Junel, and I
don't like that or the bloating and breast tenderness. I think it's time to switch!

Reviews: I have been on five different birth controls and this is by far the worst. I recently found out I have polycystic ovaries and my gyno prescribed this pill to help correct my very irregular menstrual bleeding. Aside from the breakthrough bleeding, the worst side effect is the severe moodswings. I struggle with depressions as it is. So this pill really wasn't helping anything. I had my period for over a week when I started it, and doc said it would stop it. It didn't. I bled the entire month I was taking it. For others like me, the only pill that has ever worked (and I was only taken off of by my doctor for it being "too strong") was Mononessa. Ask about it. Different bodies need different amounts of "hormone-control". Find a bc that you're hormonally compatible with. From the looks of other reviews, not many people jive well with Balziva. Don't play guinea pig to whatever your doctor tells you. Pay attention to what your body needs, if Balziva or anything else prescribed for you is only doing you wrong, speak up for yourself and get what works for you. Your gyno isn't there every month going through what you are. You're your only advocate in the end.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
My doctor prescribed Ovcon-35 (Balziva is the generic) to treat very heavy, long periods. My periods were lasting 10-12 days and I was bleeding through a tampon ever 2-3 hours. Balziva did cause me to stop having periods altogether which was a relief.

HOWEVER, within just a few months of taking it, I'd gained 15 pounds. I was an emotional wreck. I'd cry when I got stuck in traffic and was late to work. I'd cry when my dog peed on the carpet. I'd cry when the chicken came out too dry. I even cried when the employee at my bank told me I needed one extra document to change the name on my debit card after I got married. And to top it off I was ALWAYS  tired and my sex drive totally plummeted.

Finally, after about two years of taking it, I started to have occasional, sharp chest pains and really weird, unusual headaches at the base of the back of my head. They were causing me to be light headed and dizzy. During a routine checkup, my blood pressure was a little high (130/85) for someone my age (25), who works out 6 times every week. Over the next two months it began to rise until it was at 155/100 and my doctor took me off Balziva because she was worried the high dose of estrogen was going to cause a stroke. 

Its been 2 months and my blood pressure has come down considerably but I still haven't started a period. I don't know what's going to happen when my husband and I try to get pregnant. 

I absolutely do not recommend this drug to anyone.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: I started taking Balziva because my periods were crazy. They would come every other week and last for three days. So far, they really haven't improved much. I haven't had any side effects, which is GREAT. I just don't think that the hormone dose is strong enough for me personally to hold off my periods. I have only been on it for a few months, but my periods come early, usually at the beginning of the 3rd week of the pack and I will bleed (sometimes heavily) all the way through the sugar pills and have a 2 week long period. I just want to find something that works. I think Balziva is worth a shot. It doesn't personally work for me, but that doesn't mean it won't work for someone else.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews: Switched from generic loestrin due to moodiness. It got rid of the moodiness/pms but wasn't worth it. It made my previously nonexistent acne horrible and painful. I mean I had acne everywhere- and I've never had bad acne before including in my teens.  And it messed up my eyes so that wearing contacts was almost impossible.  The acne thing got a little better eventually, but still worse than normal. I didn't have any spotting until the first week before the 'period' pills. Then it was a week of spotting and a week of moderate period. Heavier than my other BC's I've tried, but lighter than mine without BC. Cramps weren't horrible. It did last a full week which is annoying. Not sure if the lethargy this month has been from this or something else. Some stubborn weight gain- but that's all BC for me. Not horrible breast tenderness.  No pregnancy so there's that. But since that isn't really why I'm on it, I'm switching back to a different version of the generic loestrin. I tried this for the full 3 months but it just wasn't working for me. I think there were just too many hormones.

Reviews:
I have been taking Dasetta for 4 months now. I tried to stop taking it last month, my dr would not change it however. I take it for abnormal menstrual cycles. (I had been on my period for over a year without breaks lasting shorter than a 24 hour time frame.) 

Doubling up the pills helped me to stop in the beginning, but once I started to take them normally the period came back just as heavy and often as before. I knew it took a couple of months for it to become "effective" so I waited 3 months before calling my dr. I was adivsed to give it another month and suffered through yet another month of heavy bleeding. 

Finally, I was able to get them to switch me to a new medication just yesterday. 

After reading these reviews, there were other side effects. In my opinion more severe side effects. I have always had episodes of depression, but normally they would be short and easily manageable. The entire time I was on this medicine I slumped deeper and deeper into a severe depression. I couldn't explain it and didn't even realize it until it was too late. Please if you are having any type of mood swings or depressive feelings stop taking the medication immediatley and ask your dr for a different form. 

I also, have suffered from daily headaches and the inability to sleep through an entire night. I often wake up at 3am and can not go back to sleep. 

I was not at all happy with this drug. I suffered from multiple side effects with no actual results from the drug. 

I definitely suggest a different type of birth control no matter the reason you are taking it.
Sides: Nausea ,  vomiting ,  headache ,  bloating ,  breast  tenderness, swelling of the  ankles /feet (fluid retention), or  weight  change may occur.

Reviews:
I think it's fine.
I kept breaking through all the other stupid birth control pills, this one finally set me on the right track.
Yes, I still get cramps and some heat flashes around my period, but I think that's totally fine compared to what used to happen to me.
I used to have periods every 3 weeks, and they lasted from 7-10 days. It SUCKED. And I had major mood swings, heat flashes, cramps, and everything else.

This is the one oral contraceptive that has worked best for me.

Reviews: I started taking this birth control because I was getting my period twice a month for the last 2-3 years which was abnormal for me.  So my doctor at first gave me Loestrin but that made me crazy.  Then I was put on Seasonique Lo, the generic version is Camerise Lo.  The first month was great! But then I got my period in the second month but it didn't last too long, my body was trying to adjust to the new medication.  So the period went away after like 6 or 7 days but now all I have is brown spotting which I hope will go away.  I am almost done with the second pack.  But I can say it did wonders with my skin and I have even lost a couple of pounds with this medicine and it also altered my mood.  When I wasn't taking this I felt like I was constantly pmsing and crazy cause of getting my period twice a month.  over all I love this pill, just waiting it out to see if the brown spotting will go away. That's the only downside right now.

Reviews: I am on my first pack of Camrese. I have never been sexually active but always had heavy periods and am unable to use tampons, so my Dr. suggested using it so that i would have lighter and less frequent periods. I started on the Sunday of my period and it ended on that Wednesday. I was fine until the middle of week 4 and I started spotting. I know that is normal so I said ok maybe this will go away in time. Well, I am now on week 10 and still spotting. I take the pill every time each night, I am going insane. It is doing the exact opposite of the reason I started taking it. I have 3 weeks to go including the low dose at the end of the pack. I saw a diff Dr. and he told me to finish the pack normally and start a new one. Honestly, I do not see the bleeding ever stopping, it went from only seeing it when I wiped for two days, to filling a panty liner, to having to use regular pads. I'm not sure if this med just isn't strong enough for me or what but I will be so happy if I ever stop bleeding. 43 days is waay too long I'd say. so far, I absolutely hate this med...

I would either feel annoyed and mad at anyone or I cried in the middle of the day for NO reason. It made me feel extremely anxious where I just wanted to sleep so I wouldn't have to feel that way. Also, made me lose my appetite.  This is the second time trying a "pill" form of BC and last time unless someone knows of a pill that doesn't have bad mood side effects as this one then until then I will give bc another try. It gave me acne and I usually have clear skin. Save yourself the trouble girls, I don't recommend chateal to anyone.
